column17: Employees who barricaded the road to the SUCOMA sugarbush grounds cut the power supply to the grounds and forced employees to stop working and join their strike.
Striking employees of SUCOMA again turned off power to the sugarbush and forced employees to stop working.
2 people who allegedly stole livestock were attacked with knives and then burned alive by an angry mob. Some other alleged thieves escaped.

A group of 20 Dahalo raided a village, stealing some cattle. A combined force of villagers and police then pursued the Dahalo, forcing them to take refuge in a cave. Reinforcements were called in and an assault is planned on the cave. At least 4 Dahalo and 1 villager were killed and 3 others were seriously injured. These events took place over the course of two days.

A group of 20 Dahalo raided a village, stealing some cattle. A combined force of villagers and police then pursued the Dahalo, forcing them to take refuge in a cave. Reinforcements were called in and an assault is planned on the cave. At least 4 Dahalo and 1 villager were killed and 3 others were seriously injured. These events took place over the course of two days.

Bandits raided the town, killing the head of a large family, seriously injured his daughter, looted their house and shot at another youth who they ran into as they escaped. An older woman died from a heart attack during the attack.

7 Dahalo and 1 villager were killed after police confronted Dahalo they were chasing who had hide in a cave. The police used heavy weapons and grenades to flush the Dahalo out. All 250 cattle stolen earlier by the Dahalo were recovered.
Agreement: The surrender of 1400 Dahalo was negotiated in Betroka district.
The KMFB association held a demonstration to demand the release of former President Ravalomanana. The protesters were dispersed with tear gas.

column9: Unidentified Communal Militia (Madagascar); Police Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: 2 police officers and 2 villagers were killed in an ambush by Dahalo on a mixed force of military, police and villagers. Security forces in the same are shot 3 others trying to steal oxen. It is not clear whether these incidents were related.
Students protested late scholarship payments and threw stones at police, injuring one. Police intervened and arrested one.
Striking SUCOMA employees attacked those attempting to continue working with stones and also damaged vehicles and property. 2 Chinese workers and a Malagasy woman were injured.
An ""Indo-Pakistani"" was kidnapped from his store by men who spoke in Malagasy.

Angry that their carts had been impounded and their fellow carters had been arrested, street traders rioted, trapping police in their barracks until reinforcements arrived, at which point they fought back and dispersed them. At least 1 carter was seriously beaten.
2 young men believed to be cattle thieves were tortured to death by a mob wielding knives trying to determine the identity of an alleged third thief. Another was lynched at a nearby market.
An alleged burglar was captured and beaten to death by an angry mob. Before being killed he injured three people, one seriously.
Agreement: 232 armed Dahalo surrendered their guns to the members of the GICD (Intervention Against Dahalo Group, an elite gendarme group) in the Iabohazo area.

Rioters attacked the HQ of the National Company of Electricity and Water (JIRAMA) in Fenerive-Est due to perceived excessive load shedding. They stole money and damaged property, including equipment and vehicles. Members of the security forces arrived and dispersed the rioters who threw stones. 3 people were arrested.
Members of the ""Wake Up Madagascar"" association protested power outages. A large number of police were deployed to keep the peace but no confrontations broke out.

Unidentified individuals attempted to burn down the offices of the Dean of the Faculty of Medicine but the fire was put out before it could become too large. A witness said that the office window had been broken and a molotov cocktail thrown inside.

In response to the abuse of a mentally ill man, residents rioted against the police, throwing stones vandalizing buildings, and setting up roadblocks. Gunfire was also heard. No injuries were reported however.
Students of the Faculty of Medicine demonstrated in solidarity with the the faculty and staff following an attack believed to be arson on the Deans office.

Striking employees proceeded to attack the HQ of the gendarmerie, armed with a variety of weapons including guns and at least one grenade, to attempt to release their fellow workers. Police fired into the air to disperse the crowd of about 100 people, where at least 1 civilian was believed to have been killed. Clashes followed. At least 2 fatalities resulted in total, as well as 11 seriously injured. At least 3 injured were police officers. 1 soldier and 2 police officers were killed in unrelated incidents in the same area (murdered by bandits and a road accident respectively).

Following an attempt to break their leaders out of prison, striking employees of the Sucoma sugar company looted the company and set fire to their buildings. They also attacked and robbed both Malagasy staff of the company and targeted Chinese people in Morondava. Their actions included vandalism, looting and assault in the Bemanonga and Antsakoameloka districts of Morondava.

Villagers from Port-Berge protested outside the penitentiary to demand the release of villagers detained for the killings of suspected thieves earlier in the month. Most of the villagers had been given a provisional release but 5 remained detained.
Residents and students of the area demonstrated for better basic services. Security forces dispersed the demonstrators shortly after they arrived without incident.

The mayor of Betanatanana and his son shot four people at the entrance to the village. Himself and one of his companions was arrested, while his son escaped. The incident was motivated by a dispute between the mayor and those killed over influence in the village.

Residents of Toamasina rioted over power cuts. They threw stones and attacked property. The police intervened and fired into the air to disperse the rioters. 1 person was killed and 7 were injured, including 3 members of the security forces. 3 of the wounded civilians were hit by bullets.
Demonstrations against power cuts turned into riots, including vandalism and looting. Police arrested 35 people in connection.
Members of a ""former elite unit"" protested in the capital. The reason for the protest was not clear however, as integraiton of the unit into other bodies was going smoothly.
Squatters have protested against the construction of a tourist village on land they are occupying in Mahajanga.
Residents of Toamasina protested at the University of Barikadimy following a widespread power failure.

Residents of Toamasina burnt tires and blocked streets to protest against power cuts. Police intervened and made arrests. 1 person died, but there was disagreement between residents and the police over whether he was killed by police or natural causes/alcohol poisoning.
An escaped prisoner was lynched to death by villagers.
Employees of a slaughterhouse protested against its closure.

Police arrested a student leader of a strike on campus, alleging that he has ties to criminal organizations. The student was reportedly beaten when he was arrested, and his girlfriend has claimed drugs were planted on him by police who took him without a warrant.
Residents living in Antananarivos ""low districts"" protested at local municipal offices due to rising water.
Two men selling building materials had a dispute that turned violent, leaving one dead. The perpetrator was then attacked and killed by a vigilante mob.
An armed gang ambushed and kidnapped the Consular of South Korea outside of his home. When security guards arrived, the kidnappers disappeared.
Three policemen and a gendarme were killed in clashes with around 100 Dahalo.
Tricycle drivers protested against the seizure of scooters

Movement of forces: The military launched a special operation of 80 soldiers against Dahalo leader ""Revato"", who is suspected of leading a group of 50 Dahalo who killed three gendarmes last week, terrorizing the region for several months.
Taxi drivers protested to demand the release of seized vehicles.

9 people were killed and 24 arrested during a raid into a Dahalo stronghold in the Andriry mountain range near Betroka over the weekend, starting on Feb.21. At least 1 of those killed was a member of the gendarmerie group of the Anosy region.

6 presumed armed bandits were captured by the local population and 3 were publicly executed by the mob in front of the police station. The other 3 fled. Police attempts to intervene were ineffective. Police tried to intervene in vigilante killings but were pushed back by the mob.
A presumed armed bandit was beaten to death by about 30 young people in a vigilante mob.
Police tried to intervene in vigilante killings but were pushed back by the mob.
The remaining 3 presumed armed bandits who fled a vigilante mob on Feb 28th were followed and killed by the vigilantes. Police attempts to intervene were ineffective.
Gendarmes exchange fire with an unidentified group of bandits. After the armed group run out of ammunition, they are lynched by local residents.
5 bandits were lynched by a vigilante mob after committing several crimes. Local security forces were ineffective in stopping either group.
A young man accused of murder and his wife were killed by a mob.
An angry mob had to be dispersed by security forces after blocking the road. They were angry that a local cult had beaten the family member of one of its followers.
Two men with kalachnikovs attacked a gendarmerie station. Return shots were fired, but the men escaped and no injuries were reported.

Followers of a local ""apostle"" clashed with locals who accuse them of abusing members of the sect. They threw stones at one another for thirty minutes and blocked traffic until police eventually arrested the ""apostle"" and four others without resistance.
Local residents protested in front of the regional gendarmerie office to protest against recent arrests in the area. Police cordoned off the area but no conflict was reported.
A young man accused of murder was beaten severely by soldiers, and later died of his injuries.

Angry that a generator was late to be deliverd, a mob blocked National Road 2 using tree trunks until security forces calmed the situation and local leaders agreed to fix the generator while waiting for the new one.
Employees at a Canadian owned nickel mine went on strike after a sick colleague died. They held a sit-in, claiming the company refused to pay for the sick employees evacuation and treatment.
A vigilante mob severely beat two alleged cassava thieves before delivering them to the local police station.

A local neighborhood watchman took two alleged thieves to the gendarmerie station and was severely beaten; it is unclear by whom but many allege the police beat him. He died from his injuries later in the hospital.

Angry that a neighborhood watchman was recently beaten to death, overnight a mob confronted the police and the situation escalated into arson, tear gas, and live ammunition that killed at least four and injured several on both sides.
On 28 March 2015, about 150 men armed with knives and clubs stormed a gendarmerie post to take a murder suspect from their custody. The police turned the suspect over under fear of attack.
A handful of protesters marched in an unauthorized demonstration and their leader, Alain Ramaroson, was arrested.
A suspect was beaten to death by a vigilante crowd who seized him from police custody.
A person described as mentally ill was beaten to death by a vigilante mob who accused him of throwing an infant to the ground, resulting in the babys death.
A vigilante mob lynched a man accused of killing his ex-wife and assaulting another woman.
On or around 6 April 2015, 450 members of armed militias battled groups of dahalo thieves during the week of April 2- 9. Civilians were caught in the crossfire but death toll is unknown.
Members of the Airport Employees union (Adema) engaged in a sit-in in Ivato airport related to concessions in the airport.
A vigilante mob caught 3 cattle rustlers and beat them to death before they could be handed over to the gendarmerie.
A vigilante mob lynched a suspected thief to death and beat his parents to death as well.
A vigilante mob beat a convicted criminal to death after he was released from prison.
Security forces and student strikers clashed in front of City Hall, resulting in at least one death and around 100 arrests.

Three police from the Betafo station were ambushed by dahalo cattle thieves and exchanged fire. Four gendarmes and the local mayor heard the fight and came to be involved. One policeman and the mayor were both injured.
100 people marched to protest recent violence against drivers and passengers that left 13 dead in the Ivato area.
Two presumed thieves were chased and stoned by a viligante mob and later found dead in the Ikopa river. Nothing incriminating was found on their bodies.

26 gendarmes from Toliara ""attacked"" the village of Maromiandra using ammunition and grenades to look for dahalo armed gang members. At least one presumed dahalo was killed and three seriously injured, with about 30 houses burned.
5 armed men assassinated former Senator Roland Badady in his home without stealing anything.

Police smashed the car windows of an opposition lawmaker affiliated with MAPAR and seized money inside. When about 20 opposition lawmakers at the scene tried to stop the search, the police used tear gas to disperse them, causing at least one to require medical attention.

Students protested to demand payments for scholarships and equipment at the Polytechnical High School of Antananarivo. Police intervened and several were injured by stones, tear gas, and rubber bullets. At least one journalist was wounded in the crossfire.
Arrests: Police arrested a deputy of the leader of the TGV party, Andry Rajoelina, and seized political funds. They also partially cut the television station Viva which is affiliated with Rajoelina.
Students armed with stones and bricks clashed with police using tear gas and rubber bullets at the Polytechnical School of Antananarivo.
A few dozen students protested for the resignation of President Rajaonarimampianina outside of a courthouse where he was defending himself against potential impeachment.
A group of Dahalo attacked the Taolagnaro gendarmes using machine guns, killing four along with more than thirty civilians.
A march was held to celebrate the ""global day without tobacco"" to discourage smoking and encourage legislation against tobacco use.
Arrests: Air Madagascar strike leader Rado Rabarilala and five other pilots and a mechanic were arrested for ""economic sabotage."" Rabarilala was released three days later.
Unions protested outside the Anosy courthouse where Air Madagascar strike leader Rado Rabarilala was being detained.

Clashes occurred between students from the Sava region and their classmates from Diana at the University of Antsiranana. They used weapons including swords, axes and sticks, wounding several people and engaging in looting and vandalism.
A woman who allegedly tried to kidnap a child was attacked by an angry mob before being taken away by the police.
Striking employees of the Ministry of State for Presidential Projects and Regional Planning were forced to open their pickets by Emmoreg security members during protesting in front of their offices.

Students from the University of Antananarivo in Ankatso blocked access to the university from the bus stop, leading to scuffles with drivers and the throwing of stones by demonstrators. Police arrived to disperse both groups.
2 policemen allegedly injured an old man in the Betioky-Sud area while questioning him, leading to his death.
2 policemen were attacked by 6 armed members of a village brigade from the Betioky-Sud area after the policemen allegedly caused the death of an old man in their village after injuring him.

Student demonstrators and police clashed at the bus stop of Antananarivo University related to an ongoing strike. For hours students threw stones and security forces fired tear gas, damaging two cars. 4 students were eventually arrested.
30 Dahalo, 1 policeman and 2 members of a village militia were killed during a clash after the Dahalo attempted to seize more than a hundred cattle from their Betaimboraka Imanja village.

column7: SECES: Union of Researching Teachers and Teaching Researchers; Students (Madagascar)
column17: Students blocked the entrance to the University of Barikadimy by burning tires as part of a nationwide strike.

Hooded armed men attacked and damaged the Viva Radio-Television Station, which belongs to ex-President Andryb Rajoeline and has been used by his party to challenge the results of recent municipal elections.
Protesters demonstrated in front of the French Consulate to express discontent with recent events involving Malagasy athletes on Reunion.

On 9 August 2015, Dahalo militia attacked the Ambalamitaona village, stealing livestock. Police and vigilante militias pursued the Dahola and resulting clashes left one dead and several civilians injured.
Under the auspices of a security operation, armed forces killed a man who was ""black listed"" for reportedly cooperating with Dahalo.
One of 12 presumed thieves being pursued by a fokonolona vigilante mob was captured and beaten to death. His body was burned and buried on the spot.

Striking university students were denied permission to hold protests, but protested anyway. They threw stones and police responded with tear gas. One student was injured by police and another was arrested.
JIRAMA employees continued to protest outside headquarters in Ambohijatovo despite security forces attempts to get them to move locations.
Unidentified individuals set fire to a traditional temple next to ancient tombs of royalty near the capital. The site was particularly important to the Merina ethnic group.
Dahalos ambushed military forces who were recently sent to the southern regions in an anti-dahalo operation. 8 soldiers and 15 Dahalo were killed and dozens seriously wounded.
5 Dahalo were killed and one soldier wounded in a battle after Dahalo raided a nearby village the day before.
Soldiers from the Fahalemana operation reportedly took three men suspected of dealing weapons to the dahalo into custody and then killed one by shooting him.

On 31 August 2015, soldiers from the Fahalemana operation reportedly targeted local ""Kalony"" vigilante groups, severely beating two and shooting 13, at least one of whom died. It is unconfirmed whether the other 12 were killed as well.
Student protesters threw stones at police and attempted to set a car on fire. Police responded with tear gas and physical violence, resulting in several injuries.
Student protesters clashed with police.

Police severely beat student protest leader Jean Pierre Randrianamboarina before taking him to jail. The government later opened an investigation, and admitted that some of the officers may have ""crossed the line"".
Students continued to protest, burning tires and clashing with police who used tear gas and other weapons.
Jirama employees who are not participating in the ongoing strike report being assaulted by strikers.
Student protesters threw stones and police used tear gas in continued clashes. Some passers-by were caught in the crossfire.
Merchants protested against a government plan to widen a road which would encroach on their market.
Police used teargas to disperse JIRAMA protesters and prevent them from using the designated protest area.

column16: Midi Madagasikara; AFP; L'Express de Madagascar
column17: At least 18 were killed in clashes when Dahalo attacked a village and military responded as part of the campaign ""Fahalemana"". The dead included gendarme capitan Rafalihery Andriantiana, 3 vigilante ""fokonolona"", and 14 Dahalo.
14 Dahalo were killed and two soldiers wounded in clashes as part of the Fahalemana military operation.
Dahalo shot an army helicopter that was on a reconassaince mission.
One day after sustaining being shot by dahalo, a military helicopter carried out an aerial raid, firing grenades and bullets. Three were killed and 15 homes burned.
150 armed Dahalo attacked a local gendarmerie station, raiding its armory.
After the mayor refused several requests for meetings, port employees protested, blocking the entrance to city hall.

Gendarmes ""took over"" a village in the hopes of retrieving weapons as part of an ultimate to disarm Dahalo militias. Residents fled and the gendarmerie did not find the weapons; they returned to post after four days.
Dahalo ""attacked"" the Antandroka village to steal cattle and were pursued by the military on foot and by helicopter as part of the Fahalemana military operation.

In ongoing strikes by government employees demanding payment of salaries, the mayors staff and town hall staff clashed over an attempt to break a padlock on a government building, leaving one seriously injured.
Arrests: Police arrested city council member Ginah Solofoa, who led recent strikes against the Mayor.
University students who were angry about a power outage rioted in the streets, burning tires and vandalizing street lights and shops. Police tried to deter them by firing warning shots.
A military seargent guarding a mine fought with a civilian and killed him with a knife before fleeing.
Striking government employees clashed with local government supporters, injuring at least one.
Striking government employees clashed with local government supporters, causing a dozen injuries. Gendarmes intervened to stop the fighting.
Protesters demonstrated against the dismissal of the local mayor.
Hundreds of protesters marched and laid wreaths to demand the surrender of the Iles Eparses. Military prevented protesters from entering forbidden sites.
Dahalo attacked the village of Banonoky Mahazoarivo, stealing cattle and battling with local vigilantes, killing at least 4.

300 supporters of the TIM party protested in front of the communal chiefs office. They threatened to barricade the doors of the mayor, demanding the HVM party official quit his office. Police intervened and the protesters left.
On 29 December 2015, in response to Dahalo killing 4 earlier in the week, 400 people from 8 villages formed a vigilante militia and went to Ivahona, battling with Dahola on the outskirts.
A firefight between dahalo and gendarmes left one soldier dead.
100 protesters total between Ambatomena and Ambohijatovo demonstrated to demand the return of the Scattered Islands. Larger number of security forces used tear gas to disperse the small crowds.
100 protesters total between Ambatomena and Ambohijatovo demonstrated to demand the return of the Scattered Islands. Larger number of security forces used tear gas to disperse the small crowds.
In front of City Hall, merchants protested bans on street markets. Police dispersed them and one was assaulted by protesters.
Battle between Dahalo and gendarmes left one gendarme dead.
Unidentified attackers set fire to the JIRAMA regional offices, perhaps using a molotov cocktail.
Firefight between about 60 Dahalo and gendarmes left several injured.
Dahalo hunmen killed 2 people while stealing cattle. At least one victim was decapitated.
Vigilante mob beat to death a man who had just been released from prison.
Striking government employees clashed with supporters of the mayor. Security forces were present but did not intervene.
Dahalo attacked the village of Antanamaro and were repelled by police and villagers. 12 Dahalo killed, 1 civilian killed and 5 injured.

After a new mayor from the HVM party was elected, protesters set fire to the town hall. Police and gendarmes responded and arrested the former mayor and a local Lutheran pastor along with six others for their involvement.
After an illegal merchant was injured while running from authorities, protesters marched to demand the government pay for his treatment.
Villagers and police clash with Dahalo after Dahala shoot and injure a man and then flee with his cattle. Seven are killed in the subsequent clashes
Dahalo shoot and injure a villager and then steal his cattle.
A clash between the police, supported by villagers, and Dahalo results in the capture of three Dahalo.
Rioting students at the University of Andrainjato in Fianarantsoa set up roadblocks, vandalise property and clash with police. The non-payment of grants is the cause of the protest.
On 16 February 2016, two vigilantes and two dahalo killed in clashes. Gendarmes pursued dahalo after.

Unidentified individuals fire on miners protesting against expulsion from a mine. The mine is owned by the presidents son who is accused of ordering the gunmen to fire. One person is missing and has not been confirmed as dead or alive. The gunman is later identified as a non-commissioned military officer.
Medical personnel held a sit-in to protest persistent insecurity.
80 Dahalo attack a village in Bekily. They are repulsed by villagers and mercenaries paid by the people to defend their property. Six are killed in the clashes.
The people of Vohipeno protest against continued blackouts. There are many arrests during the demonstration.
Security forces launched triple attacks on Dahalo, killing 8 near Betroka and 3 near Taolagnaro, and destroying camps near Bekily.
Security forces launched triple attacks on Dahalo, killing 8 near Betroka and 3 near Taolagnaro, and destroying camps near Bekily.
Security forces launched triple attacks on Dahalo, killing 8 near Betroka and 3 near Taolagnaro, and destroying camps near Bekily.
At least twenty dead, including one gendarme, after shootout between security forces and dahalo.
Transporters block traffic to demand better road conditions. Security forces tried to disperse them but were ""overwhelmed"".
Protesters marched against demolishing homes for road construction.
Student protesters set tires on fire and police dispersed them using tear gas.
Supporters of the mayor and striking employees clashed in front of City Hall, injuries reported. Police dispersed the crowd using firehoses.
Students went on strike to protest unpaid scholarships, erecting barricades and setting tires on fire. Police quickly dispersed them.
Air Madagascar employees marched in protest of company management.
100 residents marched in protest of poor electricity and water supply, blocking traffic and burning tires.
About 50 people peacefully protested to demand return of land that was taken by Filatex.
Residents protested against power outages, burning trash and throwing stones. Police intervened with tear gas.
Transporters protested again various regulations.
Residents protested against ongoing power outages.
Residents protested against repeated water and electricity cuts.
Residents protested against the electrical company replacing a transformer. Police stopped protesters from blocking workers.
Despite a national ban on protests, unions marched peacefully.
Protesters barricaded roads and threw stones at police. Eight were arrested.

column7: Police Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019) Prison Guards
column17: Amid strikes by prison employees, 37 inmates escaped in massive break out. At least five re-arrested.
400 protesters marched in silence to draw attention to children recently killed by traffic accidents.
Employees continued their protests outside the HQ of Air Madagascar against the management of the company.
More than 1,000 residents of Antsalova protested in front of the district HQ following the theft of over 900 zebu.
Around 60 Dahalo seized zebu and clashed with police and fokolona, killing one police officer and one civilian. Security forces pursued dahalo.
Security forces tracked Dahalo who recently killed two in the Toliary region and clashed again, resulting in the death of two gendarmes in training, one police, and one soldier.
Students from Mandristara and Mahajanga clashed using stones and molotov cocktails, causing fires, material damage and several injuries. Gendarmes intervened, arresting five.
Barricades and burning tyres reported throughout the capitol in protest against poor governance. Police used tear gas and fired blanks to disperse crowds.
Military forces reportedly assaulted a journalist attempting to cover their search of a politicians home.
100 journalists protested against defamation laws in front of the National Assembly.
Battle between armed military vehicle and dahalo. No injuries reported.
Dahalo attacked a public service vehicle, killing 31 including 10 children. One person survived but is seriously injured.
Teachers protested outside the Ministry of Finance and Budget to contest ""disloyal"" ministry actions.
At least two killed and 80 wounded in grenade attack on stadium during national day celebrations.
Traders protested against their expulsion from a market that the government plans to close.
Around 40 teachers representing all 22 regions of the country held a sit-in outside the Ministry of Finance and Budget. Security forces present but did not act.
Over 100 journalists and supporters protested to delay voting on a new code of communications.

Journalists in protest against the adoption of the Code of media communication. Strong deployment of security forces in Ankorondrano where barricates have been erected for steming what that the authorities claimed as unauthorized protests.
Journalists in protest against the adoption of the Code of media communication. Around 1,30pm, the police broke up the crowd with teargas in the Aalamanga district.
School exam correcters went on strike and protested to demand back payments. Negotiations with the Ministry of Eduction resolved the strike.
Peaceful demonstration against new parking policies by private company Easy Park.
Dozens of journalists held a peaceful sit-in outside the High Constitutional Court to challenge parts of the Communication Code.
Anti-regime protesters gathered and marched despite a very heavy security presence. Police dispersed the crowd with ""disincentives"" rather than force.
Street traders protested in the capital city on Tuesday and Wednesday.
Around 40 Dahalo fighters killed attacked the village of Analamitsivala, 12 km from Mahabo, killing three Fokonolona and taking other three people hostage.

column7: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019); Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019) Gendarmerie
column17: Police pursued the Dahalo who had attacked the village of Analamitsivala, saving the hostages and killing three militants.

The people of Vohilava Mananjary took to the streets at the beginning of the week o protest the exploitation of a mining basin in their region. The mine is managed by a Chinese company, accused of polluting the water.
Street traders protested in the capital city on Tuesday and Wednesday.
Dahalo and military battle leading to the death of an army colonel.
In the region of Soavinandriana Itasy, Dahalo militia exchanged fire with Malagache armed force. One person was injured.
In an act of banditary, an armed group attacked a truck on a road outside Ambositra. 1 person was killed and 2 injured.
Three armed men attacked the home of the mayor of Dabolava in the district of Miandrivazo. One women was killed and four other were wounded.

column7: DFP: Dialogue for the Salvation of the Nation
column17: A peaceful demonstration took place in Soamahamanina as residents and the DFP handed an ultimatum over to authority over the withdrawal of Chinese workers.
Dahalo militia and the police (Gendarme) clashed in Andranombao resulting in 10 death and 1 injury.
One passenger was killed and another shot in the shoulder as police opened fire on a taxi heading towards the capital. The reports as to why the police opened fire are contradictory.
In Soamahamanina, residents who were protesting against the exploitation of a Chinese firm engaged in running battles with security forces. In sum, one woman was injured and a protester arrested.
Three soldiers at a cacao plantation arrested and beat to death a man in Ambanja.
A protest took place in Analakely by traders as they were unhappy over decision taken by government authorities.

column7: ANEFA: National Association of Non-Governmental Teachers
column17: Protesters aligned to the National Association of Non-governmental Teachers (ANEFA) demonstrated outside the headquarters of the Ministry of National Education in Anosy.
Police are reported to have killed 2 armed Dahalo militia men in Keliloha. 1 other bandit was injured.
8 people were injured as police fired at people during a riot in East Fenerive.
In protest action, rioters set the headquarters of Jirama in Farafangana alight. In the ensuing violence, policemen were injured.
Four people were killed by community members in Sambava after suspected bandits attacked a vanilla plant.
Suspected robbers of vanilla were attacked by community members in Mananara Nord. 3 Of of the theives managed to escape but 1 of the thieves was killed by the angry mob.
A bomb was thrown and exploded at the 4 stars hotel in Ivato. 2 people have been injured.
4 people died when Dahalo militia and Military forces clashed in Kiranomena, Tsiroanimandidy.
3 robbers were confronted by a local village community (The Fokonolona) in Amboditavolo in Vatomandry . 1 of the robbers was lynched and died.
4 people were beaten by members the the auto-defense in Antanimora Ambovombe.
4 people were killed as the Gendarme (Madagascar Police) fought a gunbattle with Dahalo milita
Residents of the village of Mampikony went on the rampage and rioted in the village with the intention of lynching 2 criminal suspects. They raid the police station and other governmental buildings.
2 groups of Dahalo militia fought each other resulting in 4 deaths in the region of Betroka.
12 people were killed when Dahalo militia and police force who were hunting them fought a gun battle in the betoka region.
Members of Wake Up Madagascar stage a brief demonstration in Antananarivo during the Francophonie summit.
Military forces, allied with the Fokonolano militia, exchanged gunfire with Dahalo militia resulting in 1 death of a soldier and 7 dahalo members in Mandato.
Bandits killed 2 civilians during a night time cattle raid in the town of Amborompotsy Ambatofinandrahana.
Market sellers held a demonstration in Isotry, Antananarivo.
2 suspected bandits were lynched and killed as an angry crowd descended on a hospital near Morafeno in the Befandriana-North district.
Police and bandits clashed in Andilamena resulting in the death of 2 bandits.
Dahalo militia robber were injured as the gendarme (police) commondeered a medical helicopter and engaged the bandits in the Ivohibe district.
A girl was hit and killed when Dahalo militia attacked in the town of Ambalanangozy Mahabo
A group of bandits attacked the town of Ambatondrazaka and shot anf injured one man.
3 people were killed when Dahalo bandits came face-to-face with regional gendarme (police) in Morondava.
A police station was attacked resulting in the death of a police man as a riotous crowd attacked the town of Namorona.
Three robbers were killed by an angry mob in Bekirobo
A young man was beaten and tortured by military personal in Ankasina. The man survived.
A suspected thief was beaten up by a mob after he styole a tyre in Ambodivona, Antananarivo. He survived the attack.
A traditional fighter was murdered in Mahajanga the day after he fought in traditional combat over a dispute.
A dozen Dahalo members used weapons to stage a robbery at Beadabo Bekily. One person from the village was killed.
After a group of bandits tried to rob some citizens, the gendarme interceted them resulting in one fatality in Ambato Boeny.
2 Dahalo fighters staged an attack on a hotel in the coastal town of Maintirano injuring two security guards.
A band of dahalo militia staged an attack and robbery in Ambato Boeny. Three villagers were injured in the attack.
A crowd blocked the entrance to a road leading out of the town of Vangaindrano. Before blocking the road, the protesters were the victims of tear gas fired by police. Three people were arrested.
A group of students staged a protest in Vontovorona over the supply of electricity.
During an army operation, 5 suspected Dahalo fighters were killed in the area of Belo Sur Tsiribihina.

After the suspected assassination of 3 youths, a crowd of local residents demanded justice and besieged a army barracks in protest in the town of Vangaindrano. They attempted to storm the barracks where the suspects were held but were repelled with tear gas by police. 12 buildings were also destroyed during the riots.
2 suspected robbers, who allegedly stole a kilogram of vanilla were killed by the local Fokonolona in Manakara.

About 2000 people took to the streets in Besalampy and assaulted the police headquarters as they wanted justice for suspected criminals who reportedly killed the head of a family. 2 suspected were killed during the attack.
1 suspected bandit was killed as a group of bandits exchanged fire with the gendarmerie (military) in Ankazobe.

A group of 40 unknown armed individuals launched a surprise attack on the village of Itondy in Miandrivazo district. The villlagers fought back killing four assailants while 4 villagers were wounded. 24 houses were burnt during the conflict.
2 people were allegedly lynched and killed by a mob for stealing vanilla in the town of Mahanora.
Bandits engaged with the Gendarmerie and local Fokonolona in Sakaraha. 12 people were killed in the battle.

The university was the scene of conflict between students and law enforcement in Vontovorona after the electrical supply was cut. Students blocked the road with bricks and burning tyres. They also threw objects at police forces who responded by using tear gas.
A riot took place in Ambatolampy as a crowd took to the streets. Motolov cocktails and burnt tyres were seen being used while police responded with tear gas. 5 rioters were arrested.
After days of no electricity, residents took to the streets in anger. Using bricks and other objects they damaged cars and burnt tyres. The police were present by did not take action.
Students in Vontovorona relaunched protests, However, there was no violence reported despite police being present.
A crowd, led by fokonolona stoned 2 police officers to death in Ambalamanga.
2 brothers suspected of stealing 2 million Ariary were lynched and killed by Fokonolona.
40 armed policemen descended on a village, burned many of houses and arrested around 20 people, including the mayor. 2 people are reported to have died in the attack.
20 dahalo attacked Akerefo and tried to steal 46 zebu. The villagers retaliated and killed 2 dahalo.
Dahalo and Fokonolona members clashed in Andakatanikely after the theft of a Zebu. No injuries were reported.
Armed dahalo raided a village and stole 60 zebu. They were pursued by soldiers and villagers, so opened fire. Fighting escalated. 2 dahalo, 1 soldier, and 2 civilians were killed.
Fokonolona Militia killed a thief after they caught him in the town of Marogoga in Ambohimahasoa.
A Dahalo raid resulted in the injury of 12 people in Analamainty in the district of Fitsinjovana (Andramasina).
A man was shot with a gun by Dahalo raiders who stole a cow in Marovoalavo in Andranomamy (Ambato-Boeny). It is unclear whether the man was killed.
A Dahalo thief, who stole a cow, was captured and killed by Fokonolona militia in the rural commune of Andranopasy.
Students staged a protest over the cutting of electricity took place in Antananarivo. Wheels were burnt during the protest and roads were blocked. In response police used tear gas to disperse
Dahalo and Fokonolona members clashed in Antambohitra, Antsihihy after the theft of a Zebu resulting in the deaths of 2 Dahalo fighters.
4 Dahalo bandits launched a raid on the village of Ampasitapaka in Ambato Boeny, injuring 4 people.
Police and Dahalo militia fought in the village of Laimavo in Ambohimahasoa. 2 people died.
Two teachers were injured when bandits attacked a taxi in Benangana in Anjoma Itsara, Fianarantsoa
One man was seriously injured when heavily armed Dahalo bandits stole cows in the rural commune of Beravina in Morafenobe.
A dozen Dahlo fighters attacked the area of Ankisatra in the rural commune of Ankondromena in Morafenobe. 1 Dahalo was killed in fighting between police and the Dahalo.
5 armed Dahalo attacked the village of Ampamandilika in Marovoay. 1 person was seriously wounded.
A thief was killed in a mob attack after a robbery in Mangalaza Ambatondrazaka.
6 people were injured when an angry crowd went on the rampage in Ambanja after the death of a Khat seller.
Elements of the police and the Fokonolona pursued and fought Dahalo fighters in Ambatovory district in Beroroha.
Violence occurred between Dahalo bandits and the gendarme (police) in Malaimbandy, Mahabo. One police officer was injured in the fighting.
Two thieves were killed in vigilante justice in Mananara kely, Ambodimangabe in the district of Fenerive-Est
Dahalo and Fokonalona Militia fought a battle in Ifanja in Miarinarivo.
Parents of students gathered in protest outside the French high school in Antanananrivo after a armed robbery.
2 vanilla robbers were killed in a mob attack after they were caught in Ampanefena in the district of Vohemar.
A man has been killed in Andoharanomaitso in Isandra by nadits who stole his car.
200 hundred villagers took to the streets and surrounded the headquarter of an electric company (Jirama) in the district of Vohemar.

6 hostages were freed when Dahalo militants and Fokonolona supported by police forces clashed in Ankazoambo, rural commune of Abesisika in the district of Ambatoboeny. One civilian was injured in the exchange.
5 armed Dahalo militants attacked a family in Antanetibe in the district of Moramanga. The father was killed in the attack.
A protest march took place in Antananarivo lead by the President of the Republic of the Sports Palace.
After the conviscation of vanilla in the area of Mahatsara (Fenerive-Est) an angry community attacked the police, injuring one and takeing two others hostage.
Dahalo robbed and shot a motorcyclist in Barika dimy Toamasina.
After the kidnapping of a civilian in Ilafy, the gendarme and bandits exchanged fire. Two were injured.
The daughter of an owner of a large company was kidnapped by bandits (Dahalo) in Ilafy.
Students from the University of Antanananrivo clashed. Students threw rocks while police used tear gas to disperse protesters
A women was killed during a Daalo raid in the area of Alarobia Bemaha in Betafo district.
In a second day of clashes students and police continued clash in Antananarivo.
12 people were killed when military forces launched an attack on Dahalo militant in a stronghold in the areas around the town of Betroka.
In Vontovorona, Antananarivo, students blocked roads in protestw ith burning tires.
An angry crowd attacked a member of the ruling political part (New Forces for Madagascar) in Tsarahonenana accusing him of embezzling money for the district. The man survived.
5 people were killed and 3 injured in violence between Ampitrohara and Ilemby villages. The violence occurred between villagers from Ampitrohara and a neighboring village.
About 100 customs workers gathered at the general directorate of customs in central Antananarivo to demand unpaid allowances for the past three years.
Students again protested in Vontovorona burning tyres and blocking the road.
3 people were killed as bandits attacked a truck in Fanjakana Isandra.
2 people were injured in Ankadimbahoaka (Antananarivo) as three bandits attacked a bus stop.
A protest was held in Ambatondrazaka by students who were protesting corruption.
2 bandits (Dahalo) were killed during a clash with police during an attempte robbery of a restaurant in Ambanidia (Antananarivo.
18 people were arrested in Soanierana Ivongo as a angry crowd clashed with members of a christian groups. 12 people were injured and a temple was set alight.
Students launched a protested in the district of Ampefiloha in Antananarivo. There were no reports of violence
Students continued a protested in the district of Ampefiloha in Antananarivo. Tyres were burnt during the protest.
Elements of the military opened fire of suspected Dahalo fighters in the district of Ihazondrano near Ambatofinandrahana. No casualties were reported.
Students attacked and killed a person on campus in Mahajanga suspected of thievry.
An angry crowd attacked a killed a man accused of raping a girl in the district of Antsiranana II.
Three civilians were killed by 20 Dahalo fighters in Ambonaratsara in the Morafenobe district.
In an attack, 6 Dahalo fighters attacked the town of Ambodimonara, in Andriamena in the district of Tsaratanana. 1 person was injured.
One Dahalo bandit was captured when he was injured in clashes with the military in Ambanitsena
8 armed bandits attacked a night shop in Maibahoaka in Talatamaty. One person was injured.
The Mayor of the town of Ampefy was killed by 6 bandits in execution.
2 people died ina clashes between Dahalo militia and police forces in Betroka.
Following the kidnapping of villagers, Dahalo militia fought will local Fokonolona militia as they were fleeing. In the fighting, one Fokonolona fighter was killed and three Dahalo were killed.
A police officer was killed in clashes with bandits in Malamamaina in Ambositra.
In a instance of vigilante justice, members of a gang were attacked by an angry crowd. One of the members was killed and 2 injured.
Following the kidnapping of villagers and the exchange of fire, police and Dahalo clashed in Mandronarivo resulting in the deaths of two Dahalo.
A dozen armed Dahalo bandits attempted assault the headquarters of police in Ambatofinandrahana. An exchange of fire took place but no casualties were reported.
After the death of two Dahalo fighters, 2 villagers who were taken hostage were executed by Dahalo militia in Mandronarivo.
Seven Dahalo bandits launched thieving attacks in Andraisoro killing one person
9 police officers clashed with Dahalo militia and exchanged fire in Tsararano Maevatanana.
Four bandits launched an attack on Amboanana. Three civilians were injured.
A former minister of communication was killed in Ankadifotsy.
A former minister of public services was attacked and killed in his house in Ivato.
1 police officer was killed and another injured while villagers were wounded in clashes with Dahalo militia in Belo-sur-Mer Morondava.
2 women were taken hostage by 80 Dahalo militia.
A suspected witch doctor was killed by a popular mob in Ambihidahy in Morafeno in Maevatanana.
A young boy was kidnapped by Dalaho militia in Ambalamiadana in Iarintsena.
Residents of Ambohidahy in Antananarivo took to the streets in protest over electrical cuts. The crowd burnt tyres in the streets.
Three people were wounded as clashes took place between Dahalo militia and Fokonolona in Ankerambe in the commune_of_Bemahatazana in_Tsiroanomandidy.
5 Dahalo bandits attacked a lorry in Ampizarantany_Tsiroanomandidy. The driver was wounded in the attack.
Three people were injured as Dahalo militia attacked two taxis on the road in Camp Robin.
2 Dahalo militia were killed in clashes with government police forces in Ankazoabo.
Dahalo militia and gendarme police officers clashed in Ambohitromby. 1 Dahalo was killed and 2 wounded in the clashes.
In Tsaralalana, a former diplomat was killed.
4 Dahalo militia were killed in clashes with the Gendarme police in Tsaramiadana, commune of Marokkarima in Mananjary.
Three armed Dahalo bandits attacked a butchery, wounding one man, in the town of Atsimombohitra in Ampitatafika.
A young man was killed in a vigilante attack in Betomendy in Anahidrano.
50 Dahalo militia executed a hostage and and burnt down 5 houses in Tsinjorano, 10km from Malaimbandy.
A protest was held in Amboaray Alasora against the continual cutting of electricity.
A police truck was attacked by Dahalo militia. One police officer was killed in the attack which occurred in the area of Betroka.
A young man was killed in a mob justice attack by Fokonolona members in Antsampanimahazo, in the rural commune of Antsoantany in the district of Antsirabe II.
Angry villagers killed a suspected pyromance in Sakoamadinika.
A bandit was killed in a clashes with military forces in Lambomay, Ankerana,_Ambohimahasoa.
9 villagers were killed in an attack by Dahalo militia in Ihosy.
Food producers protesters took to the streets in Morondava. Police fired tear gas at the protesters after they blocked a road.
5 people were killed in fighting between Dahalo militia and military forces in Bekapaika Tsaratanana.
Members of the taxi industry in Antananarivo held a demonstration.
6 people were killed in a Dahalo bandit attack in Antanifotsy.
Two leaders of a Dahalo group were killed in clashes with police in Antamponandapa,_Ankadinondry_Sakay.
A gendarme police officer was killed in clashes with Dahalo militia in Tsiroanomandidy.
Students protested in the city of Toamasina. Students reportedly burnt down a building.
One person was injured when Dahalo bandits attacked a house in Ambianindrano_Anosibe_Anala.
2 people were tortured and killed as bandits attacked a shop in Ambohitsimanova,_district_of Antsirabe_II.
In Masomeloka_Mahanoro a mob attacked and killed a man in a vigilante attack.
Students in Toamasina held a protest.
Two people were injured as students clashed with police in ongoing protests in Toamasina. A buliding was burnt down as 9 students were arrested.
Two thieves were captured and beat up by Fokonolona militia in Ambodimanga,_Vohemar. The thieves survived the attack.
Five students were injured as students clashes at a university in Ambondrona during student protests.
A police officer was killed during clashes with Dahalo militia. 12 Dahalo were injured in the area of Betroka.
Two thieves were lynched and killed by community members in Andrevorevo in Analalava.
A police officer and another man was killed just outside Farafangana by Dahalo militia.
A young man was killed in a vigilante attack ciommitted by the Fokonolona in Tsararano Anosikely in Mahajanga.
Taxi drivers staged a protest and blocked roads in Analakey.
Dahalo bandits clashed with gendarme police forces in Antsotra_Maintirano, resulting in the deaths of 2 bandits.
2 bandits were killed when they clashed with police in Ampefy.
3 Dahalo were killed when villagers fought against the thieves in _Angilobe_Maintirano.
A Dahalo fighter was killed in clashes with gendarme police in Itaosy.
20 Dahalo, in an attempted robbery, injured a lady in Ambohibary.
4 people were killed and other injured in Ambotry as villager clashed (Fokonolona) over the theft of livestock.
One person was injured as armed militants attacked a group of houses in_Ankerana,_Arivonimamo._
Dahalo militants attacked a house, killing the person who lived there in Andranomanintsy.
One person was killed in an attack led by Dahalo bandit in Ambatobe in Antananarivo.
3 people died in an attack on a taxi by armed militants in_FanjakanaIsandra.
A suspect was captured and killed by Fokonolona militia in Ambatomipaka,_in_Vavatenina.
Three bandits who were caught and killed by the local community in a case of mob justice in Ambatoriha-Est.
Fokonolona members killed 2 suspected criminals in_Besaboha, Andrevorevo,_Analalava.
4 people were killed by Fokonolona militia in a vigilante attack.
Police arrested 3 Dahalo militia. 2 others were killed in clashes in_Bekilojy,_Analamary.
A student was allegedly assassinated at the university of Andrainjato in Fianarantsoa.
4 people were killed when militants and Police clashed in Belo-Sur-Tsirbihina.
2 alleged militants were killed in clashes with police in Toliara.
Military forces and militants clashed in Vondrozo. 1 soldier and 2 villagers were killed.
One person was killed as Dahalo militia attacked a village in the Maevatanana region.
An angry crowd of villagers have killed 4 suspected robbers in the village of Ambohipeno,_Andranambomaro,_Mahanoro.
A protest took place in Bemasoandro-Itaosy.
Residents of Sakaraha killed a suspected serial killer as his guru.
Fokonlona militia from a village in the area of Andriamena,_Tsaratanana clashes with armed Dahalo militia. 5 people were injured in the clashes
Taxi drivers in Antananarivo held a protest.
""During a night raid, armed bandits attacked a project team of four aid workers that were spending the night at the site. The team was robbed of valuables and one of the team members was raped.""
One person was killed when police and Dahalo members clashed In Befotaka-Ankijabe,_ district of Ambatoboeny.
Violent clashes between the police and 7 armed Dahalo fighters tok place in Maintirano. The leader of the Dahalo group was killed.
2 Dahalo were killed when they clashed with police in Ankianja,_district of Ambatoboeny.
3 people were injured in a break-in in Vohiboangy in_Vavatenina. Dahalo were suspected.
Fokonolona villagers in Manjakazaza,_Ambohitrambo,_Arivonimamo tortured and killed 2 dahalo.
Following the death of a boy, 3 Fokonolona attempted to fight Dahalo militia. They were injured in the attempt.
One boy was killed by 11 Dahalo who entered a the village of Atsatratokana,_Bemavo in Tsaratanana.
A farmer was killed in Ankabokimaty,_Sakena,_Beroroha as seven Dahalo robbed the household.

30 Dahalo, in Antongomavo,_Ambodimanga-Sarobaratra stole 300 Zebu animals. Following this attack, police supported by Fokonolona militia hunted down the Dahalo and clashed with them. 3 Dahalo were injured and 3 were killed.
Armed military forces clashed with 40 Dahalo militia in Ampasimandrotry_Belo_on Tsiribihina. There were no reports of deaths or injuries.
Members of the Gendarme police and Dahalo clashed in Isaka_Ambohimahasoa. Four people were injured in the clash.
7 armed assailants launched an attack in the town of Toliara. One person was killed in the attack.
Armed assailants have kidnapped a mother and her son in Mahabo.
A suspected criminal was lynchd to death by a mob in an unknown location in Madagascar.
A group of militants killed the chief, wife and daughter of a local area in Ambondroala.
A group of student held a demonstration in Mahajanaga. They burnt tyres and and put branches and trees on the road. Police responded by firing tear gas and arresting 2 students.
A man was robbed and executed by Dahalo militants in Ampasimbe commune of Anivorano in Diana.
After Dahalo militants attacked a village, villagers attacked the militants resulting in clashes which led to 1 death and 7 injured.
Around 60 Dahalo militants attacked the centre of the town of Ikalamavony. A teacher was killed in the attack.

On Jan 15th, students of the Faculty of Medicine of Antananarivo staged a violent demonstration in Ankatso demanding two months of unpaid scholarship. The students burned tires in the road; police forces intervened by firing teargas while students threw stones. 1 police officer was injured.

On Jan 15th, students of the Polytechnic School of Vontovorona staged a violent demonstration claiming a refund of 10,000 ariary they paid in surplus at registration at the beginning of the year. The students built a barrier of branches in front of a bridge; police forces intervened by firing teargas while students threw stones.
Fokonolona members killed a suspect in a vigilante attack in the town of Maroantsetra.
Following a mob attack, Fokonolona members killed another suspects in a vigilante attack in the town of Maroantsetra.
4 people were killed in clashes between Dahalo militants and police/gendarme in Farahalana in Ambatofinandrahana.
A French national was killed in an attack by militants in Ambohimiandrisoa in Antsirabe.
Dahalo militants attacked a village of Beribiky-Antsalova. One person was killed.
In Toliara, Dahalo militants attacked the town and killed 2 people.
A suspected criminal has been attacked and killed by a mob in Mananjary.
A group held a protest in Taolagnaro.
Dahalo militants attacked the town of Ambato Boeny, injuring 2 people.
1 February 2018, a Dahalo militant was killed in a vigilante attack in Arivonimamo.
2 people were killed as Dahalo militants fought with members of the army in Kiraonimena and the local Fokonolona.
6 Dahalo attacked the village of Antsampadrano. One person was injured.
2 people were killed as the gendarme clashed with Dahalo militants in Belobaka.
A government official was killed in the commune of Antanetibe-Anativolo, Anjozorobe.
4 Dahalo militants, including a leader, were killed in fighting with the military gendarme and the Fokonolona in the area of Befotaka.
3 Dahalo militants were killed in clashes with the Military Gendarme.
Dahalo militants attacked the village of Bekopaka in Antsalova killing 2 civilians.
1 Dahalo militant was killed in clashes with the gendarme in Andraharo.
Students burnt tyres on a road in protests in Toamasina. 21 students were arrested.
Several people were injured when Dahalo militants attacked the town of Nosy Be.
Women took to the streets as part of International Woman's Day in Anosy.
On 15 March Aok' Zay supporters demonstrated to protest the endemic violence both in towns and countryside.
Over 17-18 March, former and currently military officers protested against expulsion form their lands in Ivato.
Over 17-18 March, former and currently military officers protested against expulsion form their lands in Ivato.
Detonation: On 24 March, a grenade was launched against the HVM party headquarters.
On 25 March, thirty armed ""dahalo"" attempted to seize some cattle in Bedray, Toliary. Herders repulsed the attackers, killing two dahalo and another one was wounded.
On 25 March, sixty armed ""dahalo"" attacked the Analamasina village, Toliary. They seized 28 cattle heads and killed 3 civilians.
On 13 April, a protest took place in Antananarivo by members of Wake Up Madagascar organisation.
On 21 April, demonstrators took to the streets in Antananarivo. Police responded with violence and used tear gas to disperse the protester. At least two killed and several injured.
On 21 April, militants (Dahalo) killed a couple in the town of Maharirana in Antanifotsy.
On 22 April, a second day of protests took place in Antananarivo. Dozens of soldiers were present as opposition protests against new electoral laws.
On 23 April, thousands of Madagascan opposition supporters returned to the streets of the capital to protest against the president and a deadly crackdown by security forces on demonstrations
On 24 April, in ongoing protests, hundreds of opposition activists in Madagascar's capital called for the president to step down.
On 25 April, police killed a militant in Ankorahotra, Antananarivo.
On 28 April, more than 1,000 opposition activists rallied in Antananarivo demanding the resignation of the president.
On 1 May, 2 Gendarme police officers were executed by Dahalo militants in Beraketa.
On May 2nd, elected representatives performed a peaceful sit-in at the High Constitutional Court demanding the control of constitutionality of electoral texts.
On 3 May, protesters gathered outside the Constitutional Court in Antananarivo as part of the ongoing political crisis.
On 5 May, Dahalo militants attacked the town of Anjoaorobe. 2 people died in the attack.
On 7 May, protesters took to the street in ongoing protests in the Antananarivo over the political crisis in the country
On 16 May, students and protesters who have been protesting over the last few weeks clashed in Ankatso, Antananarivo. Molotov cocktails were thrown at vehicles in the violence.
On 20 May, 4 Dahalo militia were killed and one police officer was injured in clashes in Bekily.
On 30 May, a violent battle took place in Ambatofinandrahana as Dahalo militants clashed with police. 15 militia were killed in the violence.

column7: SSM: Madagascan Solidarity Union; Labour Group (Madagascar)
column17: On May 30th, members of the Solidarite Syndicale de Madagascar (SSM) held a peaceful demonstration in Mahamasina demanding an improvement of worker's conditions.
On 2 June, in a battle between Dahalo and police, with the support of the Fokononola, 1 person was killed in Miandrivazo.
On 4 June, Dahalo attacked a village in Sakalalina. One person was killed while police gave chase and killed two militants.
On 4 June, Dahalo attacked a village in Sakalalina. One person was killed while police gave chase and killed two militants.
On 10 June, Dahalo militia killed a hostage in Ankondromena-Miandrivazo.
On 10 June, following the death of a hostage, 2 Dahalo militia were killed by Gendarme in Ankondromena-Miandrivazo.
On 12 June, teachers protested in Ambatondrazaka over employee issues.
On 12 June, Fokonolona militia killed a suspected bandit in Amboditavolo.
On 13 June, students protested in Antananarivo. They burnt tyres during the protest.
On June 14th, students of the University of Ankatso staged a violent demonstration against the regime. 15 people were arrested but soon after released. No fatalities have been reported.
On 17 June, after Dahablo militants attack a village in Alarobia Bemeha, state force pursued them and they clashed. One militant was wounded.
On 3 July, students took to the streets in Ankatso and burnt tyres in protests.
On 4 July, teachers protested in Anosy. They were angry over the the appointmen of the new education minister.
On 5 July, teachers who were protesting in Ampefiloha were the target of tear gas by police forces.
On 5 July, teachers and police clashed in Anosy. Police used tear gas in the clashes in an attempt to disperse the protesters.
On 6 July, workers of the Solidarite Syndicale de Madagascar took to the streets in Antananarivo to protest working conditions and wages.
On 8 July, Dahalo militants attacked houses in Antananarivo injuring 2 people in the attack and stealing computers and jewellry.
On 9 July, Dahalo militants attacked the village of Ihazofotsy. During the attack, the militants clashed with police and Fokonola fighters resulting in the death of 3 militants.
On 11 July, students protested at Unversity in Vontovorona. They burnt tyres and destroyed private property. In response, police fired tear gas at the students and arrested 3 students.
On 16 July, 2 people were killed and three injured in Betafo as angry people clashed with police. Property was damaged in the violence.
On 22 July, in Tsaratanana, Dahalo militants kidnapped 6 government employees.
On Jul 26th, in Toamasina, city center shopkeepers staged a violent demonstration against the marked of Anchirihiry. Tear gas was used by the police to disperse the crowd.

On Jul 30th, students from the Ecole Normale Superieur staged a violent demonstration over the reclassification of students with the degree of Licence and Master. The students burned tires in the roads. Members of Emmoreg police squad intervened firing tear gas to disperse the crowd and beating up students who resisted their intervention. Four students and one policeman were injured.
On 1 August, dahalo militants attacked the Bemaraha National Park, injuring one person.
On 5 August, a suspected thief was lynched in a mob attack in Antsohihy.
On 12 August, following an attack on Ambararata village, 12 people were killed when dahalo and local Fokonolona militia from that village and other villages exchanged fire.
On 12 August, 2 people were killed when Dahalo attacked the village of Ambararata in Anosy.
On 16 August, a man was killed by a mob in Mampikony district.
On 26 August, Dahalo attacked Manjakandriana, leaving one villager killed, others injured.
On 4 September, close to 24 Dahalo militants attacked the town of Ambatofinandrahana resulting in the death of one person.
On Sept 13th, gendarms from Fianarantsoa clashed with the Dahalo in Isorana while the latter was stealing cattle in the area. Some of the Dahalo were shot; the number of fatalities is not clear.

column9: Civilians (United States); Government of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 22 September, an American diplomat was assassinated in a suburb of Antananarivo by unknown assailants.
On 16 October, students demonstrated in Vontovorona. They blocked roads with rubble and police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.
On 20 October, 3 Dahalo assailants were killed in a clash between Dahalo fighters and gendarmerie in Amboasary-Sud.
On 24 October, three policemen were killed when they entered a village searching for stolen goods. They were beaten to death with sticks by an angry mob in Fenerive-Est area.
On 27 October, unidentified assailants shot and killed a woman in a vehicle near the village of Befotoana, fokontany of Marosakoa, Ambato Boeny. Source mentions Dahalo but identity unclear.
On 29 October, protesters blocked a road in Antsenakely over an eviction order. The road was blocked with various objects.
On 30 October, a Dahalo attack took place in the district of Ambohimahasoa, resulting in the injury of a police gendarme and the death of another.
On 3 November, Dahalo fighters attacked the town of Maintirano resulting in the injury of a gendarme policeman.
On 6 November (date not certain), protesters took to the streets near the palace in Antananarivo.
On 21 November (date not certain), two criminals that were terrorizing the village of Ambohimasina in Betafo were killed by a mob who rose up to counter them.
On 22 November (date not specific), a group of individuals protested in Ambohidahy to try get the 7 November election annuled.
On 24 November, a murder suspect was killed in a mob attack by an angry crowd in Madirokely, Tsararano, Marovoay.
On 26 November, four suspected criminals were beaten up in a mob attack in Toamasina resulting in the death of one of them.
On 27 November, a couple was lynched in a mob attack in Mevaloha, Andohajango, Mandritsara.
On 6 December, three members of the gendarmerie were killed by dahalo militants in the village of Antanamirafy, in the commune of Maromby, Amboasary Sud.

On 11 December, members of the Jama (security forces) organised to pursue Dahalo militants after they raided the village of Ambala-velona, close to Mampikony, leading to a clash that left four Jama killed. The clash occurred in Analabe, 15km from Mampikony.

On 11 December, Dahalo militants raided the village of Ambala-velona, close to Mampikony, firing shots in the air to initimidate local populations and looting cattle. A Jama force organised to pursue them later leading to a clash (coded separately).
12 December. Two Malagasy gendarmes are killed in Maintirano by dahalo militia during a national statistics survey.
December 14. About 20 unidentified armed ""bandits"" kill 4 civilians, injure 12 and set the village on fire. Two were arrested shortly afterwards by the police.
December 15. Woman assaulted at the Mahamasina stadium in Antananarivo after a TIM rally by TGV supporters.
December 16. A soldier in training at the national school of active officer training (ENSOA) in Antsirabe was killed by an unidentified armed group.
December 17. A soldier is stabbed and killed by an unidentified group in Anatihazo Isotry after a violent dispute.

December 18. Armed dahalo bandits raid three polling stations and steal documents in different areas of Komajia including Ankisomby, Ambatomainty and Antsiradrano in the late evening hours. Around 80 voters registered with these polling stations were not able to vote.
December 19. Armed dahalo bandits kill two brothers who worked at a local polling station in the Betilefo forest just south of Ankazoabo.
December 20. An unidentified armed group throws a Molotov cocktail at a polling station in Itaosy, missing the crowds and not injuring anyone.
December 20. Reports of voter intimidation by unidentified group in Sava region during presidential elections.
December 21. A retired army colonel is attacked by four unidentified armed militants in his home in Mahajija of Analamahitsy.
December 22 (on or around). Military forces clash with an unidentified armed group in Begogo, Maevatanana, allowing for the release of two hostages.
December 23. Dahalo and Fokonolona militia clash at Marombe in Beravina commune leaving four dead and three injured.
December 23. Dahalo and local vigilante group members clash in Malaimbandy in Mahabo over the dahalo theft of cattle, three dahalo and one vigilante killed, with another injured.
December 26. Dahalo militia attack the Begogogo community of Tsararano, killing a city official and stealing cattle.
December 29. Thousands of Marc Ravalomanana supporters ""illegally"" protest the election result in May 13 Square in central Antananarivo on Saturday against the victory of Andry Rajoelina.
31 December. A notorious bandit in custody tries to escape Malagasy genarmerie and is shot dead in Tsaratanana.
01 January. A woman who was kidnapped by an unidentified armed group was found dead in a train station near Antsirabe.Police have caught the suspect involved.
02 January. A woman is found dead in her home after being burned by an unidentified armed group in Mahitsy.

02 January. Supporters of Ravalomanana gathered in Antananarivo at the 13th of May Square to demonstrate against electoral fraud, but were quickly dispersed by police with tear gas. Some burned tires or constructed road blocks and three injuries were reported.
03 January. A trainee gendarme is killed in a clash with dahalo militia group in Bevoay of Betioky Atsimo after daholo stole 70 cattle.

03 January. Supporters of Ravalomanana gathered in Antananarivo at the 13th of May Square to demonstrate against electoral fraud. One woman was reported to have been attacked for wearing a Rajoelina shirt and taken to an unknown destination.

05 January. Hundreds of supporters of Ravalomanana gathered in Antananarivo at City Hall to demonstrate against electoral fraud, some throwing Malatov cocktails at police while being dispersed by police with tear gas.
05 January. Unidentified armed group kill three police officers outside a home in Toamasina.
06 January. Fokonolona communal militia and dahalo clash outside Ampisaraha of Mampikony district over zebu theft.
06 January. A police officer is shot and killed while riding his motorcycle in Toamasina by an unidentified armed group.
06 January. Riots break out in Antsirabe, with reports of arson and property destruction, following the murder of a woman on the 1st of January. Police intervene with tear gas and firing rounds.
06 January. Protests continue by supporters of Ravalomanana in Antananarivo at the 13th of May Square to demonstrate against electoral fraud.
Weekend of 05-06 January. Dahalo kill four local villagers and steal cattle in Malaimbandy.
07 January. Fokonolona communal militia and local gendarme clash with dahalo in Malakialina over the zebu theft the day before in Ampisaraha, killing 4 dahalo.

07 January. A convoy of cars of the Ministry of Public Security is assaulted by Dahalo militia in Ankazobe district on the RN4 road. Local gendarme defended the vehicle, but dahalo stole some of the contents of the vehicle.

09 January. An unidentified armed group outside of Mahajanga on RN4 road block the road and assault civilians aboard two buses. The second bus had police on board, who chase off the armed group. No injuries reported and the attackers escaped.
09 January. Three dahalo are captured following a clash between fokonolona communal militia and dahalo on the outskirts of Maevatanana over reports of stolen cattle.
10 January. Dahalo clash with Fokonolona communal militia and Malagasy gendarme in Mahazoarivo of Atsimo Atsinanana killing one gendarme soldier.
10 January. Dahalo and Malagasy gendarme clash in Talata-Vohimena of Amoron I Mania, resulting in gendarme forces seizing weapons and killing 4 dahalo.
11 January. A local pastor is shot by an unidentified armed group in Antohomadinika of Itasy.
12 January. Dahalo, armed with rifles, looted 50 cattle heads in Ambalavao village in the Ambohimanarina Marovazaha commune.
13 January. Dahalo and police clash in Andranomisa of Anjozorobe after stealing some cattle, injuring and arresting some dahalo.

14 January. 4 people from an unidentified armed group abducts the Australian honourary consul along with his daughter and driver in Antsiranana, Diana. The daughter and driver were released the same day; the consul was rescued by police on the 19th
14 January. Police and unidentified gunmen in military clothes clash in Ankasinaof Antananarivo, killing at least one of the combatants and injuring another severely.
15 January. A police office clash with an armed robber in Antsirabe, wounding a police officer and killing one of person the armed group.
January (month of). Two gendarmerie and a police officer accused of torturing and abusing people arrested at in Bemarivo gendarmerie of Ambato Boeni. A girl was also raped.

15 January. Dahalo steal cattle and abduct civilians from Dabozato of Miandrivazo, leading to a clash with Fokonolona Communal militia members before they escape. Two militia and two hostages were killed in the clash.
17 January. Dahalo shot dead a man in Tsiroanomandidy and stole his money.

18 January. Around 60 people protest in front of the Mandritsara hospital in Sofia after the suspected murderer of a community member is held under medical observation. Police forces intervene as several protesters were shouting death threats.
Week of January 23. Dahalo militia abducts a nurse in Tsaratana, released on January 29th after a ransom was paid.

24 January. A joint operation between Malagasy police and military forces leads to the death of 1 Dahalo and arrest of 2 others following the earlier killing of a businessman by dahalo (coded separately).
24 January. Dahalo abducted and killed of a businessman along with cattle in Ambohimahasoa of Vondrozo. A clash ensued later on (coded separately).
25 January. Dahalo clash with police and Fokonolona Communal Militia in Andohajango of Mandritsara district, killing a police chief, a Fokonolona militia member and two dahalo.
25 January. Dahalo clash with gendarme military forces in Betroka of Anosy, leaving 8 Dahalo dead.
26 January. Dahalo loot Anjiajia of Boeny, stealing goods from local civilians.

27 January. Malagasy gendarmerie and Fokonolona militia clash with an unidentified armed group attempting to abduct a woman from her home in Tsaratanana, killing the leader of the group, called Goeta, seizing his gun and allowing the woman to go free.
27 January. Fokonolona Communal Militia and Dahalo clash in Ambalamandray of Isandra, killing 2 Fokonolona and 1 dahalo.
28 January. Dahalo attack civilians in Ambodiriana of Antanifotsy, with several injuries reported.
28 January. Dahalo attack civilians in Mangabe of Arivonimamo, with several injuries reported.
28 January. Dahalo attack civilians in Antsahakely of Analamanga, with several injuries reported.

29 January. An unidentified armed group and police clash in Behoririka of Antananarivo Renivohitra following assaults on Chinese citizens. One from the unidentified armed group was arrested following the clash.
30 January. Malagasy gendarmerie arrests 14 dahalo in Mahajanga, retrieving several weapons as well.
31 January. Malagasy gendarmerie and Dahalo clash in Betroka of Anosy following an attempted robbery by dahalo gunmen, killing 8 dahalo and injuring 3 security forces.
31 January. Civilians in Vangaindrano of Atsimo Atsinanana protest over lack of electricity in the city and poor nutrition.

31 January. Gendarmerie shoot and killed a kidnapper in Analamanga. He was part of an unidentified armed group involved in alleged kidnapping and robbery. 2 accomplices involved in the kidnapping escape.
01 February. Dahalo attack and kidnap civilians in the village of Ankijabe in Vohemar, injuring several Malagasy and Indian residents and stealing money.
02 February. Dahalo militia and police forces clash in Antsirabe at a cattle market, killing one police officer, wounding others and ""many"" dahalo killed. ""Many"" coded as 3.
03 February. Dahalo militia and Malagasy military forces clash in the forest of Analafantsika in Atsimo Andrefana. A woman kidnapped two days prior in Ankijabe was freed.
05 February. 40 Dahalo attack civilians in Mahazoarivo, shooting civilians and stealing livestock. One civilian was reported with a serious gunshot wound.
05 February. Ten Dahalo militia kidnap two women from Andranomisa, demanding a ransom from the family.
07 February. Around 20 armed Dahalo kidnap 4 people, raping three of the women, including a civil servant in Tsaratanana of Vangaindrano.
07 February. Malagasy gendarme confiscate tons of explosives and detonators from a cargo truck in Antsirabe, which may be linked to a private company.
09 February. A Catholic priest is killed in Mahitsy of Ambohidratrimo by riot police.
11 February. A citizen accused of gang activity and crime is caught and killed in Maroantsetra of Analanjirofo as a part of ""public justice"" by Fokonolona communal militia members.
12 February. Dahalo clash with a gendarmerie in Tsaratanana during an attack from Dahalo on gold miners. 1 soldier killed during the fighting.
Week of 13 February. Unidentified armed group kidnap and rape a woman in Ambohimangakely of Antananarivo Avaradrano. Three other people were kidnapped and murdered.
15 February. Protesters demonstrate in Mahitsy of Ambohidratrimo over the death of a Catholic priest killed by riot police on February 9th. Gendarme intervened and dispersed protesters.
17 February. An unidentified armed group kill the district councilor in Sakaraha of Atsimo Andrefana.

Week of 20 February. Dahalo attack civilians on four occasions within a week in Ambatondrazaka of Alaotra Mangoro. 2 deaths reported along with property stolen. Coded as four events with fatalities spread across the events.
18 February. Dahalo militia kidnap 8 civilians and steal cattle in Tsaroanala village of Manja. Fokonolona members follow and find the hostages released outside the city.
19 February. Dahalo militia set fire to Antanambao village in Bekapaika commune.

Week of 20 February. Dahalo attack civilians on four occasions within a week in Ambatondrazaka of Alaotra Mangoro. 2 deaths reported along with property stolen. Coded as four events with fatalities spread across the events.

Week of 20 February. Dahalo attack civilians on four occasions within a week in Ambatondrazaka of Alaotra Mangoro. 2 deaths reported along with property stolen. Coded as four events with fatalities spread across the events.
20 February. Dahalo fire weapons upon the city of Ambonarabe of Morafenobe and steal cattle from civilians.
22 February. Dahalo and Malagasy gendarmerie clash in Andreamalama of Ivohibe, leaving 4 dead and 5 wounded. Some dahalo are arrested while others escape.

Week of 20 February. Dahalo attack civilians on four occasions within a week in Ambatondrazaka of Alaotra Mangoro. 2 deaths reported along with property stolen. Coded as four events with fatalities spread across the events.
22 February. Dahalo militia attack a teacher at his home in Mahabo of Menabe and kidnap his son.

25-28 February. Students of Antananarivo University Polytechnic School riot over poor living conditions by blocking RN1, burning tires and making stone blockades outside of the university gate in Vontovorona area of Antananarivo. Gendarmerie fire tear gas, with reports of security forces using rubber bullets and arresting students with some injuries reported to journalists and students. [size=no report]
