25 February. Dahalo and Malagasy gendarmerie clash in Ambalakindresy market of Ambohimahasoa after a dozen Dahalo attempt to rob the market. One dahalo is killed in the clash and others escape.

column16: L'Express de Madagascar; Midi Madagasikara; News Mada
column17: 25-28 February. Students of Antananarivo University Polytechnic School riot over poor living conditions by blocking RN1, burning tires and making stone blockades outside of the university gate in Vontovorona area of Antananarivo. Gendarmerie fire tear gas, with reports of security forces using rubber bullets and arresting students with some injuries reported to journalists and students. [size=no report]

25-28 February. Students of Antananarivo University Polytechnic School riot over poor living conditions by blocking RN1, burning tires and making stone blockades outside of the university gate in Vontovorona area of Antananarivo. Gendarmerie fire tear gas, with reports of security forces using rubber bullets and arresting students with some injuries reported to journalists and students. [size=no report]

25-28 February. Students of Antananarivo University Polytechnic School riot over poor living conditions by blocking RN1, burning tires and making stone blockades outside of the university gate in Vontovorona area of Antananarivo. Gendarmerie fire tear gas, with reports of security forces using rubber bullets and arresting students with some injuries reported to journalists and students. [size=no report]
28 February. Dahalo militia and gendarmerie clash near Andranovoloina of Fenoarivobe following an attack on the village. Several dahalo were wounded and the cattle recovered.
28 February (or before). Dahalo militia armed with guns and knives attack Andranovoloina of Fenoarivobe, burning 12 homes and stealing cattle.
03 March. Dahalo kidnap four people in Maevatanana of Betsiboka, with 2 of the kidnapped killed and the others missing.
04 March. Dahalo kidnap two people from Ampanasandamba in Tsaratanana and threaten other villagers.

05 March. An unidentified armed group breaks into the home of Nofy Lalaina Haingoharijaona, a candidate in the next legislative elections. Security forces intervened before the armed group were able to break the door down to the bedroom and no items were stolen, but likely an attempted intimidation or kidnapping.
05 March. Dahalo steal thousands of cattle from civilians in Ankerika area of Sofia.
06 March. Dahalo attack the home of a pastor in Manja of Menabe, firing guns after breaking inside and stealing property. No deaths reported.
08 March. A group of armed dahalo attack Betroka village in Anosy, killing 3 people, raiding shops and stealing zebus.
09 March. Dahalo clash with Fokonolona communal militia members in the Antanambao area of Tsarano community in Maevatanana, killing two dahalo and a civilian.
09 March. Gendarmerie forces and Fokonolona clash with dahalo following an attack and theft in Betroka of Anosy, killing one dahalo and recovering stolen cattle.
10 March. An independent candidate for parliament was kidnapped and killed by 3 MAPAR supporters in Tsaratanana of Vangaindrano.

11 March. An unidentified armed group clashes with Fokonolona militia members in Soamanandray of Antananarivo Atsimondrano. The unidentified group overcome the Fokonolona and attack 12 homes with reports of injured civilians, stolen goods and rape during the attack (coded separately). Police forces are able to apprehend the group following the attack.

11 March. An unidentified armed group attacked 12 homes in Soamanandray of Antananarivo Atsimondrano, leaving civilians injured, women and children raped and goods stolen. The attack followed a clash with Fokonolona militia members, whom were overcome. Police later apprehended the gunmen.

column7: SECES: Union of Researching Teachers and Teaching Researchers; Teachers (Madagascar)
column17: 14 March. SECES researchers continue to protest at the University of Antananarivo in Antananarivo Renivohitra over working conditions and wages. [size=140]
16 March. Civilians demonstrate in Ambondrona of Antananarivo Renivohitra against the poor service provision of water by JIRAMA. [size=no report]
17 March. Dahalo militants attack civilians 45 km north of Betroka of Anosy. 2 civilians are killed and others injured during the attack.
19 March. Dahalo and gendarmerie clash in Tsaratanana of Vangaindrano, killing one trainee soldier and 5 dahalo during a pursuit to recover stolen zebu.

20 March. Civilians riot by burning the JIRAMA electricity company office in Antalaha of Sava over poor provision of electricity. Police and gendarmerie intervene in the riot, killing 2 people and injuring others. [size=crowds]
21 March. Dahalo clash with military and police forces in Antranomamy of Betioky Atsimo. One soldier and one dahalo are killed in the clash with others injured.

21 March. Dahalo militia clashes with military forces at Mahatsitso area of Ambato Boeny. Six dahalo and one military member are killed during the clash, along with the army seizing weapons, stolen cattle and arresting dahalo. Military forces have increased their presence in the area following the fighting.

22 March. Truck drivers protest by blocking traffic in Ambohimangakely of Antananarivo Avaradrano, refusing night transportation of forest products. Police forces are called in to disperse the protest. [size=no report]
23 March. Dahalo militia members clash with Fokonolona and police forces during an attempted cattle raid and kidnapping in Bemandresy and Androtsy of Ihosy.
27 March. Municipal workers protest in front of City Hall in Antsirabe over salaries, as part of ongoing strikes since February 15. [size=no report]
27 March. A labour group demonstrates in Antsahamanitra of Andramasina against the Sirama company, demanding government investigations. [size=no report]
27 March. Dahalo clash with gendarmerie and Fokonolona communal militia members in Andriamena of Tsaratanana, killing 2 of the dahalo in the clash.
30 March. Gendarmerie and Fokonolona communal militia members clash with dahalo in Ampisara area of Keliloha in Tsaratanana, killing 1 dahalo member.

column6: Former Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019) Gendarmerie
column17: 01 April. 2 former gendarmes kidnap a taxi driver in Soavinandriana of Itasy near the hospital.
On or before 02 April. A group of 5 dahalo decapitate and kill a civilian in Manja of Menabe. Police arrest one of the dahalo following the attack while the others escape.
Week of 03 April. A dozen dahalo clash with Fokonolona Communal Militia members in Vohilava of Mananjary, wounding the Fokonolona leader. Five dahalo are arrested following the clash.
05 April. Police is accused of killing a prisoner in jail charged with theft. Riots ensue (coded separately).

05 or 07 April. Residents riot in Maroantsetra of Analanjirofo following the police killing of a prisoner in jail charged with theft (coded separately). Rioters burn homes and police disperse rioters by firing rounds at the demonstrators, killing one person and wounding others. [size=no report]

On or before 09 April. Fokonolona communal militia and gendarmerie forces clash with dahalo militia in Andrembosoa within Betafo district of Moramanga. 5 dahalo are arrested, some injured and weapons are seized.
11 April. Fokonolona communal militia members recapture and then kill a prisoner who had escaped from Ambatomasina prison.

12 April. Fokonolona communal militia and gendarmerie clashes with Dahalo militia members in Tsaratanana of Vangaindrano following the Dahalo theft of goods and cattle from a local market. No casualties reported.
12 April. Police forces clash with dahalo in Taranta area, near Manja of Menabe, killing one of the dahalo.
Month of April. Madagascar military forces deploy 400 forces to Itasy, Mahajanga and Fianarantsoa regions to combat Dahalo militants.
15 April. Dahalo militia members clash with police forces in Ambilobe of Diana, wounding 3 police and two civilians.
16 April. Around 60 Dahalo militia steal 80 oxen in Amboronabo of Sakaraha.
16 April. A mob armed with sticks, axes, machetes kills two civilians thought to be thieves and set them on fire.

16 April. University students riot in Ankatso of Andramasina against the ongoing suspension of classes, the accreditation system, university student services and increase of scholarships. Students throw stones at police, who in turn disperse the protest with tear gas. [size=no report]
17 April. Rioters burn buildings at the Toliara base against the lack of local benefits of a proposed major mining project, gendarme soldiers disperse the riot. [size=30]
20 April. Gendarme soldiers, along with Fokonolona communal militia clash with Dahalo militia in Ampanasana of Morafenobe. 3 were killed in the clash, including 2 dahalo and a soldier wounded.
22 April. A gold mine worker and interpreter is killed by gendarme soldiers following a disagreement in Sakaraha of Atsimo Andrefana.

column16: Midi Madagasikara; L'Express de Madagascar; News Mada
column17: 24 April. A group of Ihosy residents armed with spears, stones and bricks attempt to carry out communal justice against a civilian suspected of murder at the police station in Ihosy of Ihorombe. The group is repelled by police and gendarme forces with tear gas and live rounds before they could execute the prisoner. [size=hundreds]

24 April. A group of students and residents of Toliara engage in mob violence against a suspected thief, severely injuring the civilian at Maninday University of Toliara in Atsimo Andrefana. [size=no report]
24 April. A group of Mandritsara residents carry out popular justice by killing a civilian suspected of stealing zebus in Mandritsara of Sofia.
27 April. Military forces kill a civilian by hanging during operations in two villages of Soaloka called Bebeta and Dabo Madinika against Dahalo militia members.
28 April. 30 Dahalo armed militia members raid 127 zebus from civilians in Anjozorobe of Analamanga.

29 April. Students demonstrate and strike for the resumption of classes at the university campus, upsetting taxi drivers and other traders by the ongoing demonstrations. The taxi drivers and traders riot against students by throwing rocks and violently clashing against one another. [size=no report]

29 April. Following an attempted theft of zebus, Dahalo militia members clash with gendarme forces and Fokonolona members clash in the Tsivory area of Amboasary-Atsimo, killing 4 Dahalo, injuring a Fokonolona member and recovering 41 stolen zebus.
30 April. Soldiers assault civilians and burn 50 homes in Bebeta and 20 homes in Dabo Madinika villages of Soaloka in operations against Dahalo militia members. Widespread looting was reported.
05-06 February. Dahalo and Malagasy gendarmerie clash, killing 2 dahalo in Manarintsoa.
02 May. Journalists, students and others in media demonstrate in Analakely of Antananarivo Renivohitra for press freedom. [size=no report]
02 May. A woman is kidnapped by dahalo militants in Tsimandainga of Maevatanana, releasing her following a bribe of cattle.

07 May. Rioters demonstrate in Ranobe of Anosy by vandalising, stealing and burning property in support of local politician Siteny Randrianasoloniaiko. Gendarme intervene to disperse the demonstration. [size=no report]
05 September. Dahalo clashed with a Fokonolona communal militia following a cattle and arms theft by Dahalo in Morarano village in Beraketa, Bekily, killing 2 and injuring another Dahalo militant.

10 May. 30 military forces burn homes and assault civilians during ongoing operations against Dahalo militia members in Bebeta and Dabomadinika areas of Soaloka in Miandrivazo, forcing many to flee to surrounding areas.
11 May. Dahalo militia members attack civilians in Aristotle area of Farafangana. 11 people are injured in the attack, as well as property stolen.

Month of May. Military forces regain three villages of Mahazoarivo, Vatolava and Ambaladera II in ongoing fighting with dahalo forces. ""More than a dozen deaths"" reported in the fighting as well as civilian casualties (coded as 12 across 3 locations) with 30 arrests.

Month of May. Military forces regain three villages of Mahazoarivo, Vatolava and Ambaladera II in ongoing fighting with dahalo forces. ""More than a dozen deaths"" reported in the fighting as well as civilian casualties (coded as 12 across 3 locations) with 30 arrests.

Month of May. Military forces regain three villages of Mahazoarivo, Vatolava and Ambaladera II in ongoing fighting with dahalo forces. ""More than a dozen deaths"" reported in the fighting as well as civilian casualties (coded as 12 across 3 locations) with 30 arrests.

Month of May. Dahalo militia control territory in Ambalavao forest of Fanjakana commune and Vatolava of Mahazoarivo in Isandra district of Haute Matsiatra. Military forces attempt to retake the territory but are unable to overcome the dahalo forces.
16 May. Military forces and dahalo clash in Isandra and the surrounding area of Haute Matsiatra where dahalo have been holding territory.
17 May. Military forces and dahalo clash in Isandra and the surrounding area of Haute Matsiatra where dahalo have been holding territory. A military lieutenant is wounded in the clash.
18 May. 3 police officers attack journalists in Mahamasina of Antananarivo Renivohitra during a university basketball game.
18 May. Military forces and dahalo clash in Isandra and the surrounding area of Haute Matsiatra where dahalo have been holding territory.
18 May. Fokonolona communal militia members clash with Dahalo militia in Ambatonandriana of Manjakandriana. Some civilian injuries reported following the clash, as well as theft of livestock.
19 May. Dahalo and police clash in Manja of Menabe, following the attempted theft of livestock by dahalo. One dahalo is arrested and some livestock recovered.
25 May. Dahalo attack civilians, destroy property and steal cattle in Anjozorobe of Analamanga. No casualties were reported.
27 May. Dahalo militia members attack civilians in Ambohimiera of Ifanadiana, burning buildings and forcing civilians to flee.
28 May. A student and independent political candidate is killed and another civilian wounded by an unidentified armed group in Sakaraha of Atsimo Andrefana.
Week of 29 May. Protesters of opposition parties demonstrate in Maroantsetra of Analanjirofo against the outcome of elections in the constituency. [size=4000]
30 May. Protesters of opposition parties demonstrate in front of the Court of First Instance in Ambositra of Amoron I Mania against the outcome of recent elections. [size=no report]
30 May. Protesters associated with opposition parties demonstrate in Bekily of Androy to denounce election fraud. [size=no report]

30 May. Protesters demonstrate against election fraud and the outcome of the vote in Sakaraha of Atsimo Andrefana, following threats of violence to vote for a particular candidate. Electoral staff flee without the results following the demonstration by protesters. [size=no report]
30 May. Supporters of 7 losing candidates in the recent election protest in Independence Square of Ihosy of Ihorombe to challenge the election results. [size=no report]
30 May. Protesters associated with two political candidates demonstrate for a recount in Belo sur Tsiribihina of Menabe. [size=40]
30 May. Protesters of opposition parties demonstrate in front of the District Electoral Centre, demanding a recount of the votes in the recent election. [size=no report]
31 May. Military forces arrest and kill three civilians in Ampitatafika of Soavinandriana, leaving their bodies in the river.

31 May. 3 Zaha Gasy members, including the legislative candidate called Jean Navandahy, attack and kill a civilian in Tsiafahy of Antananarivo Atsimondrano following elections. The party members are arrested following the attack.
31 May. A polling station is burned down by an unidentified armed group in Toliary-II following elections in the district.
03 June. Suspected Dahalo militia members attack civilians for the second time in one week in Ambohimiera of Ifanadiana, burning buildings and forcing civilians to flee.
05 June. Dahalo militia members attack the Mayor in Andranovory of Soavinandriana, firing shots into the house and killing his wife.
Week of 05 June. 4 Dahalo militia members ambushed a vehicle carrying the Minister of Agriculture at on RN9 near Antanimeva, Morombe. The assailants looted goods from the vehicle.
05 June. Dahalo militia attack civilians and steal cattle in Ambatolahy of Miandrivazo. 1 death and two injuries are reported following the attack.
12 June. Dahalo clashed with a communal militia group, called ""Boko Haram"" in Ambohipeno, Ambohimahasoa.
16 June. Dahalo militants attacked civilians in Andilamena, Alaotra Mangoro. 1 civilian was killed and cattle were stolen during the attack.
16 June. Dahalo attacked civilians and stole cattle in Amparatsiraka, Andilamena. One civilian was killed in the attack.
On or before 17 June. Dahalo militia members attack and killed a civilian farmer in Ambodisatrana, Antalaha.
17 June. Dahalo members clashed with police forces and Fokonolona communal militia in Tsarafidy, Ambohimahasoa. The police and Fokonolona forces killed 2 Dahalo, captured one, and seized weapons.
18 June. An angry mob carry out popular justice and kill two young men suspected of murdering a woman in Tanambao Daoud, Sambava. [size=no report]
18 June. Armed Dahalo looted 140 zebus from civilians in Marovala, Betroka.
19 June. Taxi drivers protest in Ankorondrano, Antananarivo Atsimondrano over new tax laws. [size=no report]

column9: Military Forces of Madagascar (2019-); Fokonolona Communal Militia (Madagascar)
column17: 24 June. Military, Fokonolona and gendarme forces clashed with Dahalo militants in Andohajango, Mandritsara. Three gendarmes, one soldier and a civilian were shot and injured. One Fokonolona militia died, two civilians were taken hostage and cattle was stolen.

column9: Military Forces of Madagascar (2019-); Fokonolona Communal Militia (Madagascar)
column17: 25 June. Military, Fokonolona and gendarme forces clashed with Dahalo militants in Andohajango, Mandritsara. 6 were wounded in the fighting, including 3 gendarmes, a soldier and 2 civilians.

26 June. A police officer attacked a civilian during Independence Day celebrations in Maevatanana, Betsiboka. A gendarme intervened and severely injured the police officer, in order to stop the attack.
28 June. Dahalo and military forces clashed in the commune of Andrea, Maintirano (no coordinates available), killing one Dahalo combatant.
28 June. Dahalo and military forces clash in Ivahona, Betroka following the theft of cattle, killing 5 Dahalo combatants in the fighting.
28 June. Police forces burn civilians' homes and buildings in Mangily village in Ivahona, Betroka.
28 June. A gendarme soldier raped a young, primary school girl in Tsiroanomandidy, Bongolava.
30 June. Demonstrators burned tires and barricaded streets in Alasora, Antananarivo Renivohitra over power issues during the Africa Cup match. [size=no report]
30 June. Police forces clashed with Dahalo militants in Ampanahy Andrefana, Miandrivazo, after the Dahalo stole 80 cows. 2 Dahalo were killed and 13 arrested in the clash.
05 July. The Dahalo militia abduct two civilians from Ivahona, Betroka.
05 July. The Dahalo clashed with gendarme and military forces in Fotadrivo, Ampanihy. 2 Dahalo were killed, 13 arrested and goods recovered in the clash.
07 July. Dahalo and gendarmerie forces clashed during an attempted raid on vehicles in Adranoboka-Ankatsakatsa, Morombe. The Dahalo were repelled by the gendarme.
08 July. Dahalo clash with gendarme and Fokonolona militia in Analavory, Miarinarivo. The Dahalo attempted to steal cattle but are repelled, killing one in the fighting and injuring others.
08 July. Dahalo clashed with a Fokonolona communal militia after a raid by Dahalo in Betalala, Miandrivazo, killing 2 and injuring 3 others of the communal militia.
08 July. A police officer attacked and killed a civilian in the village of Maroloha in Bemahatazana, Miandrivazo.
Week of 10 July. Gendarmerie forces and Dahalo clashed during at attempted raid by Dahalo in Beraketa, Bekily. Three Dahalo were arrested and weapons were seized.
12 July. Dahalo looted goods and killed a civilian working at a local market in Maharihy, Morombe.
14 July. Dahalo and gendarmerie forces clashed in Tanandava, Bekily following the theft of 113 cattle. 4 Dahalo were killed in the clash.
18 July. Dahalo militia killed 3 civilians in Tsaramandroso, Bongolava, as well as burned homes and looted cattle.
18 July. Dahalo militia clashed with gendarme and Fokonolona militia in Andrasia village in Ankavandra, Miandrivazo. Gendarme and Fokonolona recovered stolen zebus and wound 10 Dahalo in the clash.
18 July. Protesters demonstrate in Mahabo, Menabe for the installment of an elected MP after a recent election. [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of Madagascar (2019-) Prison Guards
column17: 20 July. Prisoners took guards hostage and threw rocks in Toamasina, Atsinanana. Guards suppress the uprising by firing shots and dispersing the prisoners. [size=no report]

25 July. Dahalo militants steal cattle from civilians in Ambatondrazaka, Ambatondrazaka before clashing with military and Fokonolona forces who were able to recover stole livestock (coded separately).

29 July. Dahalo militants and military forces clash in Befandriana Nord, Sofia. A brigade commander was shot and killed in the clash, along with the mayor of Belal municipality and a government administrator.
31 July. A police officer shot and injured two civilians in Tsaralana, Antananarivo Renivohitra but claimed it was accidental.
31 July. Police forces killed two civilians in Ambohimahasoa, Vondrozo. Circumstances unclear.
06 August. 20 Dahalo and police forces clashed in Besoa, Ambalavao during an attempted raid on cattle, killing 3 and recovering weapons.

Week of 07 August. Police arrested and killed two civilians which may have been Dahalo militants in Ambohimahasoa, Vondrozo. Police and the family of those arrested and killed have conflicting accounts whether those killed were Dahalo militants.
09 August. Residents demonstrated against lack of water provision in Antsahameva, Sofia. [size=no report]
09 August. Gendarme forces clashed with Dahalo militants in Andilamena, Alaotra Mangoro, killing one Dahalo and arresting 7 others in the fighting.
11 August. Dahalo attacked civilians and stole cattle in Fenoarivo, a suburb of Ianabinda, Betroka.
12 August. Locals demonstrated in Ankadiaivo, Antananarivo Renivohitra against the toxic tar smoke emitted during road construction in the area. [size=no report]
16 August. Dahalo clashed with gendarme forces following an earlier killing of a civilian in the Andilamena area. One Dahalo was killed and 7 others arrested.
17 August. Dahalo clashed with Fokonolona communal militia in Amparakininy, a village in Tsivory commune, Amboasary-Atsimo. 1 civilian was killed in the clash and cattle were stolen.
18 August. A group carried out popular justice of suspected criminals by beating and stoning those caught in Beranofary village, Vohemar. 6 civilians were killed. [size=no report]

Weekend of 17-18 August. Orange farmers demonstrated by blocking the entrance to a local factory, which they claim had taken their land in Imerintsiatosika, Arivonimamo. Farmers threw rocks at police, who fired shots in the air to disrupt the demonstration. [size=no report]
18 August. Dahalo militia members attacked and abducted a civilian in Antsalova, Melaky. They took him from his village, but released him in the countryside.

19 August. Dahalo militants attacked and injured a civilian farmer in Marovahoaka village, Ambatomiady, Vakinankaratra. Gendarme forces arrested two Dahalo and their arms dealer nearby on the same day.
19 August. Dahalo clashed with Fokonolona communal militia in Belenalena, Amboasary-Atsimo. 1 Dahalo was killed in the fighting, and Dahalo stole some cattle.
19 August. Dahalo clashed with Fokonolona communal militia and police forces in Bekopaka, Antsalova. Stolen cows were recovered after the clash.
21 August. Dahalo militants attacked civilians and stole cattle in Tanandava, Bekily. One civilian was killed in the attack.

21 August. Responding to an earlier attack in Tanandava on the same day, Police and Fokonolona communal militia clashed with Dahalo militants in Beraketa, killing two Dahalo. Police recovered weapons during the clash.
Week of 21 August. Dahalo and military forces clashed in Tsaratanana, Vangaindrano. One Dahalo was killed in the clash and stolen zebus were returned.
26 August. Gendarme forces clashed with Dahalo militants, injuring a civilian by a stray bullet in Ambatosola, Bekily.
29 August. Gendarme and Dahalo forces clashed in Amboraka, Befotaka. One gendarme was injured in the clash.
02 September. Military and Fokonolona forces clashed with dahalo militants in Andranomanga, Iakora following the theft of some zebus. 1 was killed in the clash.
04 September. Dahalo and gendarme forces clashed in Ifarantsa area of Beraketa, Bekily following the attempted theft of zebu. 2 dahalo were killed in the clash and 2 civilians were injured.
05 September. Dahalo and military forces clashed following the theft of some zebu. Two were killed in the clash, weapons were recovered and military forces arrested several dahalo.
08 September. Police and dahalo clashed following an abduction and zebu theft and abduction by dahalo. One person was killed in the clash.
08 September. Dahalo militants abducted a civilian and stole zebus in Ifarantsa area of Beraketa, Bekily.
08 September. Dahalo clashed with military forces following an attack on civilians in Tsivory, Amboasary-Atsimo. 4 were killed, zebus stolen, goods looted and several wounded in the fighting.
11 September. Military forces clashed with 50 dahalo militants in Mahaimandry village in Amborompotsy, Ambatofinandrahana. No reported fatalities.

On Sept 14th, inhabitants and farmers of Ambohitrimanjaka, held a peaceful protest against the President's project which would consists in the backfilling of approximately 100 hectares of rice fields. [Size=no report]
On September 15 2019, Dahalo clashed with police in Anakona (Farafangana, Atsimo-Atsinanana). No fatalities were reported.
Around September 15 2019, police and Dahalo militia members clashed in Sahabe (coded as Anozorobe, Analamanga). 2 Dahalo were killed.
Around September 15 2019, Dahalo militia members attacked the commune of Manankana, coded as Anjozorobe (Analamanga). They burnt houses and stole cattle.
Around September 20 2019, Dahalo attacked the village of Beapombo II (Betroka, Anosy). One Dahalo was killed in uncertain circumstances.
On September 21 2019, a group of Dahalo militia members clashed with police in Vohiposa (Ambohimahasoa, Upper Matsiatra) after stealing cattle from a village nearby.
On September 21 2019, Dahalo members clashed with police in Vohiposa, Betroka district, after stealing cattle from a nearby village. 4 people were killed, unclear who.
On September 21 2019, Dahalo militia members attacked Ambatondrazaka (Alaotra Mangoro).
On September 24 2019, Dahalo militia members clashed with police after the Dahalo had stolen cattle from a nearby village in Ambovombe Atsimo district. 2 Dahalo were killed.
On September 25 2019, police forces clashed with Dahalo militia members who had stolen cattle in Anililanavato (coded as Ambovombe, Androy). 2 Dahalo were killed.
On Sept 26th, medicine students of the University of Antananarivo gathered to protest over the non-payment of 5-month scholarships and 1-year interships. [Size=no report]

On September 26 2019, Dahalo and Fokonolona members clashed in Adabomaro Satrokala (coded as Satrokala, Ihosy). 6 Dahalo and 1 civilian were killed and 3 Fokonolona were injured. An alternate report suggests that the Dahalo clashed with police.
On September 30 2019, Dahalo militia members attacked Belula Ampasy (coded as Miary, Toliara II, Atsimo-Andrefana) and stole bulls. They were chased by community members but escaped.
On October 1 2019, police and Dahalo clashed in Lopary (Vangaindrano, Atsimo-Atsinanana), resulting in the death of 1 Dahalo member.
Around October 2 2019, Dahalo militia members attacked the village of Betroka and clashed with police members who responded to the attack. 2 Dahalo members were killed.

On October 3 2019, 11 people were killed after a marital dispute turned violent in the rural district of Emagnobo near Taolanaro. Members from neighboring communities took oxen in the name of resolving the dispute which provoked violence between the individuals. [size=no report]

On Oct 3rd, on the occasion of the World Day of Decent work, people held a silent march in the streets of Anosy to call for an improvement of working conditions in mines, for the respect of workers' right and for the access to employment in Madagascar. [Size=no report]
Around October 7 2019, Dahalo attacked the village of Mahasoa (Betroka, Anosy) and 1 Dahalo was killed when a villager fired at them.
Around October 8 2019, Dahalo attacked the village of Soaserana in Tsivory commune (Anosy).
On October 9 2019, unidentified armed men attempted to attack the president of TIM in Antsirabe.
On October 12 2019, a person stabbed 2 people, killing 1, and was then beaten to death by the Fokonolona militia group in Ampitatafika (Soavinandriana).

Over the weekend of October 12 2019, members of a village in Ambalamanasy clashed with vigilantes from other communities nearby, resulting in 1 death. Both believed the other had stolen cows that were discovered dead. The incident occurred in Ambalamanasy II, Andapa, Sava. [size=no report]
On October 12 2019, police forces clashed with men stealing bulls in the village of Ambalakindresy (Ambohimahasoa, Haute Matsiatra). 3 men were arrested.
On October 12 2019, members of a community self-defense militia captured, killed, and dismembered a suspected Dahalo member in Foroanarina (Anjozorobe).
On October 12 2019, Dahalo and police clashed at Maroavaratra, Ambalankindresy commune (coded as Ambalankindresy). 2 people of uncertain identification were killed.
On October 13 2019, Dahalo militia members clashed with a vigilante group in the village of Ambatolahindraahy (coded as Ambovombe Afovoany, capital of Manandriana district). Fatalities were unclear.
On October 13 2019, unidentified gunmen (assumed Dahalo) attacked two civilians and attempted to abduct them and their cattle but were pursued by police. One person was wounded or killed.

Around October 15 2019, Dahalo militia members attempted to steal cattle and then clashed with police who responded to the incident in Tanandava (Satra, Andtroy, Bekily). 1 civilian was killed, as well as an unspecified number of Dahalo and/or police members. Unknown fatalities coded as 3

On Oct 17th 2019, in Ambohitrimanjaka, clashes took place between the police and the population who refuse the expropriation proposed by the State in the context of the implementation of the Tana-Masoandro project. The police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. 5 people, of which 4 police members, were injured. [size=no report]

On October 17 2019, angry residents clashed with police in Ambohitrimanjaka (Ambohidratrimo, Analamanga) after destroying materials for the Tana Masoandro project starting to be implemented there. A mob also attacked the group of demonstrators who had attempt to disrupt another group of people who were disposing of materials for a construction project. 4 people were injured and 9 others arrested. [size=at least 13]

On Oct 18th 2019, Dahalo and police forces clashed near Ankavandra, after Dahalo militia blocked the passage of a vehicle where some officials were travelling. One police officer was seriously injured. No fatalities reported.
On Oct 19th 2019, a protest was held in Ambohitrimanjaka over the construction of the new Tana-Masoandro town. [size=no report]
Around Oct 19th 2019, in Sakaraha, a businessman was allegedly killed in his hotel room by members of a Dahalo Militia.
Around Oct 20th 2019 (exact date not reported) a tram in Taolagnaro was attacked by Dahalo militia. The driver was killed.
On October 20 2019, unidentified armed assailants (assumed Dahalo) killed 5 people in Soamanarivo (Tsaramasoandro, Ankazobe, Analamanga).

On Oct 20th 2019, in Ampanihy Ouest, people protested against an evangelist of a local church accused of practising actions contrary to the religion. According to protesters, the evangelist also prevented people from being treated in hospitals or vaccinated, claiming that only prayer can solve health problems. [size=no report]
On Oct 21st 2019, the Dahalo militia fired shots against a group of two police officers and one soldier, 5 km from Ankavandra [coded at geoprecision 2]. No fatalities reported.
On Oct 22nd 2019, a woman was killed by a Dahalo militia in Ambatofolaka. Reasons behind the murder are unknonw.

On Oct 22nd 2019, a group of two police officers and two soldiers was attacked by 60 armed Dahalo in Ankavandra. The military responded to the gunfire. One police officer and one soldier were injured. No fatalities reported.
On 23 October 2019, in Zannouch, residents and students blocked the road between Gafsa and Sfax protesting against water supply cuts affecting their area. [size=no report]
On Oct 24th 2019, drivers in Ambohibao protested for being blocked in traffic. [size=no report]
On October 25 2019, two members of the Zamami militia groups killed their boss and injured his wife in Ambatomiady (Ananifotsy).
On Oct 25th 2019, around one hundred people belonging to Bara ethnic group clashed in Marotsiraka with an Antandroy ethnic group. 14 people died, of which 12 Bara and 2 Antandroy.
Around Oct 25th 2019 (exact date is not clear) police forces clashed with Dahalo Militia in Ambatofinandrahana. Four people died, three were injured.
On Oct 29 2019, Dahalo militias clashed with Police forces in Andilamena (Andilamena, Alaotra Mangoro). At least 12 people were killed. Three soldiers were injured.
On Oct 29th 2019, Dahalo militants clashed with Police forces in Andilamena. At least 12 fatalities were reported and 3 soldiers were injured.
On Oct 29th 2019, in Antanimenabaka, clashes among different Dahalo militias erupted. One person was killed.
On Oct 31st 2019, Dahalo militias attacked 4 houses in Mahatsinjo and stole some money and personal items. 4 suspects were arrested. No fatalities were reported.
On Nov 2nd 2019, near the Ikalalo city hall, a gendarme killed a girl during an investigation on a recent attack.
Around Nov 2nd 2019 (exact date not reported), in Ikatelo, a primary school was set on fire allegedly by Dahalo militias. Motives of the attack are unknown. No fatalities reported.

On Nov 5th 2019, students of the University of Antananarivo (Ankatso) protested demanding the resumption of classes, which were suspended a week before, due to a teachers' strike. They also protedsted over the non-payment of several months of scholarship. Students clashed with transit operators and traders in Ankatso. Tyres were burnt, causing a fire on the hill close to the campus. [size=no report]
On Nov 5th 2019, in Kiranomena, a man was lynched to death by a mob for having killed his wife for jealousy. [size=no report]
On Nov 6th 2019, in Ambodiharina, a man accused of being a witch and having had his friend killed, was stoned to death by villagers. [szie=no report]
Around Nov 7th 2019 (exact date not reported), the candidate for mayor of Belalona was shot by a Dahalo militia. A gendarme was also shot.

On or around Nov 8 2019 (coded at time precision 2), a Dahalo militia clashed with Police officers in Esira (Amboasary-Atsimo, Anosy). Policemen were conducting an armed raid because of a bull robbery, when the militia engaged them. 2 people were killed.

Around Nov 8th (exact date not reported) 2019, a Dahalo militia clashed with Police officers in Esira. Policemen were conducting an armed raid in response to reports of robbery. The militia responded with fire. 2 people were killed.
On Nov 11 2019, a Dahalo militia attacked the village of Ampandrana, burning houses. The police opened fire against them but no fatalities were reported.
On Nov 11 2019, villagers clashed with a Dahalo militia in Sahamandresy (Manandriana, Amoron I Mania). Police intervened firing shots against Dahalo. No fatalities reported.
On Nov 13 2019, a Dahalo militia attacked the village of Ambohimiera (Ifanadiana, Vatovavy Fitovinany), killing 3 people.

On Nov 13 2019, protesters held a peaceful demonstration against the Tana Masoandro project in Ambohitrimanjaka (Ambohidratrimo, Analamanga). The project aims at the construction of a new town but residents refuse to sell their lands to the project developers. [size=no report]
On Nov 13 2019, a Dahalo militia attacked the village of Tsaratanana, burning several houses. Two members of the militia were killed by the police in a firefight.
On Nov 13 2019, a mob of villagers attacked a suspected robber in Antsoha (Vohemar, Sava). Police forces intervened to disperse the crowd. No fatalities reported. [size=no report]

On Nov 14 2019, Police Forces clashed with unknown gang members in Tsaratanana (Vangaindrano, Atsimo Atsinanana). The suspects were involved in the abduction of an official from the Ministry of National Education. 3 men were killed by the police.
On Nov 14 2019, six armed men belonging to a Dahalo militia clashed with police in the village of Andranovelo. No fatalities reported.
On Nov 18 2019, a Dahalo militia attacked the village of Ampandranana and clashed with police. 2 people were killed by the police.
Assumed on Nov 20, a Dahalo militia attacked the village of Antafia and stole twenty bulls. No fatalities reported.

On Nov 20 2019, residents rioted at the police station of Lohotrozona, looking for a man accused of murdering a resident. Police officers fired shots in the air to disperse the crowd but, in response, rioters burned the the police station. No fatalities reported. [size=no report]

On Nov 21 2019, a demonstration was held by students of the Technical Institute in Ambatondrazaka, over the delayed payment of their scholarship. Police intervened firing teargas. Demonstrators threw bricks at the police. Two students and one policeman were injured. [size=no report]
On November 23 2019, a Dahalo militia clashed with police in Beraketa (Bekily, Androy). 4 people died.
Assumed on November 25 2019, a Dahalo militia clashed with police forces in the outskirts of Ambatofinandrahana (Ambatofinandrahana, Amoron I Mania). No fatalities reported.
On November 26 2019, police Forces clashed with members of a Dahalo militia, in Ambato Boeny (Ambato Boeni, Boeny). Two people were killed.
Assumed on November 30 2019, a Dahalo militia attacked the village of Andranomavo (Soalala, Boeny) during elections. No fatalities reported.

On December 4 2019, a mob of people stormed the house of the parents of a man accused of having stolen some cattle in Lokomby (Manakara Atsimo, Vatovavy Fitovinany). No fatalities reported. [size=no report]
On December 6 2019, police forces clashed with a Dahalo militia which had stolen more than 80 bulls in Ranobe (Amboasary-Atsimo, Anosy). No fatalities reported.
On December 8 2019, a ""Fokontany chief"" was killed in front of his wife by a Dahalo militia in Famoriana (Isandra, Haute Matsiatra). The motives of the killing are unknown.
Around December 8 2019, a woman was allegedly beheaded by an unidentified group (assumed Dahalo) in Tandrano (Ankazoabo, Atsimo Andrefana).
On December 9 2019, 4000 people marched in Toliara (Toliary-I, Atsimo Andrefana) on the occasion of the International Anti-Corruption Day. [size=4000]
On December 10 2019, a Dahalo militia attacked the village of Vondrozo (Vondrozo, Atsimo Atsinanana), killing one child and injuring another one.
Around December 10 2019, an unidentified group (assumed Dahalo) killed and removed the eyes from an unidentified number of bodies in Ampoza (Ankazoaba Sud, Ankazoaba, Atsimo Andrefana).

Around December 10 2019, an unidentified group (assumed Dahalo) killed and removed the eyes from an unidentified number of bodies in Ambalamary (Andranolava, Sakaraha District, Atsimo Andrefana). Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On December 10 2019, a student riot erupted at the University of Fianarantsoa. Students set fire to infrastructures causing major damage. No fatalities reported. [size=no report]
On December 10 2019, a vendor was kidnapped in Anjozorobe (Analamanga). 4 kidnappers were killed by the fokonolona communal militia.
On December 10 2019, a group of citizens of Brieville (Tsaratanana, Betsiboka) chased some kidnappers and clashed with them. 4 pursuers were killed. [size=no report]
On December 10 2019, a mob of citizens captured and handed to the police a 17-year-old accused of robbery. [size=no report]
On December 11 2019, a Dahalo militia attacked the village of Ampandrana (Tsaratanana, Betsiboka). 93 cattle were stolen and 57 houses damaged. No fatalities reported.
On December 11 2019, a Dahalo militia killed two men in Ampasambazimba (Tsaratanana, Betsiboka).
Assumed on December 13 2019, a Dahalo militia reportedly attacked the village of Bekoropoka (Morombe, Atsimo Andrefana). No fatalities reported.
On December 14 2019, Dahalo attacked and robbed a vendor in Andranomifototra, Sava.

column7: SECES: Union of Researching Teachers and Teaching Researchers; Teachers (Madagascar)
column17: On December 16 2019, striking teachers from the SECES union blocked the doors of Antananarivo University (Andramasina, Analamanga). They left after discussions with university leadership and then burnt tires in the street. [size=no report]
On December 16 2019, residents of Ambohitrimanjaka protested against the Tana-Masoandro project that will affect land in the area. [size=many]

On December 16 2019, students demonstrated at the Ecole Normale Superieure in Ampefiloha (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) against the ongoing strike by teachers that has resulted in the closure of the school. [size=no report]
On December 17 2019, students clashed with police while demonstrating in Ambohipo (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) against the expulsion of students from university housing. [size=no report]

On December 17 2019, student demonstrators clashed with police in the Ankatso University campus (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) and at the university campus in Ambohipo (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) against the closure of their university due to a teachers strike. 4 students were arrested, 3 in Ankatso and 1 in Ambohipo. [size=no report]
On December 18 2019, striking students took hostage a policeman at Ankatso University (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) and released him in the evening. [size=no report]
On December 19 2019, clashes broke out between community members in Soavinandriana (Itasy) related to a land dispute. 17 people were arrested.

On December 20 2019, students protested in Ambohipo (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) and blocked the road before being dispersed by police. The protest was against the expulsion of students from university housing. [size=no report]
On December 20 2019, students protested at the Ecole Normale Superieur Ampefiloha (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) over unpaid scholarships. [size=no report]

Around December 23 2019, around 300 employees of the Madagascar Road Bureau protested outside the office in Alarobia (Antanifotsy, Vankinankaratra) claiming they had not been paid in 8 months. [size=300]
On December 24 2019, unidentified assailants attacked 3 police members who were patrolling Anjozorobe (Analamanga). 1 police was killed and 1 injured.
On December 24 2019, 10 armed assailants attacked a police center in Andranomadio (Sofia). 1 police officer was injured and 7 assailants were arrested.
On December 24 2019, a soldier was shot dead by a Dahalo in Ambatomanoina (Anamalanga).
On December 24 2019, Dahalo stole 30 cattle in Andrea, Maintirano.
On December 24 2019, Dahalo and military forces clashed between Antsalova and Tsiroanomandidy. 1 soldier went missing during the clash and his body was later found with signs of torture.
On December 25 2019, around 30 Dahalo attacked 4 vehicles in Betroka. 2 people were injured.
On December 25 2019, police forces clashed with Dahalo who had stolen 167 oxen in Imamnombo (Ambovombe). The police recovered all of the oxen.
On December 25 2019, Dahalo attacked the village of Mananovy (Anosy). 2 Dahao were later arrested.
On December 26 2019, some students protested at Antananarivo University (Analamanga) over the ongoing strike by teachers. [size=some]
On December 26 2019, Dahalo shot at a bus traveling between Betroka and Soanala (Anosy). No injuries were reported.
On December 27 2019, 1 police officer was killed in a clash with Dahalo in Belobaka (Boeny).
On December 28 2019, Dahalo attacked the village of Ambohibao (Bongatsara, Antananarivo-Atsimondrano, Analamanga)
On December 30 2019, Dahalo attacked the village of Famon-jena in Ambohimasimbola (Analamanga).

On January 7 2020, 2 police officers killed 2 Fokonolona and injured at least 2 others. The Fokonolona intervened after the police officers attacked a vendor who reportedly refused to give them money in Dondona (Itasy).
On January 7 2020, a crowd of people stormed the police post in Dondona (Soavinandriana district) after 2 police officers killed two civilians. [size=no report]
On January 8 2020, a mob of Fokonolona tried to kill a suspected robber in Andavamamba, Analamanga. [size=no report]
Around January 8 2020, police clashed with Dahalo in Ifotaka commune, Anosy. 4 Dahalo and 1 police were killed and 1 Dahalo was arrested.
On January 9 2020, soldiers clashed with Dahalo in Antetimanondro village, Fanjakana commune in Haute Matsiatra. 2 Dahalo were killed.
On January 10 2020, a small group of nurses working in state hospitals protested outside the Tanambao Hospital in Toamasina, Atsinanana. [size=about 50]
On January 12 2020, a group of Dahalo attacked the village of Ebelo in Anosy. Some community members were injured.
On January 12 2020, armed bandits clashed with members of the Fokonolona self defense group of Ankadivoribe (Analamanga). 4 people were injured.
Around January 12 2020, Dahalo militants attacked the town of Besatra, Androny, and killed 3 people.
On January 13 2020, employees of Sofitrans held a demonstration outside the office of Ravinala in Antananarivo over Sofitrans's partnership with the airports. [size=no report]
On January 14 2020, students demonstrated in Antananarivo to protest the ongoing strike by teachers. [size=no report]
On January 15 2020, a mob killed a man who had been caught stealing in Matagna, Vangaindrano. [size=no report]
On January 15 2020, Dahalo and police clashed in Ambohimahasoa (Atsimo Atsinanana). 2 Dahalo were killed.
On January 15 2020, Dahalo clashed with police in Ambohinamboarina, Haute Matsiatra. An unclear number of people were killed and 2 people injured. Unknown fatalities coded as 3
Around January 15 2020, police clashed with Dahalo in Ambohinamboarina, Haute Matsiatra. 2 Dahalo were arrested.
On January 15 2020, Dahalo stole 18 cattle in Behara, Anosy.
On January 16 2020, Dahalo clashed with police in Tsiroanomandidy, Bongolava.
On January 16 2020, Dahalo clashed with police in Ebelo, Anosy. 6 people were killed.
On January 16 2020, Dahalo clashed with police, supported by Fokonolona militia members in Beravina, Melaky. 6 Dahalo were killed and 6 Fokonolona were injured.
On January 16 2020, Dahalo clashed with police supported by Fokonolona members in Beravina, Morafenobe. 6 Dahalo were killed and 6 Fokonolona were injured.
On January 18 2020, street vendors burned tires to block the road in Anosibe, Bongolava, over the expulsion of vendors along the road. [size=no report]
Around January 18 2020, Dahalo stole 18 cattle from Maintirano district, Melaky.
On Janaury 18 2020, Dahalo tried to rob cattle from Antsokay in Atsimo Andrefana but were shot by residents guarding them. 22 Dahalo were killed.
On January 21 2020, Dahalo attacked six homes in Ambilombe, Mandritsara, and killed 1 person and injured 3 others.
On January 22 2020, Dahalo militants clashed with residents in Ambilobe, Mandritsara district, leaving 6 people dead.
On January 24 2020, a mob attacked three Dahalo in Ambilombe, Mandritsara. 3 Dahalo were injured. [size=no report]
On January 24 2020, Dahalo militants attacked a group of people in Bejijo in Miandrivazo, killing 1 person.
On January 24 2020, police and Fokonolona clashed with Dahalo in Mandritsara commune. 5 Dahalo were killed and 5 fokonolona were injured.
On January 25 2020, a mob beat up two people at Anjatelo in Mahabo (Menabe), who were suspected of stealing cattle the previous night. The 2 people were arrested. [size=no report]

On January 25 2020, a mob tried to kill the former head of the Fokonolona group in Etrotroka, Farafangana, Atsimo Atsinanana, after the current head of the Fokonolona group was decapitated by 4 unidentified assailants. [size=no report]
On January 26 2020, Dahalo clashed with military forces in Vohimary, Vondrozo district. 2 people were injured.
On January 26 2020, Dahalo clashed with military forces who were guarding cattle in Ampasiman-jeva, Vondrozo district. Some people were injured.

On January 26 2020, a mob including Fokonolona members detained and beat two Dahalo in a forest at Anjerizery, 22 km from Mahabo (Menabe). who had stolen cattle the previously day. The police later intervened and arrested the two men. [size=no report]
On January 27 2020, students barricaded the road at ESPA school in Vontovorona (Vakinankaratra) regarding the ongoing teachers' strike. Police used tear gas to clear the roads. [size=no report]
On January 29 2020, Dahalo attacked Ambohimanatrika in Vakinankaratra and set fire to a house. One of the occupants died in the fire, whilst the other was left with life-threatening injuries.
On January 30 2020, Fokonolona and angry residents killed 1 Dahalo militant who had robbed a shop in Antsahabe, Sambava district. 2 Fokonolona and 1 other Dahalo were injured. [size=no report]
On January 30 2020, a mob attempted to kill two people in Arivonimamo who were suspected of human trafficking. [size=no report]
On Febraury 1 2020, Fokonolona beat to death a robber in Bevonotra, Sambava, who had injured three people.
Around February 2 2020, a 17-year-old was beaten to death by an angry mob in a civil court in Mahanoro district after having committed a robbery. [size=no report]
On February 4 2020, street vendors protested in Anosy over the banning of vendors. [size=no report]
On February 5 2020, police clashed with Dahalo in Befeta, Ambohimahasoa. No casualties were reported.
On February 5 2020, police clashed with Dahalo in Soarano, Androy, and freed a hostage. 2 Dahalo were killed.
On February 8 2020, Dahalo militants attacked a store in Ambositra, robbing the store and attacking the owners. 1 person was killed and 1 injured.
On February 9 2020, Dahalo clashed with Gendarmes and Fokonolona after an attacked in Imanombo, Androy. Several people were killed (coded as 3).
On February 9 2020, Dahalo attacked Imanombo, Androy. 1 person was killed.
On February 11 2020, Dahalo attacked a cattle ranch in Ivolo, Ihorombe.
On February 11 2020, 5 Dahalo militants attacked the village of Ampandrandava in Androy and kidnapped 2 girls.
On February 11 2020, Dahalo clashed with Gendarmes in Ambatobe, Androy. 3 Dahalo were killed and 2 hostages were freed.
Around February 12 2020, Dahalo clashed with Gendarmerie forces and Fokonolona in Imanombo, Androy. An unknown number of people were killed or wounded (coded as 3).
On February 12 2020, Dahalo militants attacked and robbed a vehicle in Isoanala, Betrok. 2 people were killed.
On February 13 2020, Dahalo and Gendarmes clashed after an attack on the village of Tranomaro, Anosy district. 7 Dahalo were killed.
On February 13 2020, Dahalo attacked the village of Tranomaro in Anosy district and stole cattle.
On February 15 2020, riots broke out in Mantaly (Ambilobe, Diana) after rumors circulated about the death of a local woman. Rioters attacked the local Gendarme post. [size=no report]
On February 15 2020, residents demonstrated in Ambohitrimanjaka (Ambohidratrimo, Analamanga) over the Tana-Masoandro project by the government which would displace them. [size=no report]
On February 16 2020, Dahalo militants attacked Ambatoafo in Ambondrona (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) and kidnapped 1 woman.
On February 16 2020, Gendarmes clashed with Dahalo after they attacked a village near Ambatoafo in Ambondrona (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga). 1 woman who had been taken hostage was freed.
On February 16 2020, Dahalo militants stole zebus in Antsakatsaka, coded as Ihosy (Ihorombe).
On February 18 2020, Dahalo militants clashed with police in Mangarivotra (Antananarivo, Itasy) after attempting to break into houses in the area. 1 person was injured.
On February 19 2020, a mob killed a man who was part of a group that robbed a market in Antsiranana (Farafangana, Atsimo Atsinanana). [size=no report]
On February 23 2020, Dahalo clashed with police in Ikalamavony (Haute Matsiatra). 1 Dahalo was killed.
On February 24 2020, Dahalo militants attacked health workers in Ranobe (Amboasary-Atsimo, Anosy).
On February 28 2020, Dahalo clashed with police forces in Adamionga in Sakaraha district (Atsimo Andrefana). 3 people were killed and a child who had early been abducted was liberated.
On February 28 2020, Dahalo abducted a child in Adamionga in Sakaraha district (Atsimo Andrefana).

On 28 February 2020, an unidentified armed group shot and injured two civilians and abducted an albino in Ankiliabo (Tsihombe, Androy). Police and gendarme later arrested the group and freed the civilian albino who was abducted.

On 1 March 2020, Dahalo and police forces clashed in Antafotona in the Ambositra area (Amoron I Mania) following a raid by Dahalo on the village. 1 police officer was killed, another injured and 1 civilian injured. Goods were also looted.
On March 4 2020, Dahalo clashed with police near Fianarantsoa (Haute Matsiatra). 1 Dahalo was killed and 5 others arrested.
On 7 March 2020, several hundred local women from 5 surrounding communes and others demonstrated for the reopening of a mining project in Toliara (Toliary-I, Atsimo Andrefana). [size=several hundred]

On 11 March 2020, a mob lynched a bandit to death in Mandrosohasina (Antsirabe II, Vakinankaratra). The bandit was part of a larger group of thieves that had stolen goods and raped three women. [size=no report]

On 13 March 2020, Dahalo clashed with police and a local fokonolona militia in Babaria village located in Mahaly county (Amboasary-Atsimo, Anosy). Five were killed and others injured during the attempted cattle raid by Dahalo.
On 21 March 2020, a mob lynched an alleged killer in Ilakaka (Ihosy, Ihorombe). [size=no report]

On March 26 2020, rickshaw drivers demonstrated violently in Toamasina (Atsinanana) to demand a special work authorization during coronavirus confinement measures. Police forces intervened using tear gas. [size=no report]
On or before 27 March 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a young albino girl near Sakaraha (Sakaraha, Atsimo Andrefana).
On 30 March 2020, a group of taxi moto drivers demonstrated in Mahajanga (Mahajanga I, Boeny) against government restrictions on moto passengers due to coronavirus. [size=no report]
On 30 March 2020, a mob lynched an alleged criminal in the Ankirikiry Nord II area of Analamanga (Vondrozo, Atsimo Atsinanana). [size=no report]

On 30 March 2020, a group of rickshaw pullers and youth demonstrated in Toamasina (Toamasina II, Atsinanana) against the lack of food provisions by the government during coronavirus lockdowns. The demonstrators clashed with police who intervened using tear gas. One journalist was stabbed and injured. [size=no report]
On 1 April 2020, dahalo looted 40 zebus from civilians in Ambalatany (Ambovombe, Androy).
On 2 April 2020, dahalo attacked and robbed civilians in Tsivorikely (Tsihombe, Androy). 1 civilian was killed and 3 others wounded.
On 2 April 2020, dahalo and gendarmes clashed in Andraifantsa village (Amboasary-Atsimo, Anosy). Zebus were recovered and no fatalities or injuries were reported.
On 3 April 2020, gendarmes attacked and killed three dahalo prisoners as they attempted to escape custody in Andilanatoby (Ambatondrazaka, Alaotra Mangoro).

On 4 April 2020, rioters staged a demonstration, burnt tires and threw stones at police in Antananarivo (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga), in response to a scuffle between police and a man during the implementation of coronavirus measures. [size=no report]

On 5 April 2020, a group of 40 people attacked some thieves in Vatomandry district (Vatomandry, Atsinanana). Out of the 7 thieves who attempted to steal pigs, 5 were caught and injured, and 1 died. 4 arrests were made the following day. [size=40]

column9: Police Forces of Madagascar (2019-); Military Forces of Madagascar (2019-) Gendarmerie
column17: On 5 April 2020, dahalo clashed with Fokonolona, police and gendarmerie in the village of Anosinakoho (Farafangana, Atsimo Atsinanana) during an attempted zebu raid. 4 injuries were reported.

Several days prior to 10 April 2020, military forces clashed with Dahalo in the village of Fokontany d'Ampasika in Tsinjoarivo commune (Tsiroanomandidy, Bongolava). One Dahalo was killed in the clash.
On 8 April 2020, Dahalo looted four zebus during a raid in the Fandriana district area (Amoron I Mania).

On 8 April 2020, dahalo stole 4 zebus from civilians in Fandriana district (Fandriana, Amoron I Mania). The dahalo were later arrested in Antsirabe II district in the forest, where they were keeping the zebus.
On 8 April 2020, dahalo attacked civilians while attempting to steal 11 zebus in Anosak (Farafagana, Atsimo Atsinanana). Some injuries were reported.
On 14 April 2020, a dozen dahalo attacked civilians in Tanambao town (Bekily, Androy). The mayor was killed and over 100 zebu were stolen .

On 15 April 2020, taxi drivers, rickshaw pullers and others demonstrated in Toamasina (Toamasina II, Atsinanana) demanding government provision of goods during the coronavirus lockdown. [size=no report]

On 15 April 2020, gendarmerie clashed with dahalo in the Besandraha forest (Bekily, Androy) after the dahalo stole zebus and killed a town mayor the day before. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. 46 zebu were recovered.
On 16 April 2020, dahalo attacked, injured and stole goods from civilians in Alarobia (Antanifotsy, Vakinankaratra). 3 civilians were injured in the attack.
On 17 April 2020, dahalo abducted a young boy and held him for ransom in Belinta (Belo Sur Tsiribihina, Menabe).

On 18 April 2020, a mob attacked and injured a thief as he attempted to steal a refrigerator in Ambohipo (Antanavarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga). The thief was taken to the hospital for his injuries. [size=no report]
On 23 April 2020, dahalo attacked and killed a woman in Ambahikily (Morombe, Atsimo Andrefana).

On 25 April 2020, a group of civilians attacked and killed a police officer and wounded other civilians in Antsifatra village near Ambanja (Besalampy, Melaky). The police officers were attempting to investigate a drug trafficking ring along with civilian accomplices when they were attacked. [size=no report]
On 25 April 2020, dahalo attacked and killed a female Christian pastor who worked as a midwife in Anambila (Morombe, Atsimo Andrefana).
On 25 April 2020, dahalo clashed with gendarmerie and a few Fokonolona during a cattle raid in Andranovory (Befotaka, Atsimo Atsinanana). One gendarme was killed.

On 25 April 2020, street traders demonstrated by burning tires and blocking roads in Ampasika, in the commune of Bemasoandro (Anatananarivo-Atsimondrano, Analamanga). They demonstrated against coronavirus restrictions. Police threw rocks to disperse the demonstration. [size=no report]

On 25 April 2020, dozens of dahalo and gendarmes clashed after the dahalo attempted to steal 30 zebus in Andrea (Maitirano, Melaky). 2 dahalo were killed in the shooting, and the zebus were returned to their owners.
On 29 April 2020, dahalo raided cattle from civilians in Analalava (Analalava, Sofia). Police later recovered the stolen cattle and arrested some dahalo.

On 29 April 2020, a group demonstrated by throwing stones in Ankaraobato (Antananarivo Atsimondrano, Analamanga), against the unfair distributions of social assistance. Police intervened to disperse the demonstration. [size=no report]

On 29 April 2020, street traders demonstrated by fighting with and throwing projectiles at gendarmerie and military forces in Ambovombe Afovoany (Manandriana, Amoron I Mania) in response to changes proposed to the marketplace. 1 demonstrator was killed and 1 soldier was injured. [size=no report]

On 30 April 2020, dahalo looted a village and abducted 7 civilians in Mangatanboahangy (Abatofinandrahana, Amoron'l Mania). The dahalo held the hostages for ransom, which was eventually paid by relatives.
On 30 April 2020, dahalo and gendarmerie and fokonolona clashed in a village near Vohimanga commune (Bekiy District, Androy). One dahalo was killed and 4 arrested.
On 30 April 2020, dahalo attacked and killed 1 person and injured 2 others while ambushing and looting vehicles in Antanimary, in the commune of Vohimanga (Bekily District, Androy).

On 1 May 2020, around 200 people, with several unions and workers groups, demonstrated near the national library in Anosy (Ambalavao, Haute Matsiatra) against workers' rights violations during coronavirus confinement. [size=around 200]
On 1 May 2020, a mob beat and injured a thief in Toliara (Toliary-I, Atsimo Andrefana). [size=no report]

On 4 May 2020, dahalo clashed with police and fokonolona in the locality of Zafimahova, in the commune of Itremo (Ambatofinandrahana, Amoron'l Mania). The dahalo fled, leaving behind what they had earlier stolen from local residents.

On 5 May 2020, dahalo attacked a civilian and his family in Tanandava (Beroroha, Atsimo Andrefana). The dahalo attacked and killed the owner of the house and injured two of the man's family members, and they also stole 12 cows. The fokonolona and the gendarmerie attempted to pursue the dahalo in vain.

On 7 May 2020, dahalo clashed with military forces in Ambalanjanakomby (Maevatanana, Betsiboka). Dahalo had ambushed a military vehicle. 2 dahalo were arrested after the attack. Reports varied on casualty figures from zero to a few.
On 9 May 2020, dahalo clashed with police forces in Talata Volonondry (Antananarivo Avaradrano, Analamanga). Some killings and arrests reported (coded as 3 fatalities).
On 11 May 2020, a communal militia attacked and killed a man and his 2 young grandchildren at Mandarao in Isoanala commune (Betroka, Anosy) over a land dispute.

On 11 May 2020, around 12 dahalo attacked and killed 5 civilians while attempting to steal zebus in Ambodimanga village, in Vondrozo district (Vondrozo, Atismo Atsinanana). The gendarmerie were called but were unable to stop the dahalo.
On 16 May 2020, gendarmerie and dahalo clashed in Ambatsola (Bekily, Androy). 1 dahalo was killed.
On 16 May 2020, a mob attacked and injured two thieves in Antsirabe (Atsirabe 1, Vakinankaratra). [size=no report]
On 23 May 2020, a mass grave of 134 bodies was discovered in Antanandava (Toamasina II, Atsinanana).

On 28 May 2020, students of the University of Barikadimy Toamasina demonstrated by burning tires in Toamasina (Toamasina, Atsinanana). The students were demonstrating due to the payment of scholarships and student assistance that has not been distributed. [size=no report]
On 1 June 2020, dahalo looted zebu from civilians in Ambohimalaza (Ambovombe, Androy). Hundreds of zebus were killed.

On 1 June 2020, locals demonstrated in Toamasina (Toamasina II, Atsinanana) by burning tires and blocking roads. 200 police were deployed to disperse the crowds. The reasons for the demonstration are unclear. [size=no report]
On 1 June 2020, dahalo looted zebu from civilians in Ambitiky and Sarisambo, in Ambavombe district (Ambovombe, Androy). Hundreds of zebus were killed.

On 2 June 2020, dahalo clashed with military and gendarme forces in the forest of Ampotaka, near Ambohimalaza (Ambovombe, Androy) after dahalo looted zebu the day before. 3 dahalo were killed, others were injured, and 285 zebu were recovered.
On 3 June 2020, local residents lynched a suspected murderer to death in Ambararatabe (Tsiroanomandidy, Bongolava). [size=no report]

On 3 June 2020, military forces clashed with dahalo in Tanambao municipality, Isoanala (Betroka, Anosy). The dahalo had attempted to steal cattle, but were chased away by the military. No injuries and/or fatalities reported.

On 3 June 2020, locals demonstrated by burning tires and building barricades in Androranga (Toamasina II, Atsinanana), against coronavirus restriction measures. The demonstrators threw rocks at the police as they attempted to disperse the crowd with tear gas and warning shots. One demonstrator was wounded by the security forces. [size=no report]

On 4 June 2020, police and military forces clashed with dahalo during an attempted cattle raid in Tanambao village (Betroka, Anosy). This was the second attempted raid on cattle in the same week in this location. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 6 June 2020, police forces killed a man and injured 2 women in Ambohipo (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga). The police officers were beating up 2 women in the street when some men attempted to break up the violence, leading to an officer shooting and killing one of the intervening civilians.

On 6 June 2020, a group of local villagers captured and killed 2 suspected thieves as they attempted to loot graves in Antsalova (Antsalova, Melaky). 3 of the others involved in grave robbing escaped. [size=no report]

On 9 June 2020, dahalo clashed with military forces and fokonolona at the Ekonda area in Ambatosoavolo (Ambovombe, Androy). The clash occurred when the dahalo had attempted to steal cattle. 2 dahalo were killed along with 1 fokonolona member and the stolen cattle were returned.

On 10 June 2020, a group of people captured and killed one dahalo in Beapinga village in Bekopaka district (Antsalova, Melaky). A group of dahalo had recently stolen cattle from pastoralists in this area. [size=no report]
On 10 June 2020, 8 dahalo stole cattle from civilians in Beapinga village in Bekopaka district (Antsalova, Melaky).

On 10 June 2020, dahalo clashed with police forces during an attempted attack by dahalo at the Level II Basic Health Center (CSB II) in Taolagnaro (Taolagnaro, Anosy). The dahalo killed 1 young civilian and 3 dahalo were killed by police.

On 11 June 2020, dahalo clashed with gendarmes and military forces in Mahatsinjo (Bekily, Androy). The dahalo stole 80 zebus, but upon being pursued by the military and gendarmes, the dahalo abandoned what they stole. They killed 11 zebus, but no injuries and/or fatalities were reported.
Around 12 June 2020 (as reported), dahalo clashed with fokonolona when the dahalo attempted to steal cattle in Ambatoabo (Taolagnaro, Anosy). 1 dahalo and 1 fokonolona were killed.

On 13 June 2020, around 20 dahalo clashed with fokonolona communal militia members, locally called Zazamena, in Ampasika (Anjozorobe, Analamanga). 1 fokonolona militia member was killed and another injured, along with houses burned.
On 13 June 2020, dahalo abducted, stole money from and killed a husband and wife, 45km from Taolognaro city (Taolagnaro, Anosy).
Around 13 June 2020 (as reported), dahalo looted cattle from civilians near Ambohitompoina (Antanifotsy, Vakinankaratra).

On 14 June 2020, dahalo clashed with fokonolona militia members in Ambalarano (Fenoarivobe, Bongolava) during an attempted zebu raid. 3 civilians were killed, several injured and 1 dahalo was captured.

On 15 June 2020, police and gendarmes clashed with dahalo in Sakamadio (Ikalamavony, Haute Matsiatra) after a group of dahalo tried to free one of their leaders from custody. 2 dahalo were killed in the clash.
On 17 June 2020, gendarmes and dahalo clashed in Analavory (Miarinarivo, Itasy), killing one dahalo. One dahalo was arrested during the attempted cattle raid.

On 17 June 2020, dahalo attacked and looted from civilians, killing a teacher, in Tomramosy near Marotsiraka market (Amboasary-Atsimo, Anosy). The teacher was heading to the Marotsiraka market with the dahalo attacked.

On 17 June 2020, sugar company workers and their children, university students, demonstrated in Antananarivo (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga) against problems within the company and demanded for the CEO to resign. [size=no report]

On 20 June 2020, dahalo attacked and killed a civilian in Ambohimahasoa (Vondrozo, Atsimo Atsinanana). The man was known for defending his family and the commune during previous raids by dahalo, which motivated the dahalo to kill him.
Around 22 June 2020 (week of), Dahalo and gendarmerie clashed in Antondrotsy (Ivohibe, Ihorombe). 2 dahalo were killed in the clash which was prompted by an attempted cattle raid in this location.

Around 23 June 2020 (between 15 and 30 June), gendarmerie and fokonolona clashed with and killed 10 dahalo militia in Ihosy region (Ihosy, Ihorombe). 2 of these deaths coded separately on 22 June. Weapons were recovered. 8 fatalities.
Around 24 June 2020 (week of), dahalo shot and killed a man during a cattle raid in Maevatanana district (Betsiboka).
Around 24 June 2020 (week of), a group of dahalo raided cows from civilians in Betroka district (Anosy).
Around 24 June 2020 (week of), gendarmes attacked and killed a person accused of sorcery and supporting dahalo in Ankaiafo Atsimo (Andilamena, Alaotra Mango).
On 24 June 2020, Dahalo and fokonolana fought each other in Antety Zanadambo, within the province of Amoron I Mania. Weapons were recovered. No injuries and/or fatalities reported.

Around 24 June 2020 (week of), a communal militia from Betroka clashed with police forces near Sakasoa (Betroka, Anosy) following the theft of cattle in this area. The armed group from Betroka had found their stolen cattle in Sakasoa following a theft of cattle by dahalo on the same day (coded separately) and demanded their return. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 4 July 2020, dahalo and police forces clashed in Ambatomirahavavy (Arivonimamo, Itasy). The police were attempting to recover stolen cattle from the night before (coded separately). At least 2 dahalo were arrested. No fatalities reported.
On 5 July 2020, police and dahalo clashed in Mahazoarivo (Isandra, Haute Matsiatra). 1 dahalo was killed. Weapons were recovered.
On 7 July 2020, locals beat up and badly injured a suspected thief in Analamahitsy (Antananarivo Avaradrano, Analamanga). The victim was then taken to the police. [size=no report]

On 8 July 2020, dahalo and fokonolona fought each other during an attempted dahalo cattle raid in Ampoza (Maintirano, Melaky). Some civilian causalities were reported, though unclear if they included fatalities. A few dahalo were arrested and weapons were recovered.
On 8 July 2020, dahalo stole a dozen cattle from civilians in Ananambao area of Marosakoana town (Tsaratanana, Betsiboka).
Around 9 July 2020 (week of), dahalo raided and stole 50 cattle from Marosakoana village (Tsaratanana, Betsiboka).
On 11 July 2020, dahalo stole 50 zebus from villagers in Bekily town (Bekily, Androy). An armed clash followed and 32 zebus were returned (coded separately).

column9: Fokonolona Communal Militia (Madagascar); Military Forces of Madagascar (2019-) Gendarmerie
column17: On 11 July 2020, dahalo fought with police, gendarmerie, and fokonolona in a forest near Bekily (Bekily, Androy). The clash followed a dahalo raid on Bekily town where 50 zebus were stolen (coded separately). 32 zebus were returned and 1 dahalo was killed in the clash.

On 12 July 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and injured a former mayor and his wife in Ambovombe (Ambovombe, Androy). Political tensions are understood to be the motivation for the attack. The attackers were arrested by gendarmes.

On 13 July 2020, locals demonstrated and blocked the path of gendarmerie in Ambovombe (Ambovombe, Androy). Locals wanted to speak with 3 criminals arrested the day before. 2 demonstrators were arrested. [size=no report]
Around 13 July 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed the mayor in Belitsaky commune (Maintirano, Melaky).

On 13 July 2020, students and traders, who are members of the Solidarity of University Leaders of Madagascar (SOLUMA), demonstrated by burning tires and barricading roads in Ambohipo (Antananarivo Renivohitra, Analamanga). The demonstrators were demanding that their former leader be released. Police broke up the demonstration and 3 SOLUMA members were arrested. [size=at least 3]

Around 18 July 2020 (between 17 - 19 July), dahalo stole from civilians in Fieferana Marovazaha (Anjozorobe, Analamanga). They fired weapons to scare residents, stole 16 zebus and burned the rest of the valuables.

Around 20 July 2020 (as reported), a soldier attacked and injured an older man in Toasmina (Toasmina II, Atsinanana) for not wearing his Coronavirus face mask. The older man argued he had just taken it off to eat, but the soldier did not listen and beat him seriously.
On 21 July 2020, a soldier shot and injured a mentally ill citizen for not wearing a Coronavirus mask in Ilakaka (Ihosy, Ihorombe). A demonstration followed against the attack (coded separately).

On 21 July 2020, locals demonstrated by marching down the street demanding justice in Ilakaka (Ihosy, Ihorombe) after a mentally ill man was shot by a soldier for not wearing a Coronavirus mask (coded separately). Gendarmes intervened to disperse the demonstration. [size=no report]
Around 22 July 2020 (week of), dahalo raided cows from residents in Anosibe Infanja (Miarinarivo, Itasy). The dahalo were later arrested. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
Around 22 July 2020 (week of), dahalo raided cows from residents in Sarobaratra Ifanja (Miarinarivo, Itasy). No fatalities and/or injuries reported. The dahalo were later arrested.

Around 22 July 2020 (week of), a group of locals gathered and attempted to carry out mob justice against some suspected dahalo who had raided cattle in Analavory (Miarinarivo, Itasy). Gendarmes and soldiers prevented the group from killing the suspects. [size=no report]

On 22 July 2020, dahalo fought with gendarmes and fokonolona in Ambatomainty village in Ebelo commune (Amoasary-Atsimo, Anosy) after the dahalo stole 180 zebus. 3 dahalo were killed and a few were injured. The dahalo abandoned their stolen zebus and fled.

column9: Fokonolona Communal Militia (Madagascar); Police Forces of Madagascar (2019-)
column17: On 23 July 2020, 25 dahalo fought with gendarmes, police and fokonolona in Kelivaho Betroka municipality (Betroka, Anosy). The clash followed a dahalo raid in the same area a few hours earlier where they stole 25 zebus. In the clash, 5 dahalo were killed and all the zebus returned to their owners.

On 24 July 2020, a vigilante mob beat up and injured a suspected vanilla thief at Antanambao village in Mananara Nord commune (Mananara-Avaratra, Analanjirofo), before handing the suspect over to the police. [size=no report]
Around 25 July 2020 (between 24 - 26 July), dahalo and military clashed in Fenomanana village in Belobaka commune (Mahajanga I, Boeny) after a cattle raid, resulting in two fatalities.
Around 25 July 2020 (between 24 - 26 July), dahalo abducted a baby in Bongolava town, Belobaka commune (Mahajanga I, Boeny).
Around 27 July 2020 (as reported), dahalo clashed with gendarmes and fokonolona in Bekily district (Bekily, Androy). 1 dahalo was killed and 30 zebus were returned to their owners.

On 27 July 2020, dahalo and military clashed in Fenomanana village in Belobaka commune (Mahajanga I, Boeny) for a second day following a cattle raid. Three dahalos were shot dead on the second day of clashes. The cows were returned to their owners.
On 29 July 2020, dahalo stole some cows from Telomirefy Soamihadana village, Faratsiho commune (Faratsiho, Vakinankaratra).
On 29 July 2020, a vigilante group attacked and injured a suspected thief in Ampasika in the district of Anosimasina (Antananarivo Atsimondrano, Analamanga). [size=no report]
Around 29 July 2020 (as reported), dahalo raided 15 zebus from a resident in Tanambao Morafino, Tanambao Tsirandrana commune (Bekily, Androy). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 29 July 2020, 30 dahalo raided and stole 180 zebus from 3 villagers in Ambiadaba, Beraketa commune (Bekily, Androy). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
Around 29 July 2020 (as reported), dahalo raided cattle in Akilimivory (Bekily, Androy). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 30 July 2020, dahalo raided the village of Masakalina (Anjozorobe, Analamanga). They robbed the residents of money and cows. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

Around 31 July 2020 (as reported), Dahalo raided and stole 60 sheep from residents in Belamby village in Manombo commune (Ambovombe, Androy). No fatalities and/or injuries reported. Afterward, there was a clash between gendarmes and dahalo (coded separately).

Around 31 July 2020 (as reported), Dahalo and gendarmes clashed near Belamby village, Manombo commune in Ambovombe district (Ambovombe, Androy). The clash followed a raid on the village earlier that day where the dahalo stole sheep (coded separately). 2 dahalo were killed and one arrested.
On 1 August 2020, a group of locals attacked and killed an alleged thief in Ambondromamy (Ambato Boeni, Boeny). [size=no report]
On 4 August 2020, dahalo and military clashed in Mampikony district (Mampikony, Sofia). 4 dahalo were killed.
On 5 August 2020, 15 dahalo attacked and killed a civilian during a cattle raid in Andranobevava village (Maevatanana, Betsiboka). The dahalo took 3 people hostage and also stole 30 cows.

On 5 August 2020, dahalo clashed with gendarmerie in Betamotamo village (Maevatanana, Betsiboka) following a cattle raid and hostage killing by the dahalo that same day (coded separately). Dahalo fled and abandoned their hostages and cows. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 6 August 2020, dahalo clashed with gendarmerie in Faratsiho commune (Faratsiho, Vakinankaratra). 7 dahalo were arrested. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 7 August 2020, dahalo and gendarmes clashed in Ikalamavony (Ikalamavony, Haute Matsiatra). More than 100 dahalo attacked the gendarmes in vengeance of the death of their leader, who was killed by gendarmes in June. No injuries and/or fatalities recorded.

On 7 August 2020, dahalo and military gendarmerie clashed in Beanana (Maevatanana, Betsiboka). The dahalo were attempting to steal 30 cows when they were confronted by the gendarmerie. 1 civilian was killed. 27 cows were returned to their owners.

On 7 August 2020, military forces clashed with dahalo in Bemagoraka (Tsiroanomandidy, Bongolava). The military killed 2 civilians, injuring one other, burned houses and took 50 cows. This appeared to be a raid on a village where some dahalo were living.
On 9 August 2020, dahalo attacked and killed a civilian and stole his cow in Marofotra village, Maevatanana commune (Maevatanana, Betsiboka).

On 12 August 2020, a mob attacked and killed 3 alleged criminals near Analanana, in Vohemar district (Vohemar, Sava). The 3 killed were accused of poisoning a family and stealing their vanilla. [size=no report].
