column17: At least six jihadists opened fire on a truck from the International Committee of the Red Cross and Crescent, killing one and injuring one. The truck was later found burned down.
Gunmen attacked a Malian military position near Burkina Faso and a firefight ensued, resulting in the death of three militants.
A 16 year old girl was killed by a landmine while herding her sheep near Asongo.
Two armed men on motorcycles attacked a village, firing at the police station and town hall. They killed two civilians and injured a gendarme.
In a suspected militant attack, a bomb was detonated in a private residence, killing one and injuring four. It is unclear whether the intended target was a French national living nearby.
Militants shelled Gao, killing one and wounding three.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Two MINUSMA peacekeepers were injured in a landmine explosion.
Four gunmen on motorbikes stormed a weekly fair, firing shots in the air and then killing a uniformed worker at the Ministry of Water and Forests.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: French special forces killed at least two Al Qaeda militants and injured others in an operation where they rescued a Dutch national who had been kidnapped in 2011.
A Malian military vehicle struck a roadside bomb in the south, killing two soldiers and wounding three others. The attack took place Sunday in Malis Segou region between Niono and Diabaly.

column6: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: The militant Sahara-based Al-Murabitun group, which is led by the Algerian jihadist figure, Mokhtar Belmokhtar, has claimed responsibility for the 15 April attack on a UN camp in Ansongo, Northern Mali, which resulted in the deaths of three people, including civilians, and wounded nine peacekeepers.
3 soldiers were injured, one seriously, after their vehicle hit a mine near Boni.
One civilian was killed after his bike hit an explosive near Aguelhoc.

column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Two drivers were shot dead in an attack on a peacekeeping supply convoy in northern Mali. The attack took place some 15 kilometres (nine miles) from the main city of Gao. A third person was wounded.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUMSMA convoy was attacked by unknown assailants about 30 km west of Gao, leaving the driver dead.
A village chief, Amadou Issa Dicko, was assassinated by two unidentified assailants.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Seven UN peacekeepers were wounded when a mine exploded.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
column17: GATIA pro-government forces retook positions in Menaka near the Niger border. They claim to have been initially attacked by MNLA fighters 40km south of Menaka, and the resulting battle led to overtaking the city.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad militants fired on MINUSMA vehicles near Timbuktu.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad militants opened fire on troops in Goundam, killing two soldiers and a child.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: The Coordination of Movements of the Azawad ambushed armed forces in the central town of Lere, leading to a battle that left 10 militants and 9 soldiers dead. Government troops remain in control of the town.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Dozens of gunmen from the Coordination of Movements of the Azawad stormed a northern town, killing one and taking six hostage.
Four civilians were killed and 28 injured when their minibus drove over a landmine near the Doro locality between Gossi and Gao.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad fighters attacked the town of Dire, and two militants were killed. The town remains under Malian military control.
Thousands marched to call for peace in the north and to express solidarity with the GATIA pro-governent militia.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: The CMA militant group attacked Tenenkou, and the resulting battle with the Malian military left 10 militants and 1 soldier dead and several injured.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: The MINUSMA camp in Kidal was targeted by 6 - 8 mortar shells but did not sustain any material damages or casualties. MINUSMA forces ""responded to the attack.""
A vehicle hit an explosive device near the MINUSMA camp in Kidal and two civilians were injured.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Two peacekeepers were seriously injured when their vehicle struck a landmine near Tenenkou.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: The Coordination of Azawad Movements ambushed Malis defense forces near Tin Telout, killing at least nine and injuring fourteen. Civilians were also caught in the crossfire but casualty numbers are unknown.
Around 200 women marched in Bamako, calling for peace in the north.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Attacks took place between CMA rebel fighters and GATIA pro-government fighters in the northern town of Ikadewan in the Gao area, leaving at least four dead.

Non-violent activity: The Al-Murabitoun jihadist group declared allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria. Later reports indicated that the statement was made by Adnan Abu Walid and rejected by presumed leader Belmokhtar, indicating a potential schism in the Al-Mourabitoun leadership.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column9: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Agreement: Malis government signed a peace accord with three representatives of pro-Bamako militias and two minor members of the CMA rebellion under a team of mediators led by Algeria. The CMA had initialled the deal a day earlier, but its three principal factions did not attend the final signing. This ""Algiers Accord"" calls for the creation of election regional assemblies but not autonomy or federalism for the rebel groups.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Protesters threw rocks at MINUSMA troops in Kidal, professing opposition to Tuareg involvement in a peace deal.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Renewed fighting took place in Menaka between pro-government and separatist groups.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Heavily armed CMA militants fought with GATIA pro-government forces in and around Menaka. At least 24 were injured but the death toll is unknown.

column6: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad
column17: At least 3 Malian soldiers were killed and one injured in an attack by the MAA.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: In a raid in the far northeast, French special forces killed four jihadists, two of whom were key AQIM leaders, including Amada Ag Hama and Ibrahim Ag Inawalen.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Rebels attacked the town of Tin Hama being held by GATIA pro-government troops and briefly took over before the Malian military intervened and chased the rebels out.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Rebels attacked the town of Tin Hama being held by GATIA pro-government troops and briefly took over before the Malian military intervened and chased the rebels out.

column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A gunman set fire to a UN car and then opened fire on a UN residence in Bamako and threw grenades before escaping. He shot and wounded a civilian guard but no troops were injured.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: 6 - 9 civilians, including an aid worker, were killed after fighting near the Tin Hama village. After a battle with rebels, GATIA pro-government troops reportedly handed several civilians over to Malian soldiers who publicly executed them. The Malian government did not confirm the claims and the UN is investigating.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Militants launched a failed six-rocket attack at MINUSMA barraks near Timbuktu. MINUSMA returned fire but not casualties were reported.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: The Coordination of Azawad Movements battled with Malian troops in the town of Tessit, capturing up to 19 soldiers and injuring at least one.
People from the Fulani ethnic group are fleeing the towns of Dioura and Nampala, south of Timbuktu, claiming that the Malian army has been raiding their camps, beating and arresting them.
People from the Fulani ethnic group are fleeing the towns of Dioura and Nampala, south of Timbuktu, claiming that the Malian army has been raiding their camps, beating and arresting them.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Unidentified assailants opened fired on two UN peacekeepers in a clearly marked UN vehicle in Bamako, killing one and wounding another. No group has claimed responsibility and the UN is conducting an investigation.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column9: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Al-Qaida in the Islamic Maghreb launched rockets at a MINUSMA camp while soldiers were negotiating with CMA leaders inside.
More than 200,000 people marched in support of the peace and reconciliation process known as the ""Algiers agreement"" that was signed May 15th.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Three UN troops were wounded when their convoy hit a landmine in the Timbuktu region between Dire and Ber. AQIM later claimed responsibility for the attack.
Armed men assassinated local elected leader Mohamedou el Maouloud Ag Mohamedoun about 100km from Timbuktu.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A rocket fired from a plateau overlooking Gao fell on the nearby MINUSMA camp, causing no casualties.

column6: Movement of the Liberation of Maasina
column17: A group called the Movement of the Liberation of Massina made up primarily of the Fulani ethnic group and possibly linked to Al-Qaida engaged in ""intense fighting"" with government troops in the Massina region. Some claim the government troops have injured, killed and arrested Fulani civilians as a result, but those details have not been verified.
A civilian was kidnapped and shot dead. The CMA claims that the victim was targeted by pro-government groups for his support of their rebellion.
A civilian was killed by armed men traveling in a vehicle near the town of Goundam.
A civilian was reportedly killed by an armed group about 30km north of Timbuktu.
A group from Guinea ""stormed"" the Malian village of Sanafara to carry out illegal gold mining and exchanged fire with Malian genderames for about four hours.

Dozens of Islamist militants on motorcycles attacked security forces in Misseni, killing at least one policeman and wounding two. They raised the flag of Ansar Dine before escaping, as the Malian army sent backup forces. At least two members of the Dawa Islamist sect with suspected ties to Ansar Dine were later arrested in connection with the incident.

column7: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column9: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
column17: Security sources say 14 Al Mourabitoune fighters were killed in clashes with ""Al-Qaida affiliated"" groups near Gao, and that former MUJAO head Adnane Abou El Walid El Sahraoui was seriously injured.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: GATIA pro-government forces withdrew from Menaka to pave the way for a peace deal, allowing the military and MINUSMA peacekeepers to take control.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Agreement: The CMA signed a peace deal known as the ""Algiers Accord"" that the government and loyalist militias signed May 15th.

A group of Ansar Dine Islamists likely from the Peul ethnic group attacked the military outpost of Nara village and were repelled by the military. Twelve were killed including 9 militants and 3 soldiers.
Ansar Dine jihadists attacked the town of Fakola near the border with Ivory Coast. They took control of a section of the town before being chased away by the army. Three jihadists were killed.
Soldiers killed three ""militants"" during a search operation for jihadists in the Sama forest.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: AQIM attacked a MINUSMA convoy on the road between Timbuktu and Goundam, killing at least 6 peacekeepers and wounding 5.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: French special forces killed Al-Qaida leader Ali Ag Wadossene and arrested several others in an operation in the Tigharghar mountains of the Kidal region. Two special forces were wounded.

The Malian army claims to have destroyed a ""jihadist military camp"", during operations which occurred in the Fakola area of the Sikasso region. 3 militants were allegedly killed during these operations. The militants found there were reportedly from various groups, including Ansar Dine.
7 civilians were killed by unidentified gunmen riding on a motorcycle near the border with Burkina Faso in the Kobou area.
6 people were killed by Fulani in Mondoro allegedly connected to a continuation of an ongoing dispute between Fulani and Dogono farmers.

column7: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A Malian armed forces convoy containing MINUSMA vehicles was ambushed by suspected Islamist militias who used IEDs. 1 Malian soldier was wounded, while 1 Malian military vehicles and 2 MINUSMA vehicles were damaged.

column6: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUSMA camp in Aguelhoc was targeted by mortar fire by a suspected Islamist militants. No casualties or damage was reported.
Two Malian soldiers were killed and at least four injured when their convoy was ambushed on the road between Nampala and Diabaly. The military responded and seized a number of light weapons.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: AQIM attacked the National Guard in Gourmas Rharous killing at least 10 and injuring 1. Malian forces later arrested 5 people suspected of involvement with AQIM in coordinating the attack.

Gunmen attacked a Malian military site and were repelled, so they seiged a hotel in Sevare, taking several hostages. In the course of the siege, at least 12 were killed including 5 militants, five soldiers and 2 foreign civilians, including one UN employee (civilian deaths coded separately). El Mourabitoun claimed responsibility and authorities believe the newly formed FLM may also be involved.

Gunmen seize a hotel and several hostages in a siege in Sevare, Mopti. In the course of the siege, at least 12 were killed including 5 militants; five soldiers and 2 foreign civilians, including one UN employee (battle deaths coded separately). El Mourabitoun claimed responsibility and authorities believe the newly formed FLM may also be involved.
Gunmen on motorbikes attacked the village of Gaberi and were fought off by residents. One attacker was killed.
The day after a battle with residents of Gaberi, unidentified gunmen returned and attacked again, leaving 10 dead.
3 soldiers were killed and 4 injured when their vehicle hit an explosive device near Diabozo. The attack was claimed by El Mourabitoun.
Two armed men opened fired at police officers at a roundabout in Bamako, injuring at least one police officer and one civilian.
Jihadists linked with the new group Macina Liberation Front killed a village imam who refused their repeated attempts to recruit him.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: The CMA and GATIA exchanged fire. It is unclear what initiated the clash. No casualties were reported.
Seven people were killed ""in the north"" when nomadic and sedentary communities carried out tit-for-tat attacks on over two days.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: CMA and GATIA continued to clash for a second day in the Kidal region, near Touzik, Anefis, and Amassine. At least 10 were killed and several injured over three days of fighting.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: CMA and GATIA continued to clash for a second day in the Kidal region, near Touzik, Anefis, and Amassine. At least 10 were killed and several injured over three days of fighting.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: CMA and GATIA continued to clash for a second day in the Kidal region, near Touzik, Anefis, and Amassine. At least 10 were killed and several injured over three days of fighting.
Seven people were killed ""in the north"" when nomadic and sedentary communities carried out tit-for-tat attacks over two days.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: CMA and GATIA clashed for a third day near Kidal - in Touzik and Amassine. At least 10 were killed and several injured over three days of fighting.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: CMA and GATIA clashed for a third day near Kidal, in Touzik, Amassine, and Anefis. At least 10 were killed and several injured over three days of fighting.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: On a third day of fighting, GATIA took over the town of Anefis which was previously held by CMA. At least 10 were killed and several injured over the 3 days.
Around 200 people peacefully protested against heavy taxation, and police arrested 17 people for ""inciting revolt"", including a village chief and a radio director.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Two MINUSMA peacekeepers were injured when their vehicle hit a landmine.
Two soldiers were killed in a pre-dawn attack against an army checkpoint outside Timbuktu.
Militants killed one soldier and wounded seven in an ambush near Diafarabe.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Two UN peacekeepers were injured in an ambush on the Gao-Anefis Road, about 15km from Gao

At least one police officer was killed and another injured when armed men on a motorcycle opened fire at a security post. They also burned the office of the village administrator and two vehicles. The attackers are suspected members of the Front for the Liberation of Macina.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: After the pro-government GATIA forces withdrew from Anefis, their movements in the Kidal region led to clashes with Tuareg separatists from the CMA. No information is available regarding deaths and injuries.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: CMA forces took control of Anefis without a fight after GATIA fighters left the city earlier in the week.
Armed men killed forest guard.
FLM attacked the village of Bi/Nangabara near the border with Burkina Faso, killing two policemen and two civilians.
""Two armed men on motorcycles shot at a private vehicle whose driver was a national staff member of an INGO. He was seriously injured in the attack but was able to reach a clinic.""
One person was killed and four kidnapped in a village in the Gao region when Tuareg separatists targeted family members of Tuaregs aligned with the government.
""Jihadists"" with suspected ties to FLM killed injured several and killed 3, including an elected official.

column9: Police Forces of Mali (2013-2020) Prison Guards
column17: Armed men attacked the Camp I gendarmerie in Bamako, allowing 9 prisoners to escape, including 8 who were connected to the 2012 coup.
Three French special forces were injured in a landmine blast somewhere in ""the north"".

column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: After a civilian car hit a landmine 40-100km from Gao, militants armed with rocket launders and machine guns attacked their vehicles being guarded by the military. MINUSMA sent two vehicles which were then set on fire. A total of 6 were killed.

Ansar Dine leader Esse Ag Warakoule was killed during the week of October 11th in a French military operation in northern Mali, near the Algerian border. One of his children was also killed in the operation.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Agreement: Ifoghas and Imghad clans along with CMA and pro-government groups signed a new peace agreement.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A landmine exploded, kililng three civilians and wounding two peacekeepers near Tessalit.

column16: Maghreb Emergent; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); RFI
column17: The military killed 7 FLM jihadists and injured 10 in clashes near the Tiebanda forest near the border with Burkina Faso as part of the new military operation ""Seno"".
Suspected jihadists opened fire on a canoe, injuring one, presumably in response to the militaries arrest of 4 suspected jihadists that day.
An explosive device was set off at the entrance of a building for an NGO in Menaka, causing material damage.
Arrests: Military forces arrested FLM leader Allaye Bocari Dia
One soldier was killed an another injured when FLM attacked their post in Djenne. The attacked was perhaps retaliation for the arrest of an FLM leader the previous day.
The newly formed Al Mourabitoun Battalion group attacked the Radisson Blu hotel, taking more than 170 hostages and killing at least 19 civilians. FLM also claims responsibility.

column9: Military Forces of France (2012-2017); Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Mali special forces with support from French and US military responded to the hostage taking at the Radisson Blu hotel, killing at least two assailants as they released the remaining hostages. At least two military were injured in the fight against the newly formed Al Mourabitoun Battalion group, while FLM also claims responsibility for the attack.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: UN vehicle hit an explosive device about 25 km from Timbuktu, killing one civilian staff member.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Ansar Dine launched a mortar attack on the MINUSMA base in Kidal, killing two peacekeepers and one civilian contractor and injuring at least 14.
Armed men attacked a truck carrying migrants, killing four and wounding six.
Ansar Dine attacked a military base, injuring one soldier and stealing an army vehicle and weapons. Two soldiers reported missing.
Two soldiers injured and one army vehicle stolen when Islamist militants attacked a military post.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Militants shelled UN barracks in Gao. No casualties or damage.
An armed man killed three people outside a Christian radio station.

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: An anti-extremeist unit of Tuareg separatists killed four Ansar Dine militants and imprisoned four others.

column8: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad
column17: French forces killed 12 MAA fighters as they battled what they thought was a jihadist position in the Menaka region.
In the Menaka region, French forces killed about 10 fighters from Al Mourabitoun Battalion over two days of fighting.
In the Menaka region, French forces killed about 10 fighters from Al Mourabitoun Battalion over two days of fighting.
3 killed and 2 wounded in clashes related to a border dispute between Karatou village in Mali and Nielimala in Guinea.

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Ansar Dine attacked CMA in the Kidal region, killing at least 6 and burning vehicles.

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Ansar Dine ambushed a Tuareg separatist vehicle, killing four.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Gunmen abducted a Swiss woman, Beatrice Stockly, from her home for the second time. AQIM later claimed responsibility.
2 brothers were detained by Malian soldiers in the Karena area and were found dead a few hours later. They were believed to have been the targets of summary executions.
Security guard from the Water and Forests Agency killed when Islamists attacked a market.
Two soldiers killed when assailants attacked the aid convoy they were escorting about 11 km from Goundam. One attacker arrested and two killed.
Three gendarmes killed in an ambush by Islamist militants.
4 armed men attacked the village of Kouna, including the gendarmerie. No casualties reported.
Gunmen attacked the residence of the Public Prosecutor in Gao; a guard returned fire, killing one.
Soldier killed in an ambush just east of Timbuktu.
Three soldiers died and two seriously injured when their vehicle hit an explosive device.
Angry mob burned the homes of Tuaregs, claiming the group is responsible for recent attacks on Malian security forces.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Movement of forces: Tensions increased in Mali when Gatia entered in Kidal on February 2. No shots were fired as GATIA militants entered the town with 50 pickups. The CMA still controls the town

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: AQIM attacked a UN military camp. 4 jihadists and 1 Malian soldier killed. 2 arrested but later released.
Three Malian soldiers were killed after their vehicle hit a landmine in the region of Mondoro.
Armed men attacked a customs office, killing three people including one customs officer before destroying the building.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Three Malian soldiers killed and three wounded in ambush by AQIM on the road from Timbuktu to Goudam.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Seven Guinean UN peacekeepers were killed and some 30 wounded when Ansar Dine attacked a MINUSMA base.
French military vehicle hit a landmine near Kidal; no injuries reported.
Members of the tuareg group Ibogholitane assassinated a leader from the Dawsahak group.
Jihadist attack on army position killed two soldiers and injured another.
11 killed in intercommunal conflict between the tuareg groups Dawsahak and Ibogholitane.
Suspected jihadists attacked an army position, killing three soldiers. Two attackers were injured

column6: Mutiny of MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A Chadian soldier with MINUSMA shot and killed his commander and another Chadian MINUSMA soldier. He was immediately arrested.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: At least two armed Islamists of AQMI were killed in a military operation conducted by French forces in Timbuktu area. One of the Islamists killed was Abou al-Nour al-Andalusi, leader of AQMIs battallion Al-Furqan.

An improvised device exploded near a vehicle of the United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) on the Aguelhoc to Tessalit Road in the north of the country on 29 February. No material destruction was reported.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A vehicle of the United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) set off an improvised device on the Aguelhoc to Tessalit Road in the north of the country on 1 March. According to the French radio, six peacekeepers sustained injuries, two seriously. It would be recalled a similar incident happened in the same area in the afternoon of 29 February without any material destruction.

Seven gunmen riding motorbikes attacked a military camp in Misseni. It was later discovered that the attackers were policemen active in the racket business. They were riding motorbikes in civilian clothes when soldiers started to shoot at them near Misseni camp, mistaking them for militants. No injuries reported.

column6: Mutiny of MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Chadian peacekeeper opened fire on his colleagues, killing two and injuring one. The attack comes against the backdrop of tension within the Chadian peace contingent due to disagreements over pay and living conditions.

column9: Police Forces of Mali (2013-2020); EUTM Mali: European Union Training Mission Mali
column17: Two or three gunmen attacked a hotel housing EUTM. Soldiers and police fought back, killing one and arresting two. 17 later arrested in connection.
A man was killed in Yogodoji by alleged Nigerien Islamists.
Arrests: Special forces arrested Souleymane Keita, a ""top jihadist leader"" linked to Ansar Dine.
Two soldiers killed and two injured when vehicle hit mine in Timbuktu region.

At least 8 civilians from the Peul (Fulani) enthnic group reportedly killed by soldiers in March and April 2016. Others detained, beaten, and burned by military after being accused of collaborating with Islamist militants.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Ansar Dine attacked UN base with rockets, causing material losses and several injuries.
7 Fulani men were detained by Malian soldiers in the Sokolo area and were allegedly tortured. 3 of the men later died of their injuries.
7 men were detained by Malian soldiers and tortured in the Diabaly area, resulting in severe injuries to at least one man.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Armed men attacked a convoy of seven MINUSUMA vehicles in the Timbuktu region, injuring three drivers and burning three vehicles.
The lead in a convoy of 60 vehicles approaching Tessalit hit a land mine, killing three French soldiers.
Army repelled an attack, killing one and arresting five.
6 Fulani men were detained by Malian soldiers in the Boulekessi area near Douentza and allegedly tortured.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Arrests: Police arrested Alou Doumbia, the ""number two"" suspect in the recent AQIM attack on Grand-Bassam, Ivory Coast.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)
column17: Three ICRC workers kidnapped and freed one week later.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: At least two civilians killed and seven wounded when riots broke out at the Kidal airport. Rioters set fires and damaged property in protest of recent arrests by French forces and MINUSMA responded with force.
Two soldiers killed and one injured in an ambush.
Unidentified group attacked humanitarian convey from the Danish Council for Refugees, injuring three and burning two vehicles.
Pro-government militia composed of Bambaras killed four members of the Fulani ethnic group loosely suspected of collaborating with extremists.
On May 1, 2016, presumed Katiba Macina militants assassinated two Bambara civilians in Malimana under the pretext that they worked as informants for the Malian army.
Pro-government militia composed of Bambaras killed at least nine members of the Fulani ethnic group attending the funeral of others killed a day or two before.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Two MINUSMA soldiers injured in ambush on Hombori-Gossi route. Vehicles stolen.
An armed group attacked a military camp over the night between Monday and Tuesday, the militaries fired back. Two people remain killed.

A landmine explosion, along the road between Hombori and Gossi,at a military convoy by an alleged jihadist group killed a high-ranking Malian military officer and a soldier. The attack came a day after an assault targeting a Malian camp in Bamba.
The Civil Society Resistance Movements of Gao marched to denounce exclusion in decision-making bodies.
Soldier assassinated overnight in his house

column6: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Elderly man reportedly beaten as he was arrested in conjunction with an attack on MINUSMA soldiers. He later died in custody.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Ansar Dine ambushed MINUSMA convoy, killing six Chadian peacekeepers. Three attackers arrested.
Armed men attacked a humanitarian vehicle and kidnapped two Malian NGO workers and their driver.
Opposition groups and associations marched to denounce poor governance in the north.
One soldier killed and four wounded in attack by armed men.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Three UN vehicles hit roadside bomb. 2 soldiers injured.
Armed men attacked a vehicle of the Orange Mali company. Driver presumed dead.
Five soldiers killed and four injured in mine explosion and subsequent ambush.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Five peacekeepers killed and one injured in ambush near town of Sevare.
Protesters marched to demand implementation of the Algiers Peace Accord.
Protesters in Timbuktu burned tires and ""besieged"" town hall to demonstrate against military recruitment policies.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: AQIM attack on UN base killed a peacekeeper and a civilian de-mining expert and seriously wounded several others.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
column17: A member of the MNLA was kidnapped by AQIM in the Ber area near Timbuktu. He is later killed

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Pro-government militias clashed. At least 8 killed, several injured, and several taken prisoner.
Armed men attacked a check-point, injuring two soldiers.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: HCUA: High Council for the Unity of Azawad
column9: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Agreement: Armed groups and government officials agreed to put in place provisional authorities to govern five regions in the north.
""Jihadists"" opened fire on the village of Mankena, killing two civilians.
A gendarmeri station was attacked by Ansar Dine fighters in Gossi.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: HCUA: High Council for the Unity of Azawad
column17: A representative of the HCUA was killed in Ber. AQIM claimed responsibility.
At least 14 killed and more than 40 injured in clashes over land dispute between Koussouma and Mougna, near the town of Djenne.
Military convoy came under attack near Timbuktu. At least three soldiers killed and one injured.
Armed men killed former separatist leader as he left a friends home.
Two armed men on motorcycles killed two gendarmes and wounded a soldier.

Two Malian soldiers were killed on Saturday 9 July following an attack by armed men ""wearing turbans"" in a locality near the border with Burkina Faso. Authorities said the gunmen arrived early Saturday in a white pickup truck, opened fire on a military checkpoint and stole a military vehicle in the town of Dinangourou.
Deputy mayor of the Wouro-Mody, Kola H. Dia, was killed on Monday by unidentified attackers.

Four demonstrators were killed and 35 wounded after a protest turned violent in northern Mali on Tuesday. Demonstrators said security forces opened fire when hundreds of young people set off on a banned march in the city of Gao.
Ongoing youth protests despite the interdiction of security forces due to troubles which caused 4 dead and 35 wounded.

Hundreds of youths in Bamako and Tombouctou have protested following the violent repression in Gao on Tuesday, which caused the killed of four protesters. People marched with slogans ""Je suis Gao"" and "" Youth of Gao, we are together"".

Hundreds of youths in Bamako and Tombouctou have protested following the violent repression in Gao on Tuesday, which caused the killed of four protesters. People marched with slogans ""Je suis Gao"" and "" Youth of Gao, we are together"".
Northerners residing in Bamako held a peaceful protest to express solidarity with Gao, after protesters were recently killed there.
3 suspected Islamist militants broke into a house in the Boumboum area of Douentza and killed one person over his alleged collaboration with the military.
Armed group raided military camp, killing 17 soldiers, wounding 37, and taking 6 prisoners. Macina Front claimed responsibility.

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: At least three killed in attack on CMA post about 30km north of Ber.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: CMA and GATIA battled for control of Kidal for two days; at least 16 killed and 17 wounded. By July 23rd, GATIA was driven from the city and UN presence noted.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: CMA and GATIA battled for control of Kidal for two days; at least 16 killed and 17 wounded. By July 23rd, GATIA was driven from the city and UN presence noted.
Arrests: Near Wagadou forest, special forces arrested Mahamoud Barry, alias Abou Yehiya, a top commandor of Ansar Dine.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Clashes led to death of at least six CMA fighters.
Army vehicle hit an IED just west of Gossi, killing two soldiers and wounding three.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: AQIM assassinated military officer Hamatta Ag Oumalha Ansary outside of his home.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: UN peacekeeper injured when vehicle struck explosive device near Kidal city.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: UN peacekeeper killed and four injured when vehicle hit an explosive device and gunfire 11 km south of Aguelhoc-Anefis. Claimed by FLM.
Ansar Dine claims FLM ambushed supply convoy of Malian soldiers near Tenenkou. One militant killed and five soldiers missing, later found dead in Niger river.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Less than three hours after a roadside bomb struck and killed a UN soldier, another UN vehicle hit a bomb 2km from the base near Kidal. No injuries; Ansar Dine later claimed responsibility.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: HCUA: High Council for the Unity of Azawad
column9: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Fighting resumed between GATIA and HCUA. No casualties reported.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: AQIM allegedly attacked and killed 5 GATIA members near Tabakort in response to the death of an AQIM member by Gatia on July 31.
An IED attack targeting a French armored vehicle outside Abeidara was claimed by Ansar Dine. No casualties were reported.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Ansar Dine claimed to have fired rockets or mortars at the joint MINUSMA-French base at Amachach near Tessalit. No casualties were reported.
After Ansar Dine fired mortars at a joint MINUSMA-French base in Amachach, they claim to have planted an IED which hit a French patrol sent out to scan the area, killing 2 soldiers.
Hundreds protested the recent arrest of radio presenter Rasbath. Police fired tear gas and bullets, and protesters responded by throwing blunt objects; at least one protester killed and 11 injured.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Local sources claimed that French forces clashed with AQIM fighters in Tabakort.

Ansar Dine claims to have attacked a Malian military checkpoint in Mopti. Their statement says they fired on the post which caused the soldiers there to retreat, before stealing motorcycles and weapons.

A clash between herders and farmers from the Fulani ethnic group left 5 dead and 7 wounded at Tabital Pulaaku in the Tenenkou area of Mopti. One militia ambushed another looking for stolen animals in the village of Tekere Finadji.
Malian soldiers were ambushed by a suspected Islamist militia near Boni. Two of their vehicles were captured and burned.

column6: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A UN vehicle hit an IED near Ansongo.
Suspected Ansar Dine fighters attacked a military post in the Boulkessi area, near Mondoro. No casualties were reported.
Suspected Ansar Dine fighters attacked a police sation in the Bandigara area in the Mopti region.

Ansar Dine claimed responsibility for an attack on a military checkpost in the town of San. They stormed the building, stole weapons and motrocycles, and burnt it down before retreating. No casualties were reported.

column16: Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Long War Journal
column17: About 40 suspected Ansar Dine fighters attacked Boni and forced the retreat of Malian military forces to the south of the city. The Islamists, some of whom had been waiting in the town for reinforcements before the attack, planted a flag in the town and ransacked administrative offices and a security post. No casualties were reported.
The Malian army retook Boni from suspected Ansar Dine fighters which took it the day before. They escaped the town with a local official they had taken hostage.

column6: ANSIPRJ: National Alliance for the Protection of the Fulani Identity and the Restoration of Justice
column17: A recently created group, ANSIPRJ, claim responsibility for an ambush in Boni which claims the lives of three Malian soldiers.

In mid-September a scholar of the Quran living in Sofara was killed for his alleged collaboration with the Malian army. Witnesses said that soldiers had visited his house several times while on patrol in the area where militants also operate.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: GATIA attacked a CMA position in the Intachdayte area of Kidal. The CMA claimed to have lost 6 fighters, while 12 people were allegedly killed overall in the violence.
A Malian soldier was killed and 4 wounded in an ambush by a suspected Islamist militia between the towns of Gossi and Doro. A military vehicle and a tank were also destroyed during the attack.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: A national guardsmen was executed by AQIM in Timbuktu. The circumstances of his capture were not reported.
A Malian soldier and a civilian were killed in an allegedly Islamist militant ambush in Timbuktu.

column7: URD: Union for the Republic and Democracy
column17: According to the police, at least 2,000 people (opposition est. 100,000) engaged in a march in Bamako called by Malis opposition to demand the return of former Malian Presdient Amadou Toumani Toure, and to protest against a new electoral law and alleged state censorship. Opposition leader Soumaila Cisse of the URD spoke during the event, while former prime minister Modibo Sidibe was also present. Police seem to have been present but did not intervene.
A civilian was killed by a landmine in the Aguelhok area.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Ansar Dine fighters claimed a Grad rocket attack on a UN base in the Aguelhok area. No casualties were reported but a truck was destroyed. A second round of firing using mortars later in the day did no damage. After the first round of shelling, a Chadian patrol sent out to find the culprits hit an IED claimed by Ansar Dine. One peacekeeper was killed in the blast and at least 5 were seriously wounded; one later died of his injuries. Finally, an ambulance belonging to the Chadian MINUSMA contingent was hit by an IED as it went to pick up injured from the earlier IED. 8 people were injured during the events in total.
At least 2 Malian soldiers were killed and 2 injured when their vehicle hit a land mine in the Timbuktu area. No group claimed responsibility.

column7: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: A Malian soldier was killed during an attack on civilians being escorted by the military along the Goundam-Timbuktu road by suspected al Furqan Battalion (AQIM) fighters. 2 civilians were also injured in the assault and 2 assailants arrested.
About 1,000 people demonstrated in Bamako to demand an end to legal action against a popular radio host.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column7: HCUA: High Council for the Unity of Azawad
column17: The military leader of the HCUA, a member of the CMA coalition, was killed when his vehicle hit a mine in the Kidal after a meeting at MINUSMAs offices in the area.
6 French soldiers were lightly wounded when their vehicle hit an IED or mine north of the Abeibara area.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A suspected Islamist suicide bomber detonated his vest in an attempted attack on Swedish MINUSMA peacekeepers in Timbuktu on the night of Oct.10. No casualties were reported however.

4 soldiers were killed during an ambush by suspected Macina Liberation Front gunmen (based on similar attacks by the group), which began after one of their vehicles hit a landmine . The attack took place as their convoy was traveling between Diabaly and Nampala. 9 soldiers were also seriously wounded.
A nurse was killed when unidentified gunmen opened fire on a vehicle belonging to a health centre in the Dimamou area of Mopti. Jihadist militants were suspected in the attack.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: AQIM abducted the chief of Kel Ansar Tuareg militia end October 2016 on suspicion of collaboration with Malian security forces. He was released by JNIM - a newly formed Al Qaida entity - early May 2017.
3 civilians were killed when unidentified gunmen attacked a toll post in Dialakoroba. The assailants allegedly shouted ""Allahu Akbar"" during the events.

The Mujahideen attacked a French barrack in the city of Kidal with several shells and missiles. No casualties were reported, but two Bangladeshi helicopters were damaged by the rockets. Ansar Eddine claimed responsibility for the attack.

Non-violent activity: On 30 October 2016 al-Qaedas rival Islamic State group (IS) reported it had received a pledge of allegiance by ""Al-Murabitun"" under the leadership of Abu-al-Walid al-Sahrawi, while part of Al-Murabitun remains loyal to al-Qaeda.
Hundreds of people marching in protest against the appointment of the interim authorities in the North of Mali

A French soldier was killed by a landmine. On the same day, a third French vehicle was hit by an IED near Kidal. All three were claimed by Ansar Dine. Ansar Dine claimed responsibility for the attack. The killing of this soldier raised the French victims in Mali to 16, since January 2013.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column9: Tuareg Ethnic Group (Mali); Al Furqan Battalion
column17: Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM), on Friday night released a video showing the execution of 4 people, including two Tuareg captives and two other Malians, Mohamed Ould Beih and El-Hussein, accused of collaboration with the French military forces in Mali to fight the jihadists. Location unidentified.

Ansar Dines forces attacked a military camp in Gourma Rhaous, in Tombouctou, burning military equipment and temporarily taking control over the outpost. Additionally, the group claimed to capture 5 vehicles, burned another 6, and captured at least one DShK machine gun. It also reported that one of its own fighters was killed in that attack.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column16: AFP; Long War Journal; Al Akhbar (Egypt)
column17: A UN peacekeeper from Togo and two Malian civilians were killed Sunday at around 10:30 am (1030 GMT) when a MINUSMA logistics convoy was the target of a complex attack 45 kilometres (30 miles) north of Douentza, in the Mopti region. After a mine or improvised explosive device was detonated and the attackers opened fire on the convoy. Many sources reported Ansar Dine has claimed the responsibility while on Nov. 8 the Al-Akhbar website reports El Mourabitoune has also claimed responsibility for detonating a bomb that targeted Malian army truck although there are no more confirmations about.
An IED blast hit a French vehicle in the Abeibara area near Aguelhok. Ansar Dine has claimed responsibility.

An armed Islamist group executed the head of the village of Diaba. One villager said he believed the killing was a warning to the community to not work with the Malian army, whose presence had recently been reinforced in the area.

column9: Police Forces of Mali (2013-2020) Prison Guards
column16: Twitter; Long War Journal; Maghreb Emergent; AP; AFP
column17: A policeman and a Malian prison officer were missing Monday, allegedly abducted, after an attack by Ansar Dine on the night of Sunday to Monday against the Malian town of Banamba. Two vehicles of the Gendarmerie were seized by the gunmen. According to the sources, the attackers arrived in Banamba ""aboard a dozen vehicles"" were immediately divided into three groups. One group attacked the local gendarmerie, another group attacked the jail to free prisoners, and a third headed a bank on site to force the safe. 21 inmates were released from a prison. One of the two missing men was found on Nov. 8 while the second on Nov. 9.
An international NGO convoy was attacked Monday night Nov. 7 near Timbuktu, at ten kilometers of Tounka, and the vehicle stolen. The toll is three dead in the shooting.
Two Malian soldiers were wounded when members of Al-Mourabitoun on motorcycles attacked an army position near Gao.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Ansar Dine attacked on Wednesday a convoy of armed Tuareg Tribe in the Kidal region. Three fighters of Gatia were killed. The attack took place in the locality of Tisawached (Kidal region), not far from the Algerian border.
A candidate for local elections was kidnapped in the Koro region on voting day.
5 Malian soldiers transporting ballot boxes were killed and others wounded during an ambush by suspected Islamist fighters in the Douentza area. Other sources said the CMA carried out the attack.

An Islamist militia attacked the town of Dilli, killing one civilian and stealing 2 ambulances before heading for the Mauritanian border. This occurred in the evening following local elections in Mali.
Property destruction: Ballot boxes were seized and burned in Timbuktu, as well as other cities in the north.

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: 4 Malian soldiers were killed and several others injured during an ambush by suspected CMA fighters in the Bambara-Maounde area.

column6: ANSIPRJ: National Alliance for the Protection of the Fulani Identity and the Restoration of Justice
column17: A Peul ethnic militia, the National Alliance for the Protection of the Peul (Fulani) Identity, have agreed to give up their arms and join the reconciliation process.
Ansar Dine claimed an IED attack against French forces in the Abeibara locality. No casualties were reported.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: AQIM claimed a grad rocket attack on a French military base at Timbuktu airport. None of the rockets landed in the perimeter of the base however.

column7: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: The Al Mourabitoun Battalion, a sub-group of the AQIM, claimed a suicide car bombing which targeted a UN facility at Gao airport. No one was injured besides the bomber. Another car bomb was allegedly detonated remotely around the same time.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: A GATIA vehicle hit an IED in Kidal, killing 5 of its members. Ansar Dine is suspected in planting the explosive.

A lookout, who turned out to be a minor, was killed by a French helicopter patrol near Tigabatene, 60km from Tessalit. The patrol was looking for people planting roadside explosives after a few French vehicles had been attacked over the past month.
On 1 December, unknown gunmen attacked a civilian transport bus near Gringale, wounding seven passengers including three severely, Malian soldiers were among the passengers on board the bus.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: 2 people were killed in clashes between suspected CMA and GATIA fighters between Tessit and Intillit near the Nigerien border.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: On 3 December, a convoy of GATIA combatants entered the village of Inguizal in the circle of Tidarmene, several shops were looted and civilians mistreated. Several property also stolen in the area in the days that followed.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: On 4 December, a convoy of GATIA combatants entered the village of Tidarmene, seized three vehicles and five motorbikes, two other vehicles were damaged, three shops were also looted and two civilians abducted, they were released a few hours later.

column8: Police Forces of Mali (2013-2020) Prison Guards
column17: At least one prison guard was killed, another person injured, and between 50-93 prisoners released in an attack on a jail claimed by Ansar Dine.
4 Malian soldiers were killed by unidentified assailants who ambushed a convoy headed to Sevare from Boni.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Non-violent activity: The main Tuareg rebel coalition suspended its participation in the peace process, accusing the Malian government of failing to prevent recent violence and lack of progress on promised reforms.
5 men from Isseye village were detained and later executed by Malian soldiers near Yirma.

Two other common graves previously reported on by Human Rights Watch have yet to be investigated by the Malian authorities. The second grave allegedly contains five men from Isseye village detained and executed by soldiers on December 19, 2016
5 men were detained by Malian soldiers in Isseye village in the Douentza area. Their bodies were allegedly later discovered in a mass grave near the village.
A Malian police officer was killed and another wounded in an attack on a police station at Saye in Mopti.
Unidentified gunmen occupied the Boni area in Mopti without violence.
A French woman who runs a humanitarian organization focused on helping children was kidnapped in Gao by Al Mourabitoune
Unidentified gunmen attacked the Malian gendarmerie in Gossi. The gendarmerie offices and a hanger were set on fire during the attack.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
column17: ""One security guard working for the ICRC was shot and killed during an altercation with two men on a motorcycle in Gao.""

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)
column17: An ICRC official was killed in Gao by unidentified assailants.
The Mourabitoun Battalion claimed responsibility for an attack on FAMA soldiers at a checkpoint in Ansongo. No casualties reported.
A Malian military patrol was ambushed in Fafa village by unidentified assailans. After a gunfight, 3 assailants were arrested and handed over to the local gendarmerie.
On 9 January, unknown gunmen abducted three young men of the Imghad tribe in the area of Tidarmene.
On 10 January 2017, a suspected cattle thief was killed by unidentified armed group between Dala and Kerena in the Douentza area (Moptil).

5 Malian soldiers were killed and 3 wounded when their vehicle hit a roadside explosive while traveling between Diafarabe and Macina. The explosive was suspected of being planted by Islamist militants who regularly attack Malian security forces in the area.
Arrests: French military forces arrested the mastermind of the Grand Bassam (Ivory Coast) attack which left 19 people dead in March 2016. The arrest was made in the village of Gossi in Mali.
2 people were killed by an IED blast outside the ANPE office in Kidal.
An explosion involving either an IED or Grad rocket was reported in Gao. No details about target or injuries.

column6: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: AQIM claimed a grad rocket attack targeting French forces at Timbuktu airport. It was not clear if the rockets caused any injuries/damage.
Teachers working in northern Mali in areas such as Timbuktu, Gao, Kidal, menaka and Taoudeni have started limited service over demands for risk premiums.
A Malian army checkpost was attacked in Goundam by unidentified armed group. 1 person was killed, 4 injured and a vehicle and arms seized.
An employee of the mayor's office in Salem, north of Timbuktu, was abducted by an unidentified group.
The mayor of Boni was assassinated by unidentified gunmen.

column7: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column9: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: At least 55 people were killed (including a bomber) and 100 wounded in a suicide car attack at a military camp in the northern city of Gao in Mali. The area houses government soldiers and armed groups who conduct mixed patrols under a UN-brokered peace deal aimed at curbing violence in the region. The perpetrators were Al Mourabitoun allied with AQIM. In mid-Feb MINUSMA revised the death toll down from 77 to 54.
An IED attack against the Malian army was reported in the Goma-Coura area of Diabaly. Significant casualties were reported (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
3 people arrested by FAMA soldiers at Yirma were allegedly executed in front of the villagers of Banguel.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: 13 GATIA members and one suspected CMA fighter were killed in an alleged CMA attack on GATIA fighters in the Tin Essako area of the Kidal region.

Two other common graves previously reported on by Human Rights Watch have yet to be investigated by the Malian authorities. The first, according to four witnesses from Yirima (35km from Boni), allegedly contains three members of an extended family detained by soldiers on January 21 and later executed.
3 Malian soldiers were killed in a landmine explosion in the Diabaly area.
Property destruction: Unknown gunmen entered a Chinese-owned entreprise 10km away from Ke-Macina and damaged 5 vehicles.
3 Malian soldiers were killed by a landmine while traveling on the Gao-Gossi axis.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUSMA peacekeeper was killed in a mortar attack on a UN camp in Aguelhok. 2 other peacekeepers were seriously injured in the attack.
1 Malian soldier was killed and others wounded in an IED attack on the Hombori-Douentza road.
An angry mob ransacked and looted the shop of an alleged confessed murderer in the Djikoroni Para district of Bamako.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUSMA vehicle hit a IED while traveling along the Gao-Gossi road, causing no injuries.
The mayor of Mondoro was killed in front of his home in Douentza by unidentified assailants.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a checkpoint in the Somadougou area. 2 civilians were wounded after the attack.
A local official was killed by unidentified armed assailants in Dinangourou.
Clashes between presumed Ansaroul Islam members and Dogon militia on the outskirts of Douna, Mopti not far from the Burkina Faso border, one Dogon killed and Dogon militia forced to retreat.
3 people were injured in an attack by unidentified armed motorcycle riders on a market in the Zinda area of Gao.
The mayor of Mondoro was killed by unidentified assailants.
1 gendarmerie officer was killed and 2 injured in an attack on the Djiandiori-Tenenkou road. Ansar Dine claimed responsibility.
4 Malian soldiers were killed and 3 wounded in an attack by an unidentified armed group on their positions in Menaka. At least 2 attackers were injured in the attack.
Property destruction: 3 trucks belonging to the French construction company SATOM were burned by unidentified gunmen in Niafunke.
At least 2 gendarmes were killed and 3 people wounded, including 1 civilian, in an attack by unidentified assailants on a checkpoint in Marina, near Mopti.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: 4 Chadian MINUSMA peacekeepers were wounded after their vehicle hit an IED on the Aguelhok-Tessalit road.
A Colombian nun was kidnapped by suspected FLM gunmen near Koutiala in the Sikasso region. The Colombian government claimed the FLM was responsible in April 2017.
A Malian soldier was killed and 4 others wounded when his vehicle hit a mine on the Goundam-Timbuktu road.
Violent protests were reported in Senou, just outside Bamako, where a crowd threatened to burn down the mayor's office. It was not reported what the people were protesting.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Property destruction: 4 trucks chartered by MINUSMA were reportedly burned between Boni and Hombori by unidentified gunmen. There were no reports of clashes or injuries.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Looting: The CMA has accused GATIA of stealing their vehicles in the Menaka area and subjecting residents fo violence. GATIA rejected the claims of violence done to the population. The Malian government confirmed the thefts of vehicles but not the violence.
A Malian military officer was shot 4 times by unidentified assailants and evacuated by French Barkhane troops. He later died of his injuries.
Alleged Peuhl Islamist fighters killed a Bambara shopkeeper near the town of Ke-Macina
Malian military forces allegedly killed 4 unarmed villagers and arrested several others in Dialloube village. The area is known for being frequented by militants, including Ansar Dine affiliates.
On 11 February 2017, unidentified assailants opened fire on 2 agents of the Water & Forests Department between Timissa and Djenne (Tominian, Segou), killed a guide and wounded the station chief.

column16: Afriquinfos; HRW; Nord Sud Journal; Xinhua; AFP
column17: 8 Fulani villagers were killed ic Ke-Macina commune, including 6 in Fokobougou, 1 in Diawaribougou, and 1 in Nawel-Baba, by members of the Bambara ethnic group after a Bambara trader was killed in Diawaribougou the day before. The violence was stopped by Malian soldiers who intervened, but shortly after more people were reported killed. The final fatality count was at least 21 killed. Other sources say as many as 32 more were killed. At least 16 people were reported injured.

One militant was killed and 20 arrested during a Malian military operation in the Dialloube area that Ansar Dine affiliated militants are reported to frequent. Other people have also been reported missing following the operation.
Local youths in Gossi captured bandits in their area and handed them over to Malian soldiers.
4 soldiers were wounded when their vehicle hit an IED about 30km from Hombori.
People protested against the designations for the Interim Authorities in Timbuktu.
An ambush in Tonka by unidentified assailants resulted in 5 soldiers injured and 1 killed. 2 later died of their injuries.

9 traders, most of whom were from the Bozo ethnic group, were killed by armed Islamist militants in the Monimpe area, near Macina. The attack is believed to be related to recent ethnic violence in the area.
2 people were abducted in Dialloube by suspected Islamist militants.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: 4 MINUSMA peacekeepers were wounded when their vehicle hit an IED 50km south of Aguelhok.
One person was killed and 15 wounded when a bus hit an IED between Gossi and Hombori.
2 suspected Islamist militants were killed and 3 arrested in an early-morning operation by French Barkhane forces in Tin Afaghout in the Boughessa area.
At least 3 Fulani herders were killed by Dozo hunters in the Ke-Macina area.
10 Dozo hunters (Bambara) were killed and 13 wounded when they were ambushed by Islamist militants in the Diabaly area.
Dozens of allegedly ""well-organized"" young Muslims ransacked bars and liquor stalls in Timbuktu during a protest against alcohol.

column7: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad (Splinter Faction)
column17: Elements of the CMA2 (dissenters from the peace process) picketed the regional assembly in Timbuktu demanding that they be involved in decision-making and other initiatives related to Timbuktu region.
About 2,000 armed members of the Ganda Izo vigilante group picketed the regional assembly to demand the cancellation of the implementation of interim authorities.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Non-violent activity: Ansar Dine, al-Mourabitoun and AQIM have announced their merger into a new group, ""Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimeen,"" which translates to ""Group in Support of Islam and Muslims"".
Youths in Koiratao (Niafunke) repulsed an attack by armed bandits. They captured one and handed him over to the army.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: The MINUSMA camp in Aguelhok was hit by rockets/mortars. No group claimed responsibility.
2 civilians were killed and 3 abducted by suspected Islamist militants in Funtonde, 8km from Boni.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: The MINUSMA camp in Tessalit was attacked by rockets and mortars. No group claimed responsibility.

column7: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (CMA)
column8: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (Platform)
column17: 2 civilians and an MAA-CMA officer were killed in an attack by MAA fighters from a different faction on a Malian army checkpoint outside Timbuktu.

column16: RFI; AP; Menastream; Nord Sud Journal
column17: At least 11 soldiers were killed and 4 injured in an attack by Ansaroul Islam fighters on an army position in the Boulkessi area of Mopti. 2 Ansaroul Islam fighters were reported wounded.
Armed groups took control of Timbuktu to prevent Malian interim authorities from being installed in the area. No clashes were reported.

At least 3 people were injured in an attack by unidentified assailants on two buses owned by a Mauritanian company which were travelling from Bamako to Nouakchott. The bus carried people of various nationalities.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Unidentified assailants attacked a GATIA checkpost in Tin-Hama. The attack was repelled without reported injuries.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: At least 4 people were killed, including 2 soldiers and 2 civilians, in an attack by 9 suspected AQM fighters on Fafa. 2 military vehicles were also stolen by the attackers. Some people were also reported injured. Other sources said 3 civilians had been killed.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: GATIA's commander Almahdi Ag Lengach was killed in Menaka by 3 unidentified assailants who arrived on motorcycles.
One Bambara community member was killed and several wounded during intercommunal violence reported in the Dogofri-Diabaly area.

column6: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
column17: Unidentified assailants killed an MNLA officer in the Ouzayane valley north of Abeibara.
A Bambara hunter was killed in an ambush by unidentified gunmen in the Tougou area of Segou. Intercommunal violence targeting Bambara was recently reported in the area.
A Malian gendarmerie post was attacked in the Tonka area.

In late March 2017, gendarmes in Sevare allegedly beat seven men from a village near Djenne, including a Quranic teacher. 'During the night, a few of the gendarmes came into our cell and kicked and beat us. One man broke a few ribs and two others bled from their noses,' one detainee said.
A young Fulani shepherd was allegedly killed by Bambara militiamen in Niono district of Segou.

column9: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: RFI; AFP; Nord Sud Journal; Long War Journal
column17: At least 10 people were killed and 14 others injured in clashes between Bambara and Fulani in the Diabaly area of Niono. The clashes were either due to a Fulani shepherd being killed or Fulani cattle rustling. AQM militants claimed that they joined the fight and supported the Fulani.
3 people were lightly wounded after their transport truck hit an IED in the Tabrichat area near Tessalit.
At least 3 people were killed at Diaka in Tenenkou Cercle in fighting between Fulani and Bambara.
Unidentified assailants robbed two buses near Intahaka after leaving Gao. Some of the passengers who resisted were wounded, and one later died in hospital.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: AQM claims to have killed and wounded dozens of Dozos (Bambara hunters) and seized/destroyed motorcycles during clashes in the Macina area (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A Malian army vehicle hit an IED between Manga and Koina, killing 2 soldiers and severely wounding several others. AQM claimed responsibility for a blast in the area.
3 people were killed and 4 wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants on a Malian army post in Almoustarat. Vehicles were also seized by the attackers.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: AQM claims to have taken control of a checkpost in Djenne.
A customs post in Ouelessebougou was attacked by suspected Islamist militants. At least one customs officer was killed and another wounded.

Malian soldiers raided Kouakourou in the Kewa area and clashed with alleged Islamist militants, killing 10. At least 8 other alleged Islamist militants were arrested, while 30 others were also reported arrested (not clear if they were also militants or just suspected of affiliation).
Unidentified assailants clashed with security forces in the Boni area.
The chief of Dogon section of yirma village near Boni was killed at his home by unidentified assailants.
2 army vehicles were hit by an IED near Niala.
2 educational consultants and the driver of a vehicle owned by CAP were wounded by unidentified gunmen in the Gniminama area as it was traveling from Konna to Douentza.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: 2 Malian gendarmes and a civilian were killed and one gendarme went missing during an attack on a joint police/army checkpost in Boulikessi by AQM fighters.
An imam was assassinated by unidentified gunmen in the Missabougou-Balobougou neighbourhood of Bamako.
The mayor of Konna says that 2 youths were mistaken for militants and killed by gendarmerie in the area.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: AQM claimed grad rocket attacks against a joint Barkhane-MINUSMA base in Amachach.
2 youths suspected of a robbery were lynched by a mob in Gao. One was killed while the other was injured.
2 young shepherds were killed in an IED blast in a forest near Mondoro.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A French soldier was killed by gunfire in the Douna area as they searched the area for explosives following a roadside blast earlier in the day. AQM claimed the attack.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A French LAV hit a roadside explosive in area of Douna village, injuring 2. AQM claimed responsibility.
A humanitarian worker and two health workers were abducted and had their vehicle seized by unidentified gunmen in Kadial, between Tenenkou and Mopti.

column6: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
column7: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: One person was killed and 2 injured following an attack on MNLA fighters (members of the CMA) by unidentified assailants in Kidal.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: 7 Dozo hunters (Bambara) were killed and their leader captured during an attack against a Fulani self-defense group's position between Koroguiri and Kiguiri in Tenenkou Cercle. JNIM later claimed responsibility.
A gendarmerie checkpost was attacked and set on fire in San by unidentified gunmen.
Several civilians were injured in Gao when unidentified assailants fired into a crowd.
A person searching for their missing cattle was abducted by suspected Islamist fighters in Diafarabe. He was later found dead.

column8: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (CMA)
column17: 2 MAA fighters (members of the CMA) were killed and at least 6 wounded while some of their vehicles were seized during an attack by an unidentified armed group on their positions in Anefis.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)
column17: A vehicle of the ICRC was hit by gunfire while traveling along the Gao-Gossi road. The driver was wounded.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUSMA-chartered truck was attacked by unidentified gunmen between Gao and Gossi. No casualties reported.

column9: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-); Military Forces of Mali (2013-2020)
column17: Clashes were reported between tripartite forces (French, Burkinabe and Malian) and Islamist militants in the Tin Tehegrin area near the Burkina-Niger border.

column8: CJA: Congress for Justice in Azawad
column17: At least 5 people were killed, including 4 CJA fighters, in an attack by suspected Islamist gunmen on CJA positions in Gargando, west of Goundam.
Multiple airstrikes targeting suspected Islamist militants were reported in the Mondoro/Fhero forest area near Burkina Faso's border by French forces.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM claimed an ambush against a Dozo convoy in Ke-Macina, Segou, killing and wounding several (fatalities coded as 3).

column6: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Unidentified gunmen on a motorcycle targeted MINUSMA forces with gunfire in the Bera area of Gao.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)
column17: A humanitarian worker and their driver were abducted in Diafarabe in Tenenkou circle. They were later released.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM claimed an attack that targeted a Malian gendarmerie post in Tene, Segou.

column7: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Members of the CMA protested over the arrest by French Barkhane forces of some of their fighters and an officer of the MAA. They demanded their release and the return of their weapons.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: JNIM claimed an IED which destroyed two MINUSMA vehicles carrying Chadian peacekeepers in the Taghlit area on the Aguelhok-Tessalit axis on Sunday. 3 people, including 2 peacekeepers and 1 civilian, were severely injured in the attack.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column16: Xinhua; Long War Journal; Menastream; UN (unspecified)
column17: 2 MINUSMA peacekeepers were injured and one civilian seriously injured when their vehicle hit a mine south of Tessalit on Tuesday. A similar attack occurred on Sunday.
