column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: JNIM claimed an attack against an army post in Gourma-Rharous, during which 5 FACA soldiers and 10 militants were killed, and as many as a dozen soldiers were injured. As the militants retreated, MINUSMA forces carried out airstrikes against the militants, which caused most of the casualties against them.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUSMA vehicle was lightly damaged after being struck by an IED this morning in Kidal.
Clashes reported between the Malian army and unknown gunmen aboard motorbikes in Bentia, south of Ansongo.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUSMA vehicle was damaged by an IED followed by gunfire near Kera on the Tenenkou to Ke-Macina axis.
UNHCR vehicle seized by unknown gunmen aboard motorbike in Ansongo.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: JNIM claimed a rocket attack against the MINUSMA camp in Aguelhok. MINUSMA denied any attack had taken place.
A worker of the National Institute for Social Welfare (INPS) was abducted by suspected Islamist militants in Youwarou.
IED attacks were reported against Barkhane vehicles on Apr.24-25 east of Aguelhok.
Unidentified assailants attacked a gendarmerie checkpost 5km from Youwarou in the Mopti region. No casualties reported.
IED attacks were reported against Barkhane vehicles on Apr.24-25 east of Aguelhok.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: 2 soldiers were killed and 1 wounded when their vehicle hit a mine in the Koubaye area near Mopti. JNIM claimed responsibility.

A clash was reported between Malian soldiers and militants in the Ganguel area near Tenenkou. A military statement said that many casualties were reported among the militants (unknown fatalities coded as 10) while no soldiers were injured.
A large blast was reported near the MINUSMA camp in Kidal. It was allegedly an IED which hit a civilian vehicle, causing no injuries.
Suspected Islamist militants attacked a FAMA convoy in the Tassiga area, near Ansongo. The attack was repelled by the soldiers who seized two of the assailants vehicles.

As a follow-up of operation 'Panga', multiple airstrikes (operation 'Bayard') targeting Ansaroul Islam group were reported in the Mondoro/Fhero forest area near Burkina Faso's border by French forces. Twenty jihadists were neutralised.
Clashes were reported between Islamist militants and Malian soldiers near Kadial. No casualties were reported but Malian troops allegedly withdrew to Mopti (no evidence assailants occupied the area).
Unidentified assailants attacked a vehicle belonging to the Social Development Department in Gao, wounding the driver.
2 NGO workers abducted & vehicle seized

Human Rights Watch was given a list of 17 men from the villages of Mougnoukana, Douna, Kobou, Yangassadio, and Guedouware who have been 'disappeared' since their arrest in early May. Several witnesses told Human Rights Watch that they had been arrested on May 2 with seven of the missing men

column17: 'A supply mission for the national armed forces fell into an ambush between Dogofri and Nampala. The initial toll is nine dead and five wounded,' Commerce Minister and government spokesman Abdel Karim Konate said in a statement. AFP reports 10 dead and nine wounded.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A United Nations peacekeeper from Liberia was killed and nine others injured when their camp came under attack. Some six mortar shells or rockets hit the camp at around 13:15 local time. Significant material damages including 2 destroyed housing units.
FAMa vehicle struck by IED/mine at 9km south of Boni on the road leading to Mondoro, no casualties reported.

In August, community leaders gave Human Rights Watch photographs of what they believed to be a common grave about seven kilometers south of Mondoro, containing the remains of at least six of 17 men who went missing following their arrest by soldiers between May 2 and 9.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM jihadists carried out a ""comprehensive attack...from several directions"" targeting Malian forces in Almoustarat area, 140 km north of Gao town.A suicide car-bomb followed by a group of ""commando"" jihadists who purportedly managed to burn down an army base and seize a lot of military equipment and arms.7 soldiers killed, 17 wounded some severely , 2 missing & 3 technicals seized.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM claimed destroying an armored Barkhane vehicle and damaging two others by detonation of landmines west of Tessalit.

Human Rights Watch documented the detention of 114 men by Malian security forces in central Mali between December 2016 and June 2017. The detainees, the vast majority of whom were ethnic Peuhl, were held for their suspected support for Islamist armed groups. On May 8, soldiers detained 10 men, ages 19 to about 50, from several hamlets near Boni. All 10 were severely beaten and told they would be shot or burned alive.

column8: MPSA: Popular Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: Unknown gunmen have abducted MPSA officer Mehdi Ag Abdallah
Elderly man abducted for having organized a small marriage celebration presumably by jihadists in Ali-Samba. He was released on May 19th, safe and sound.
On 15 May 2017, a Ouatagouna armed group clashed with an Islamist militia in Ouattagouna (Ansongo, Gao), with 2 reported dead. This follows an attack on the Mayor's office by the Islamist group.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: 4 wounded and a destroyed ambulance in the mortar/rocket attack that struck the MINUSMA Super Camp.
A truck belonging to construction company SOGEA/SATOM was struck by a mine around 12h in Soumpi, driver lightly wounded.
Heavy clashes raged for hours early this morning between jihadists and the Malian army.

Human Rights Watch interviewed 18 men and four boys, ages 14 to 17, who alleged being mistreated by soldiers after their arrest in May from villages near Mali's border with Burkina Faso. Two months later, nearly all showed visible scarring around the wrists and ankles; the hands of two men were still bandaged, while six had scabs and scars from what appeared to be deep gashes on their wrists. They said their hands were tied for over two days, including during the long journey from central Mali to Bamako. One man had visible scars around his throat, saying it was from 'when I was attached within the pickup for hours on the bumpy road, with a cord around my throat... they only removed it after I passed out.' Ten of these were initially detained in a joint operation involving the Malian army and French forces.
Human Rights Watch also documented the death of a 50-year-old man after he had been severely beaten by Malian soldiers in May. Three witnesses said the man died at the hospital in Sevare.

column17: JNIM claimed damaging a Barkhane vehicle east of Tessalit.

column17: A group of the Red Cross Mali was kidnapped in the Tenenkou circle while on assessment mission. They were released the following day.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)

a young woman accused of having a relationship out of wedlock was kidnapped by armed men on 16 May

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: GATIA was subjected to ambush in Acharaba. At least 1 dead.

Unknown gunmen attacked the village of Monzonga this morning, a shepherd succumbed to his wounds after being shot.
Arrests: Some thirty ""suspected jihadists"" arrested yesterday in Djenne, local official denounce the arrests as arbitrary.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims

Suspected Islamic extremists have wrecked a primary school in central Mali out of hostility to Western-style education. The raiders ""set fire to classrooms and fired shots in the air. They also threatened to attack other schools. Two civilians on the premises were beaten up"".

French Operation Barkhane said Friday that activities carried out by soldiers from Sunday to Thursday in the Serma forest left 20 jihadis ""out of combat."" It said the operation began with airstrikes followed by soldiers on land
Councilman in Moungnoukana assassinated by presumed jihadists on motorbikes.

Youth protest against results of Malian army recruitment process, viewed as unfair and discriminatory

Local Idnane tribal chief abducted by unknown gunmen yesterday near Tabankort
Fighting between Imghad and Idnane in Kidal and Gao: fighting, robberies and abductions reported. Around a dozen severe incidents were reported in the past few days. No details on casualties.
Fighting between Imghad and Idnane in Kidal and Gao: fighting, robberies and abductions reported. Around a dozen severe incidents were reported in the past few days. No details on casualties.
People blocked trucks' access to Gao to ask for the dismissal of the Governor, responsible of hindering the commercial activities on the axis Gao-Niamey.

Unknown gunmen killed a fisherman and wounded another yesterday in Barbon
A demonstration against the constitutional reform was dispersed by police forces. Some wounded were reported

Arrests: Several witnesses from hamlets near Mali's border with Burkina Faso described how, on June 9, Burkinabe soldiers detained about 74 men, ages 20 to 70. The soldiers accused the villagers of supporting the Burkina Faso Islamist armed group Ansaroul Islam, which also has bases in Mali.
Agent for the Water and Forests Dept. killed by unknown gunmen in Attara.
Looting: Stallholders' were harassed by armed men and their vehicles and money were seized.
Police fired tear gas to disperse peaceful protesters in Bamako. Several arrested.

Three days of clashes between Fulani and Dogons in Dioungani: the assassination of a Dogon hunter by a Fulani prompted the reprisal of Dogons against Fulani. Casualty toll in Dioungani continuously rising, a resident speaks of carnage and a number of deaths close to 80, Kisal reports 90.
The gendarmerie in Hombori was attacked by ""unknown gunmen"", 2 hangars burned, materiel seized, gendarmes fled, no loss of lives.

7 Dozos were killed in ambush between Diafarabe and Sampaye, and chief gone missing.

Two other men said that on June 22 or 23, they were beaten and one was burned by soldiers based in the military camp at Diabaly, 140 kilometers from Segou. 'They accused me of being involved with the jihadists,' said one man. 'I was held for three nights. On the final night, they beat me on my back, and kicked me with their boots. I'm not sure how long it lasted - I was beaten until I lost consciousness. The next day, they dripped burning plastic all over my shoulder and back.""
2 individuals shot an employee from an NGO from Luxemburg while he was leaving the mosque.

Malian army and National Guard units based in and around Boni, 220 kilometers from the garrison town of Sevare in Mopti region, were extensively linked to torture. For instance, on June 23, soldiers arrested and tortured three traders - two Malians and one Burkinabe - whom they accused of supporting armed Islamists who had attacked the gendarme post in Boni the previous day
Three strong detonations were heard in North-East Kidal's outskirts.
Clashes between police and Dire youth: 2 wounded.
The marketplace in Infoukaretane, has been attacked last night around 19h.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Suspected Ansar Dine militants attacked members of the National Guard in Djenne (Mopti). The security forces repelled the assailants but one of them was injured.
Platform spokesperson claimed Barkhane soldiers proceeded to disarm Platform's men in Tabankort: combined air and ground strikes were launched after Platform's men opposed French attempts.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column9: Police Forces of Mali (2013-2020) Gendarmerie; Private Security Forces (Mali)
column17: MINUSMA HQ was attacked by unidentified armed men: 5 securicom guards, 1 gendarme, 1 civilian contractor & 6 assailants killed, 1 guard & 6 peacekeepers wounded (2 severely).
A Malian army convoy was attacked a few km from Diabata: 6-8 killed, 4 wounded, 3 vehicles seized.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: MINUSMA camp in Douentza subjected to an attack early this morning. 4 dead (2 assailants, a Malian soldier and a Blue Helmet) and several wounded.
4 people raided a house: 1 civilian died of his wounds.
3 armed men raided Arkodia village killing a man; they asked the community to enforce charia law before leaving the village.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: GATIA elements were attacked while reaching the Tamkoutat market. 8 dead and 3 vehicles burned.
The opposition and its supporters took to the streets of the capital Bamako Saturday in jubilation for the indefinite suspension of the consitutional referendum.
Attack by 4 gunmen aboard motorcycles of the customs post in Ouonkoro, Cercle of Bankass. No casualties.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Herdsman named as Bokary Chory reportedly beheaded in public by jihadists today in Seno Edal south of Boni. Accused of having helped a wounded Malian soldier who escaped the ambush in Bebi, late August last year.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: 9 peacekeepers wounded incl. 4 severely by IED detonation in Taghlit, axis Aguelhok-Tessalit, Kidal Region

column9: Aid Workers (International); UNHCR: United Nations Refugee Agency
column17: Unknown gunmen wounded 2 UNHCR staff members in failed attempt to seize their vehicle between Kabara & Timbuktu
A minibus was hurt by a IED detonation.
Gendarmerie post in Tonka (Goundam) attacked by gunmen on motorbike/s around 2h this morning, telecomms sabotaged, casualties unknown
Sahel Eco (NGO) coordinator found dead after being strangled by unknown assailants at hotel room in Bankass, Mopti, computer stolen
Unconfirmed reports on clashes between the Nigerien army and unknown gunmen 25km south of Infoukaretane
Gendarmerie post in Ouo, Cercle of Bandiagara, Mopti Region attacked by unknown gunmen on motorbikes around 18h, 1 gendarme killed
FAMa checkpoint on the outskirts of Timbuktu on road towards Araouane attacked last night around 21h, 1 dead & at least 1 wounded

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Barkhane forces destroyed two vehicles carrying several JNIM terrorists; others have been captured. MAA rejected allegations of any involvement on the JNIM side.
The bodies of two Dawsahaq kidnapped on August, 25 were found in Tamalat. This execution is probably linked to Fulani-Tuareg tensions.
Exchange of gunfire between unknown gunmen on motorbikes and Malian soldiers in Abaradjou neighbourhood, Timbuktu, the assailants took off

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: MINUSMA vehicle targeted by gunfire this evening in Gossi, 2 dead reported

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: 2 vehicles part of MINUSMA logistics convoy struck by dual-IED, 5km north of Tabankort

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Tense situation these past days in the Macina: clashes between ""jihadists"" & locals in Kouakourou.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed Islamists kidnapped 30 people in Mamba as revenge for the beat up of two Islamists after a quarrel about veil wearing.
NGO ambulance was attacked at 25 km S of Afoud on the Tassiga axis. One wounded.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: MINUSMA vehicle struck by IED 15km from Aguelhok this afternoon, 2 peacekeepers dead and 2 severely wounded reported.
Attempt to seize a FAMa supply vehicle ""foiled"" at Menaka market, one soldier killed one wounded.
The explosion of a vehicle on a IED in the Etambar valley was reported by Kidal inhabitants.

2 ""jihadists"" killed by Barkhane (Tigre helos & mountain commandos/paratroopers) on Sept 8, in N'daki near the BurkinaFaso border. 2 pick-ups, 3 motorbikes, 3 AK-47s, ammunition, IED-manufacturing materiel seized.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: The joint Barkhane/MINUSMA Amachach base in Tessalit subjected to rocket/mortar fire this morning
The village of Kanio was besieged by """"jihadists"""" for days following recent clashes with villagers, supplies scarce.
2 men shot to death a person in Kidal city centre.
Gao's 8th district, airport and the FAMa camp subjected to mortar fire this morning, 2 Malian soldiers lightly wounded
A National Guard vehicle was seized after an exchange of fire. One civilian wounded.
An explosion followed by an exchange of fire was reported by Kidal inhabitants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Clashes between JNIM's Katiba Macina and a National Guard patrol was signalled this evening in Kouakourou, Mopti Region. The patrol was ambushed in a forest 5km from Kouakourou without suffering any casualties.
The siege on Kanio conintues: two civilians killed during the week.
A National Guard pick-up was seized after an exchange of fire: 3 guards dead and several civilians wounded. Malian army in pursuit till 5 km from the city.
2 Platform pick-ups were attacked: 2 dead and 4 men kidnapped on the Platform side.
Hundreds of persons took the street to protest against the FCFA in Cotonou, Dakar and Bamako. The demonstration was dispersed by police.
Looting: Unidentified militants seized 178 cows, and destroyed several fields and water pumps.
2 armed man killed an off duty policeman in the mosquee for the morning prayer.
The siege on Kanio, is still in place: an elderly Malinke was shot dead on his property by Islamist militants.

column8: Military Forces of Mali (2013-2020) Operational Coordination Mechanism
column17: A MOC element was shot down by armed men, possibly as reprisal of Gawa events of 14/09/2017.
CSREF accountant was attacked by armed men and stripped of money, telephone and pc.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Complex attack: seemingly armed assault on MINUSMA positions and and rocket/mortar shooting to camp ""Kandi"" in Kidal this morning. 1 peacekeeper lightly wounded and material damages. Civilian house also damaged/destroyed by mortar/rocket fire. Attack claimed by JNIM on 24/09.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Complex attack: seemingly armed assault on MINUSMA positions and and rocket/mortar shooting to camp ""Kandi"" in Kidal this morning. 1 peacekeeper lightly wounded and material damages. Civilian house also damaged/destroyed by mortar/rocket fire. Attack claimed by JNIM on 24/09.

Malian army convoy ambushed along the axis Menaka-Ansongo, 15km from In-Delimane. Provisional toll: 4 Malian soldiers killed & 3 wounded, 2 FAMa vehicles destroyed; 3 vehicles managed to return to Menaka.
FAMa vehicle struck by IED in the area of Boulkessi near the Burkina Faso border, 2 Malian soldiers wounded.

Finally, Malian army arrived in Kanio, to conduct patrols, but the usual downside a Peul neighborhood in the village subjected to searches, with multiple families stripped of their belongings and maltreated.

column9: Aid Workers (International); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
column17: Looting: ICRC vehicle seized and staff stripped of belongings by presumed armed bandits near Bore, axis Konna-Douentza.
Looting: 2 armed men at NGO agents' homes and robbed them.
Islamist militants abducted village chief of Sare-Kina.
In Menaka an IED/mine exploded in front of the Gendarmerie this morning without causing any victims

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUSMA convoy was subjected to complex attack (IED+ armed assault) in Tabrichat, axis Almoustarat-Tabankort.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: 3 peacekeepers killed and 5 others severely wounded in IED/mine attack on axis Ansongo-Gao.
A MSA checkpoint was attacked by unidentified men: 2 MSA men and 5 assailants killed, several prisoners captured.

Protests against racketeering customs officers & gendarmes turned deadly in Koury: 1 protester shot dead & 2 severely wounded by gendarmes; customs station, gendarmerie, Water & Forest Dept. chief's house burned by the protesters.
President of communal health organization abducted by presumed jihadists in Dioura
Marabout killed and an apprentice abducted by unknown gunmen in Godoware

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Unknown gunmen abducted three individuals and burned down the gendarmerie post in Mourdiah, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.
Malian army post in Imboraghane locality in Gawa area was attacked by armed men.

Property destruction: Reportedly, churches are increasingly targeted by Islamist militias in the centre of Mali. Last week, Dobara's church was stripped of its furnishings that were burnt. Others churches have experienced the same accidents.
A Comanav boat was ambushed on the Niger river by unknown assailants. 5 people were wounded and rescued in Kouakourou.
A FAMa motorcycle was hit by an IED: 2 men dead.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)
column17: Looting: A ICRC agent was robbed by armed men on a pick-up.
""Jidahists"" said to have taken over Kanio, Kouakourou. Half population left with the army, those who stayed provided supplies and complied with their demands.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: MINUSMA convoy targeted by IED detonation in the area of In-Fijaren, near In-Delimane, axis Ansongo-Menaka. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: MINUSMA vehicle reportedly struck an IED near Adar N'Tikilit, axis Menaka-Ansongo. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.
Clashes reported between elements of the MSA and a ""group of bandits"" in the area of Tamalate near the Niger border. No casualties and attackers repelled in Tamalate.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A vehicle of the gendarmerie destroyed by IED/mine explosion, 10km from Saye (Ke-Macina), 2 wounded. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.

Renewed clashes between MSA fighters and unknown gunmen in the area of Takadami on the Niger border. MSA claims to have killed 15 assailants (not verified) amidst clashes in Tankademi, acknowledges 2 dead in own ranks.
Iboghilitane fraction chief assassinated by armed men 20 km from Anderamboukane.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Presumed JNIM militants aboard 2 pickups attacked a MINUSMA position in Kidal attack repelled
Looting: Unknown gunmen raided a nomad camp in Inhinita, Menaka and seized the livestock.
Property destruction: Church burned by unknown gunmen (presumably ""jihadists"") in Dounapen, near Dioungani (Koro).
Unrest in Kidal, as people took to the streets in continued protests against Barkhane
One Water and Forest agent and one civilian killed in Fangasso
Youth throwing stones at Barkhane vehicles patrolling the streets of Kidal
Militants executed an alleged informer in Boudjiguire, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Malian army post attacked in Labbezanga, 1 dead & 6 wounded (2 critical), 1 vehicle + arms seized. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.
Barkhane hit Abdollahi Ag Ess's vehicle, who died, in Tifilalen.
FAMA killed 4 militants who previously had executed an alleged informer in Boudjiguire, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region
Several gunshots were heard by locals close to Eastern checkpoint.
Two individuals killed in clashes with Barkhane in the area of Tadalok, not far from Abeibara. Both individuals killed are from the same family,

On 15 October, presumed ISGS militants raided a camp in the locality of Agawayghaway, about 30km from Menaka, three MSA combatants including a senior commander were killed in the attack, the assailants also seized two vehicles.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Position of Fulani self-defense group attacked in Hombori by presumed GATIA, 2 wounded self-defense. Group targeted was established by former Ganda Izo commander Abderrahmane Cisse earlier this year.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Locals signalled that a Malian army patrol was ambushed by Macina fighters in the Kouakourou forest, 4 reported killed. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.
4 individuals arrested by the Malian army in Boulkessi last Saturday were found to have been executed & buried yesterday by herders.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Gendarmerie commander in Guire (Cercle of Nara) abducted and his driver found dead. JNIM claimed the ambush on October, 20th.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: One killed in clashes between CMA and Platform.

Ayorou attackers reportedly subjected to heavy airstrikes by unidentified fighter jet/s (likely FR Mirage 2000). Casualties also reported without further precisions in Amalawlaw, 85km Ayorou and 15km from the Nigerian border.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Gendarmerie post in Dioro Region attacked by unknown gunmen, a vehicle seized. Eventual casualty toll not available. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 26th.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: The village of Ouan (Cercle of Tominian) also under attack, telecomms cut, one gendarme killed two wounded. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 26th.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: 15 ""AnsarDine"" members (part of JNIM) killed and captured amidst Barkhane raid in Abeibara area involving both airstrike and ground forces. JNIM says French raid killed 11 Malian soldiers held captive and the 3 guards. France denyed JNIM claims. JNIM's claim was confirmed by France Embassy and Barkhane on November, 1st.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: IED attack followed by gunfire signalled in Kidal. JNIM claimed damaging a MINUSMA vehicle by IED detonation on October, 26.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: FAMa vehicle struck by IED, axis Tenenkou-Dia, 2 wounded. Incident follows vast military campaign in the area, yesterday FAMa dispatched a contingent numbering +400 men and +70 vehicles to Tenenkou. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 26th.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Malian army post attacked around midnight in Soumpi, two dead, one wounded and 2-3 vehicles seized/destroyed. 15 SATOM trucks burned.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Vehicle of the National Guard struck by IED on the axis Koro-Mondoro, 10km from Dioungani. 2 wounded. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 27th.
Local activists say Barkhane airstrike hit vehicle, killing three militants in Ti-n-Bidene, between Kidal and Abeibara

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: 3 peacekeepers killed & 2 wounded by IED/mine explosion against MINUSMA convoy, axis Aguelhok-Tessalit. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 27th. One peacekeeper died of his wounds on November, 21st

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: In latest MINUSMA briefing, joint MINUSMA/Barkhane base in Tessalit subjected to indirect fire (mortar or rocket) .

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: IED targeting MINUSMA convoy detonated between 2 vehicles in the morning, axis Gao-Anefis. No casualties/damages
FAMa repelled attack on checkpoint by 3 militants on motorbike at 4h in the morning in Ansongo at the exit of the town towards Menaka

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: One of the vehicles sent to rescue an MP was struck by an IED on the way back. 5 soldiers dead.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Tenenkou MP/High Court president Niang was ambushed by JNIM men between Diafarabe & Dia. The driver was killed in the ambush.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (CMA)
column17: MAA military chief Heyba Ould Zeyn abducted by JNIM commando this afternoon at the market in Zouera, Tombouctou Region.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Mali)
column17: Looting: 2 Red Cross vehicles seized and staff robbed by unknown gunmen overnight in Almoustarat, Gao Region

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: CMA post in Inafarag on the Algerian border was attacked by Platform men
Looting: Vehicle belonging to the NGO Premiere Urgence seized by gunmen on motorbikes in Tabango.
Attack on two FAMa checkpoints early this morning in Imboraghane (Bourem) 1 killed and 3 wounded
Attempted carjacking this morning in Timbuktu, driver sustained several stab wounds, here teachers & students parade the assailant
Kidal subjected to mortar/rocket fire (six shells) this morning, still no eventual casualty toll available
DETONATION: Detonation not long ago in Kidal, no further details.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM claimed assault on gendarmerie post in Bla taking control of site and seizing booty.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Combined FAMa units clashed with militants 12km from Kouakourou, the militants escaped and FAMa recovered two weapons left behind

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Convoy of local authorities targeted by mine detonation between Soumpi & Niafunke, 3 FAMa wounded incl. one with amputated leg. One of the three soldiers succumbed to his wounds.
FAMa checkpoint in Gossi attacked around 18h20, provisional toll, 1 dead and at least 2 wounded.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Report on complex attack against a FAMa and MINUSMA convoy between N'Gouma & Bore, Mopti, vehicles on fire. 4 civilians, 2 assliants and 1 soldier dead.
Truck struck by IED 12km from Ansongo, 5 civilians killed and 9 wounded

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A military vehicle hit by a IED. 3 wounded.
Local disturbances in Tessit following the arrest of 6 MNLA fighters amidst the first joint G5Sahel force & Barkhane operation in the tri-state border.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: MINUSMA convoy struck by mine/IED detonation around 13h, axis Boni-Hombori, 2 wounded, medical evacuation to Gao. Claimed by JNIM on November, 15th.
Policeman wounded after armed men seized his vehicle.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Attack against FAMa checkpoint at the southern exit of Ansongo towards Labbezanga. Barkhane intervened with airstrikes, body of one assailant was found in the morning, AT-mine, bag with various materiel, 2 motorbikes, 2 PKMs, 2 mags & ammo belts also recovered
Looting: Three transport vehicles carrying health workers en route to Sevare and Bamako were attacked, 30km from Bambara-Maoude, all stripped of their belongings.

FAMa detected and destroyed an IED planted on a bridge between Djenne and Kouakourou, Mopti. The unit was subjected to gunfire following the triggering of the device but routed the assailants, 1 FAMa wounded, casualties among the assailants unknown.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: The village chief of Kargue (Lowol Gueou) accused of ""collaborating with the Malian army"", was assassinated by presumed ""jihadists"", the locality recently experienced communal violence between Peuls and Dogons.

column7: FPA: Popular Front of Azawad; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation; CPA: Azawad People's Coalition; CJA: Congress for Justice in Azawad; MPSA: Popular Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: Change to armed group: On 11 November, CME (Coordination des Mouvements de l'Entente) was formed to merge FPA, MSA, CPA, CJA and MPSA forces into a unified front calling for the inclusion of all armed groups in the 2015 peace accord. The movement held its first congress between April 28-30 in Tin-Aouker. Decisions were taken for a unified flag and to establish the movement's structure i.e. the political and military office of the coordination and an office for the youth wings of the movements.
A former communal councilor from Djougani named Oumar Barry was murdered in Koro by two men on a motorcycle.
Another attack targeting FAMa checkpoints overnight at the eastern and southern entrance (Menaka & Labbezanga) of Ansongo, assailants routed, no casualties reported.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: JNIM claimed a IED attack against MINUSMA, axis Tabankort-Anefis, on November 14.
The President of the Niono District Court was abducted by unknown gunmen in Niono.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Reports of airstrikes by helos against two ""jihadists"" positions in the area of Nampala.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: FAMa patrol ambushed near Dioungani, Mopti, 5 wounded soldiers, casualties unknown in the ranks of the presumed militants. Claimed by JNIM on November, 24: 8 killed 2 vehicles destroyed and 1 burned, FAMa said 5 wounded.
Guide of FAMa's anti-poaching brigade assassinated at his home in Hombori.

People gathered to denounce the sale of human beings in Libya. The mobilization began with a sit-in in front of the Libyan Embassy in Bamako. Malians chained themselves to each other in front of the building with faded walls, in front of which was deployed a large cordon of policemen
Forest guard and his guide killed by unknown gunmen at the market in Dah, near Sokoura, Mopti Region
At the market in Garnati, 50km east of Niafunke, gunmen opened fire and killed a retired National Guard.
A trader kidnapped in Atara, 25 km from Niafunke, by armed men.
Unknown gunmen attempted to rob the offices of the NGO IRC in Menaka. Coordinator and guard wounded, FAMa forces stationed in the area routed the assailants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: MINUSMA convoy subjected to a complex ambush involving IEDs and RPGs close to Bambara-Maoude, 1 peacekeeper killed and 3 severely wounded.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Presumed JNIM attack in the area of In-Delimane, axis Ansongo-Menaka against joint MINUSMA & FAMa forces; 1 FAMa killed and 1 wounded, 3 MINUSMA peacekeepers killed and 15 wounded. 2 dead in JNIM's ranks.

""One INGO national staff member was brutally assaulted at the organization's compound in Menaka, Mali. Items were stolen after the attack. The staff member had to be medically evacuated for treatment and then travel outside of the country for additional medical support.""

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Mortar/rocket fire against the MINUSMA bases in Aguelhok and Tessalit

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Mortar/rocket fire against the MINUSMA bases in Aguelhok and Tessalit

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Mortar/rocket fire against the MINUSMA camp in Kidal followed by gunfire this morning.
A group of preachers commemorating the Mawlid were attacked by gunmen near Niono.
The secretary general at the Mayor's office in Dioungani, Cercle of Koro, Region, assassinated at his home this evening in the village of Gourti not far from the Burkina Faso border

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: The mayor of the Sougoulbe commune was kidnapped by jihadists due to a pending debt. It is unclear if the event occurred in Sougoulbe's main village, Kora.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Two MINUSMA agents aboard a hilux vehicle were pointed at Bavaria. One of them was shot in the head and succumbed to his hospital injury. The attackers fled. The vehicle was damaged.
One civilian dead and one wounded following the passage of a truck on a mine in Wailalam about 04 km southwest of Adielhoc.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: 5 civilians were executed today near Niono by Fulani jihadists. They were in this area for the installation of optical fiber.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: After an attempted failed kidnapping of the Nara prefect, the escort elements retaliated by fending off the attackers. Provisional balance sheet: Three FAMA soldiers wounded. Claimed by JNIM on 26/12.
A notable of the Imghad community was killed in this area on 10/12.

A joint cross-border military operation took place from 3 to 20 December on both sides of the Malo-Mauritanian border in the Ouagadou Forest. A detachment of Barkhane was involved alongside the Malian armed forces.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM claimed the attack against a vehicle on December 10 in the area of Douekire, Tombouctou Region, carrying civilian merchants, and four CJA members including the Farach post chief Abou Ag Oubeidata, the attack left seven dead, two gone missing and three wounded

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: JNIM claimed an IED attack against a FAMa and MINUSMA convoy on December 12 on the road linking Douentza and Dala, saying the IED detonation destroyed a vehicle, killing and wounding the occupant.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM/Al-Murabitoun commander Mohamed Ould Nouini/""Hassan al-Ansari"" survived a Barkhane/Sabre operation in the Tilemsi valley, while an Algerian named Zakaria El-Staifi was killed and a Tunisian arrested
Malian railway workers decided to organize a sit-in on December 12 in the courtyard of the Dakar-Bamako railway to claim four months of unpaid wages.
Nearly a thousand people demonstrated against US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. Mobilization at the call of the Muslim community of the country.

Violent clashes between security forces and protesters who demanded the resignation of the Mayor in Konsiga, Kayes Region, the security forces resorted to the use of live rounds, many wounded. One dead

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM claimed ambush against FAMa convoy (""#G5Sahel-FC"") between Dofana & Sambani, admits 1 dead in own ranks named Abu Aisha al-Ansari, local observers reported 1 FAMa, 1 civilian killed & several wounded amidst the attack.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Four simultaneous attacks by presumed JNIM/Ansar Dine militants targeted two MINUSMA security posts on the outskirts of Kidal, one security post at camp ""Kandi"" and one against a patrol. Two wounded peacekeepers (one severely) and three civilians lightly amidst exchanges of fire

The group of wives of the military and paramilitary pursued in the so-called ""red berets"" case organized on Saturday in Bamako, a 4km March to protest against the slowness observed in the judgment of the case of the red berets.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Clashes between JNIM/Katiba Macina and the Malian army a few kilometers from Kouakourou, Mopti Region, no casualties, although in connection to the incident were five motorbikes, a cart and a donkey belonging to civilians seized

column9: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
column17: Unknown gunmen shot dead CSMAK officer Baba Ag Adobent (MNLA) around 19h in Kidal

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: An IED detonation struck a MINUSMA armored vehicle around 8h this morning in Kidal, no casualties

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: CMA condemns Barkhane raid earlier today in Tin-Abaw, south of Menaka, and calls for the release of two youths arrested amidst the operation.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM/AQMI kidnapped two marabouts.
Clashes erupted between students from different faculties of the University of Bamako. The toll is one dead and several wounded. Several arrests have been made.
National Guard unit ambushed in Djenne, Mopti Region, one wounded, FAMA says it arrested ""a suspect"".

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: FAMa checkpoint attacked overnight in Niono, Segou, 1 soldier killed, 2 wounded and others gone missing. FAMA says it killed 5 assailants, although the bodies were taken away during the withdrawal of the attackers who also seized a technical

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Clashes between GATIA men and unidentified armed individuals in Ahina locality 100 km East of Gawa. A notable of the Imghad community was killed in this area last 10/12.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A FAMa vehicle was struck by an IED in the area of Boni, Mopti Region. Two FAMa soldiers killed and 5 wounded as per local sources following this morning's IED blast near Bebi.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Exchanges of gunfire between FAMa and jihadists in Koro (ville), Mopti Region, no victims but population terrified

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM claimed a second IED attack on December 28 that destroyed another Malian army armored vehicle of type ACMAT VLRA equipped with a ZPU-2 twin-barreled 14.5mm heavy machine gun between Boni and Boulkessi, Mopti
Four young Tuareg men, accused of being robbers, were killed by local militia (Ganda Izo) at the weekly market in Gabero-Zinda, Gao Region
Gunmen entered the village of Douna, Mopti near the Burkina Faso border and fired shots in the air and also abducted a young Dogon, Kisal reported

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: JNIM targeted a MINUSMA convoy between Douentza & Dansa, no casualties.
A rally was held at the Bamako Memorial Pyramid to denounce domestic violence; 150 people gathered around the Amazons collective to demand measures to protect women

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: An IED detonation targeted a MINUSMA vehicle this morning in Kidal, no casualties or material losses

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Presumed ""ISGS"" militants attacked a GATIA and FAMa position this morning in Anderamboukane, Menaka, two soldiers and three GATIA fighters killed and their arms seized.
14 armed militants aboard motorbikes attempted to rob a truck coming from Menaka in the area of In-Delimane around 13h, FAMa surrounded and arrested the group

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Two MINUSMA checkpoints attacked a few kilometers from Camp Kandi in Kidal, assailants repelled, no casualties

Malian police have dispersed a demonstration of a hundred people against the French military presence Wednesday in Bamako, on the eve of the fifth anniversary of the launch of the intervention of Paris in the country.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: FAMa (National Guard) ambushed around 18h near Djenne, Mopti Region presumably by JNIM/Katiba Macina militants, one guard killed and 6 wounded including 3 severely.

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: One dead, 2 injured and a damaged vehicle after an explosion of an IED against a pickup of the CMA.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Complex ambush (IED + armed assault) against a Malian army convoy near Hombori, Mopti Region, 1 soldier killed and 4 wounded, two vehicles including a tank truck damaged/destroyed. Claimed by JNIM on January, 30.
Unknown gunmen aboard motorbikes abducted a gendarme this morning in Lere, Cercle of Niafunke
Gendarmerie post about 10km from Markala near Ke-Macina, Segou Region attacked around 21h, assailants routed following the arrival of reinforcements
A suicide bomber reportedly attacked a Barkhane patrol in the area of In-Delimane, three French soldiers wounded and vehicle damaged

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: IED/mine blast targeted a MINUSMA convoy in Wadi Egharghar, axis Aguelhok-Tessalit, Kidal Region. Claimed by JNIM on January, 12.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: JNIM claimed rocket barrage against the joint Barkhane/MINUSMA base Amachach, near Tessalit on January 14.
Abdorahmane Ag Alhatab, an over 50-year-old man was killed by the Malian army 2 km away from the town of Boulikassi.
A patrol of the Malian army exchanged fire with people aboard a pick-up not far from the MINUSMA camp.
Gendarmerie post attacked around 19h in Bambara-Maoude, Tombouctou Region, one gendarme wounded.
Baba ould cheikh, major of Tarkint, was kidnapped by armed men.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed JNIM/Katiba Macina militants abducted a man around 20h in the village of Toko, about 7km from Tenenkou, Mopti Region.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: MINUSMA peacekeepers of the Senegalese contingent (RRF) subjected to complex attack (IED + gunfire) in the area of Boni (probably further south), no casualties.
Two heavy explosions south of Serma towards Seno Mango. As of yet cause unclear (IEDs, airstrike..), however, the area has seen troop movements and multiple IED attacks recently.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: An attack against MINUSMA forces was repelled. No further details available.
FAMa checkpoint on the outskirts of Gao attacked around 3h, attack repelled. Motorbike and other objects abandoned by the assailants, no casualties reported.

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Armoured MINUSMA vehicle struck by IED in the Aliou neighborhood of Kidal.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed JNIM/Katiba Macina militants attacked customs officers at the market of Toubakoro around 12h, about 50km from Banamba, Koulikoro Region. One assailant and one customs officer killed and others wounded in the ensuing shootout, a customs vehicle also burned out.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Simultaneous attacks this morning by presumed JNIM/Katiba Macina militants targeting FAMa positions in Gouma-Coura, Segou and Youwarou, Mopti. Seven killed in the ranks of the ""jihadists"" in Youwarou.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Simultaneous attacks this morning by presumed JNIM/Katiba Macina militants targeting FAMa positions in Gouma-Coura, Segou and Youwarou, Mopti, provisional toll is 2 soldiers and 3 assailants killed. Seven killed in the ranks of the jihadists

29 dead following this morning's IED detonation which struck a transport truck between Boni and Bebi (Mopti Region) that carried civilians, mainly Burkinabes travelling from Djibo towards the Boni market.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: FAMa camp attacked in Soumpi, Niafunke, as many as 14 soldiers and 4 assailants killed and around 20 soldiers wounded evacuated to Niafunke. Heavily armed gunmen aboard pickups attacked the camp with heavy weapons including RPGs and HMGs, overran, pillaged and burned the camp, 6 vehicles, light and heavy weapons and ammunition seized.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: National guard camp in Menaka attacked, at least four FAMa killed, others gone missing and vehicles seized by the assailants. The attack was carried out by a suicide bomber equipped with an explosive belt. JNIM claimed the attack and acknowledged two dead in own ranks.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed JNIM/Katiba Macina militants attacked checkpoint (toll booth) in San, Segou Region. No casualties, although several motorbikes seized amidst the attack against toll booth in San, Segou.
Malian army vehicle struck by IED about 10km south of Tarkint on the road towards Bourem, 2 dead and 7 wounded.
Non-violent activity: Unknown gunmen attacked and seized the vehicle of the subprefect around midday between Boni and Douentza.

column8: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (Platform)
column9: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Unknown gunmen attacked MAA & GATIA (Platform) posts in the area of Aghlal, 50km east of Timbuktu, burning their posts.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed Islamists attacked the Inwelane village, 18 km from Talataye. 3 people were killed and two kidnapped. The qadi's house was burnt down.
Clashes between MSA men and unidentified armed men in Intihoufe, 50 km southeast of Talataye. One dead body (possibly belonging to one of the people kidnapped) was found.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Gendarmerie post in Mandiakuy, Segou Region attacked around 20h15 by presumed JNIM/Katiba Macina militants, no casualties recorded.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Unknown gunmen, presumably JNIM militants attacked the gendarmerie in Hombori, the attack was repelled, and no casualties recorded.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Unknown gunmen, presumably JNIM militants shot dead two National guards in Gossi.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: Presumed JNIM militants launched three mortar shells/rockets against the joint MINUSMA and Barkhane base in Amachach near Tessalit, one of the projectiles landed inside the camp perimeter while two exploded outside, no casualties were reported and the extent of the material damages is unknown.

""One national INGO staff member was abducted by a Non-State Armed Group and released two days later after local negotiations took place. The abduction occurred while the staff member was on-route in a vehicle to his destination in the Douentza region.""

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: An IED struck a civilian transport vehicle in Perna carrying merchants and market-goers who left the market in Dera for Konna, Mopti Region. At least seven people were killed including five women and three wounded while others gone missing, indicating an even higher toll with many unaccounted for. The IED was most likely planted by JNIM's Katiba Macina branch intended to target an army convoy that was supposed to travel the route later in the evening.

Local Fulani and Dogon militiamen clashed in the area in Tonou, near Dioungani. Several Fulanis were killed and even more on the Dogon side, although no precise number of fatalities is available. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

Unknown gunmen (possibly Ansaroul Islam members) killed five Dogons in Niangassadiou. Note that localities such as Douna, Tonou, and others recently have seen communal violence between Fulani and Dogons, as well as clashes between Ansaroul Islam members and Dogon militiamen.
The Malian army discovered and dismantled an IED on a road in Goma-Coura axis Diabaly-Nampala.
Unknown gunmen assassinated four individuals from the Dogon community in Aldiambere.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: French forces of Operation Barkhane carried out a multi-pronged operation targeting senior commanders of JNIM's Ansar Dine branch. Airstrikes engaged three targets, followed by helicopter drops and ground operation by commandos between Boughessa and Tin Zaouaten in the far north Kidal Region. The operation resulted in a total of 23 militants killed or captured. Fatalities split between two events. Two individuals killed near Boughessa, more precisely in the Aouhou area were identified as the former mayor of Boughessa and his son-in-law, presumably also others accompanying the former.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: AFP; Maghreb Emergent; RFI; Menastream; Xinhua
column17: French forces of Operation Barkhane carried out a multi-pronged operation targeting senior commanders of JNIM's Ansar Dine branch. Airstrikes engaged three targets, followed by helicopter drops and ground operation by commandos between Boughessa and Tin Zaouaten in the far north Kidal Region. The operation resulted in a total of 23 militants killed or captured. Ten militants are believed to have been killed in the operation in Tin Zaouaten. While several others in a camp between Tin Zaouaten and Boughessa. Fatalities split between two events.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed JNIM militants assassinated an imam in Senegue, commune of Ouroube Doude, Mopti region. An Islamist, who was wounded by friendly fire amidst the attack didn't manage to escape and was lynched by a mob.

column6: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (CMA)
column17: MAA fighters from the ex-rebel coalition CMA clashed with a group of unknown gunmen in the area of Didi, 7km from Ber, no casualties were reported among the fighting parties, but at least two civilians were killed and three others wounded after being caught in the crossfire.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: JNIM damaged an armored MINUSMA vehicle carrying peacekeepers of the Chadian contingent by IED/mine detonation in the Egharghar valley, axis Aguelhok-Tessalit, Kidal Region, also says Barkhane helos intervened and fired randomly.
Unknown gunmen opened fire on a vehicle coming from the market of Labbezanga carrying market-goers, the driver who refused to stop was gunshot wounded.
Property destruction: Unknown gunmen attacked and burned the house of a religious notable in the area of Inwelane in the commune of Anchawadi, east of Gao.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: On February 16, presumed Katiba Salaheddine militants attacked a GATIA patrol in the area of In-Tamede, the attack was repelled with wounded among the assailants and a vehicle and a motorbike destroyed, a GATIA fighter was also wounded.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed JNIM militants abducted the secretary general of the mayor's office in Sossobe, Mopti.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: French Barkhane forces clashed with presumed JNIM militants in the Egharghar valley between Aguelhok and Tessalit. Two explosions and gunfire were reported in the area, although unclear if the explosions were airstrikes or IEDs detonated. Five militants were killed annd vehicles and motorbikes destroyed amidst the battle.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Unknown gunmen attacked a GATIA fighters in Ahina, between Djebock and Tin Aouker, killing an unknown number of GATIA fighters, unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: Unknown gunmen abducted GATIA's post chief in Hombori, accusing him of being behind armed robberies in the area.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: On February 18, French forces carried out airstrikes killing around 10 militants believed to belong to Islamic State in the Greater Sahara, the airstrikes carried out by helicopters of operation Barkhane were conducted in cooperation with militiamen from GATIA and MSA who in ground operation seized technicals, motorbikes and ammunition.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed JNIM militants abducted a civilian in the village of Ourouguel, Mopti

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed JNIM militants abducted an individual they accuse of being an informer for the Malian army in the village of Yere-Yere, Cercle of Youwarou, Mopti Region.

Sultan Ould Bady's Katiba Salah Eddine, previously loosely aligned with JNIM, and group of fighters who defected from JNIM's Katiba Macina pledged allegiance to the Islamic State while joining Islamic State in the Greater Sahara led by Adnan Abu Walid al-Sahrawi.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Presumed JNIM militants ambushed a group of Dogon militiamen in the forest near the village of Bondo, Cercle of Koro near the Burkina Faso border, five Dogon militiamen were killed and three abducted or gone missing.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Unknown gunmen, presumably JNIM militants assassinated a desk sergeant of the gendarmerie at his home in Boni, Mopti Region.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: JNIM militants damaged a Barkhane vehicle by IED/mine detonation in the area of Amechechegh, northwest of Tessalit.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: GATIA and MSA fighters assassinated an individual, described as a local JNIM commander, in Aoughat, west of Talataye, Gao Region.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Malian soldiers repelled an attack by presumed JNIM militants in Tessit, killing two in the process, eight soldiers and a civilian were wounded in the attack.
The corps of one out of two young Arab traders gone missing in Taboye was found, it is believed that both were assassinated by Ganda Izo militiamen.

column6: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (Platform)
column8: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: MAA and GATIA (both Plateforme) clashed in the area of Bourem-Inaly, Tombouctou Region, seven were killed in the clashes.
Malian soldiers executed seven civilians amidst reconnaissance and search operations in the area of Sokolo. The government acknowledged the events, and said that it had opened an investigation.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: BFM; RFI; AFP; Xinhua; Africa News; AP; Local Source; Menastream
column17: A light armored vehicle of Operation Barkhane was struck by an IED in the area of In-Delimane between Menaka and Ansongo, two French soldiers were killed, a senior officer wounded and the vehicle destroyed. JNIM claimed responsibility.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: French Barkhane forces in cooperation with GATIA and MSA militiamen raided an ISGS camp in the area of Inkadagotane, about 60km southwest of Menaka, four militants were arrested, one Nigerien army vehicle recovered and motorbikes, arms and ammunition seized.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A civilian vehicle was struck by an IED in the area of Aguelhok, Kidal Region, one civilian killed and another wounded. The device was most likely planted by JNIM militants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A cart was struck by an IED this morning in the area of Ouroumobdi between Tenenkou and Kareri, Mopti Region, one civilian killed and another wounded. The device was most likely planted by JNIM militants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: A cart was struck by an IED in Kewa, circle of Djenne, Mopti Region, at least one dead and two donkeys wounded.

Weapons Seizure: On February 25, French forces of Operation Barkhane discovered rockets and an artisanal launcher while searching a militant camp in the area south of In-Deliman. On March 1, they discovered an cache with IED-making materiel also south of In-Delimane during a reconnaissance mission. The cache contained detonators, cord, transmitters and receivers.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: Joint MSA and GATIA forces supported by French forces of Operation Barkhane destroyed an ISGS camp and vehicles, killed 10 ISGS militants including a commander, arrested 6 others and also seized arms and ammunition without sustaining any casualties in their own ranks amidst three rounds of clashes during two days in the Mali-Niger border area, towards Banibangou, while on the Malian side of the border.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: Joint MSA and GATIA forces supported by French forces of Operation Barkhane destroyed an ISGS camp and vehicles, killed 10 ISGS militants including a commander, arrested 6 others and also seized arms and ammunition without sustaining any casualties in their own ranks amidst three rounds of clashes during two days in the Mali-Niger border area, towards Banibangou, while on the Malian side of the border.

Agreement: A two day intercommunal dialogue to find solutions to the conflict between Fulani and Dogons took place in Koro, the meeting gathered 150 village chiefs, notables and officials among others from 9 of the cercle's communes. The community leaders eventually agreed to a peace agreement between the two communities.
A Water and Forests department agent was killed with a machete in Douentza, Mopti Region, the assailant seized his weapon before taking off.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Six Malian soldiers were killed by the detonation of an IED in the area of Dioura towards Diabaly on the regional border between Segou and Mopti. JNIM claimed responsibility.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: An armored vehicle of the Swedish MINUSMA contingent was struck by an IED near Soumpi, no casualties were recorde but the vehicle was destroyed. JNIM claimed responsibility.
Youth burned tires and fired shots in the air furious about the death of a national guard shot dead earlier by unknown gunmen.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: A MINUSMA convoy of the Bangladeshi contingent was struck by an IED near the village of Pattouki on the road linking Boni and Douentza, Mopti Region. Four peacekeepers were killed and four others severely wounded. JNIM claimed responsibility.
Unknown gunmen shot dead a national guard in Gao, sparking severe communal tensions between the Songhay and Arab communities in the town.

Unknown gunmen attacked the village of Barisadji near Gao, wounding four villagers. The attack is believed to be a revenge act for the killing of two Arab traders in the neighboring commune of Taboye.

column6: HCUA: High Council for the Unity of Azawad
column17: An MSA officer was killed at the market in Talataye, Gao Region amidst clashes with fighters from the HCUA faction of CMA.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Detonation: On March 4, two IED planters presumably deployed by JNIM, were killed while in the process of laying an IED in Dogofry, Segou Region, another IED was discovered and defused in the same area by EOD-team stationed in Niono.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 4, presumed JNIM militants carried out a complex attack against a Malian army convoy between Konna and Bore, the attack was initiated by detonation of an IED followed by gunfire. Four Malian soldiers were wounded in the attack.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: On 6 March joint forces of Operation Barkhane, GATIA, MSA were subjected to an attack by presumed ISGS militants in the area south of In-Delimane, supported by Tigre and Gazelle helicopters the attack was repelled and three militants were killed.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: Property destruction: On March 7, presumed JNIM militants attacked and destroyed heavy equipment at the almost finished dam project in Djenne, the militants gathered all the workers and demanded that they leave the construction site.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
column17: On 6 March, French forces of Operation Barkhane in cooperation with GATIA and MSA forces raided an ISGS camp in the Menaka region, five ISGS militants were killed, ten arrested, and IEDs, documents and military materiel seized.

On March 8, Fulani gunmen attacked the village of Sabere Darah, between Koro and Dioungani, Mopti. The attacks targeted the Dogon community, at least four individuals were reported to have been killed. Houses, reserves of crops and sheds burned, and boreholes destroyed.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 8, the Malian army conducted a military operation targeting militants in the area of Dialloube, killing ten militants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 8, four Malian soldiers were killed and two others wounded by the detonation of an IED that struck the vehicle they were travelling near Nantaka, axis Mopti-Dialloube, the IED was presumably planted by JNIM militants.
On March 9, Dogon donzos (traditional hunters) attacked and burned the hamlet of Bodewal, near Mbana, one individual was killed in the attack.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
column16: Menastream; Local Source; RFI; Studio Tamani
column17: On 9 March, joint French Barkhane forces, GATIA and MSA raided an ISGS camp located between Taghaterte and Aghazarane Nakhe, southwest of Menaka, killing 15 militants and arresting two others, military materiel was also seized.
On 10 March, Dogon militiamen killed two civilians of the Fulani ethnic group in the bush near Omo camp in Koro.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: On 11-12 March, joint forces of Operation Barkhane, GATIA, MSA and the Malian and Nigerien armies carried out operations against the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara in Mali-Niger borderland. In the wake of the operation MSA announced and provided visuals as proof that they had recovered a vehicle and weapons seized from U.S. Green Berets in an earlier attack by ISGS militants in Tongo Tongo, Niger back in October. Seven militants were killed in the operation, three arrested, and four vehicles, 13 motorbikes, arms including rockets, ammunition and other materiel seized. One militiaman was also killed and three others wounded.
Property destruction: On March 11, Dogon militiamen burned three huts and killed two sheep in the village of Madougou.
On 11 March, Dozo militiamen killed ten civilians of the Fulani ethnic group in the hamlet of Diaou, area of Diafarabe.
On 11 March, Dogon militiamen killed two Fulani men in the area of Douna-pen, near Dioungani.

column7: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group; MSA: Movement for Azawad Salvation
column17: On 11-12 March, joint forces of Operation Barkhane, GATIA, MSA and the Malian and Nigerien armies carried out operations against the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara in Mali-Niger borderland. In the wake of the operation MSA announced and provided visuals as proof that they had recovered a vehicle and weapons seized from U.S. Green Berets in an earlier attack by ISGS militants in Tongo Tongo, Niger back in October. Seven militants were killed in the operation, three arrested, and four vehicles, 13 motorbikes, arms including rockets, ammunition and other materiel seized. One militiaman was also killed and three others wounded.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 12 March, presumed Katiba Macina militants and Dozos clashed between Nouhoun-Bozo and Koa, Cercle of Djenne, Mopti Region not far from Diafarabe, eleven Dozos were killed and others wounded, one militant was also wounded in the clashes.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 14 March, presumed JNIM militants fired two mortar shells that landed on a civilian house and near the MOC camp in Gao, without causing casualties.

On 14 March, residents in Koro, Mopti protested against local officials and their ineptitude to solve the intercommunal crisisbetween Dogons and Fulani in the area, they also accused the prefect of being at the root of the problems.

On 15 March, protesters of the Fulani community manifested in Bamako against the killings of Fulani amidst intercommunal violence in the central region of the country, and against the generalization of the Fulani as Islamist militants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 15 March, presumed Katiba Macina militants assassinated a Dozo militia leader in Nouhoun-Bozo, Djenne, Mopti Region

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 15 March, a cart was struck by an IED about 3km north of Tougere-Coumbe, area of Tenenkou, Mopti Region, one civilian was killed and another severely wounded, the two donkeys that pulled the cart were also killed. The IED was most likely planted by JNIM militants.

On 15 March, unknown gunmen seized a vehicle belonging the NGO Directorate for Social Development and Economic Solidarity of Kidal (DRDSES) in Gao, the driver of the vehicle was gunshot wounded in the leg and rushed to hospital.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column7: Katiba Macina; Fulani Ethnic Militia (Mali); Pastoralists (Mali)
column17: On March 18, Islamist militants and/or Fulani militiamen attacked the village of Sabere and neighboring Yorou, Am, and Poundourou (coded as Sabere at geoprecision 2), killing eight Dogon civilians.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column7: Katiba Macina; Fulani Ethnic Militia (Mali); Pastoralists (Mali)
column17: On March 18, Islamist militants and/or Fulani militiamen attacked the village of Sabere and neighboring Yorou, Am, and Poundourou (coded as Sabere at geoprecision 2), killing eight Dogon civilians.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 18 March, a Malian army patrol clashed with presumed Katiba Macina militants east of Djenne, killing one militant and arresting seven others.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column7: Katiba Macina; Fulani Ethnic Militia (Mali); Pastoralists (Mali)
column17: On March 18, Islamist militants and/or Fulani militiamen attacked the village of Sabere and neighboring Yorou, Am, and Poundourou (coded as Sabere at geoprecision 2), killing eight Dogon civilians. Fatalities spread over four villages.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column7: Katiba Macina; Fulani Ethnic Militia (Mali); Pastoralists (Mali)
column17: On March 18, Islamist militants and/or Fulani militiamen attacked the village of Sabere and neighboring Yorou, Am, and Poundourou (coded as Sabere at geoprecision 2), killing eight Dogon civilians.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 19, presumed Katiba Macina militants attacked the FAMa post in Somadougou, Mopti without causing casualties, although the post was burned
On 19 March, unknown gunmen assassinated a merchant in Ouatagouna.
Defusal: On March 19, engineeering units of the Malian army discovered and defused an IED in the Boni area, axis Douentza-Hombori, while another was found between Hombori and Gossi.

On March 19, three civilians aboard a cart were killed by the explosion of an IED near the village of Niangassadiou, Mopti near the BurkinaFaso border. The IED was presumably planted by Ansaroul Islam militants.

column8: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: Weapons Seizure: On March 20, French forces of Operation Barkhane seized weapons from CMA members in Menaka, following decision by the town's governor prohibiting armed vehicles (technicals) inside the town.

On March 20, presumed Fulani militiamen opened fire on a Malian army patrol in the area of Gourti, between Sabere and Yorou, the patrol responded and killed one of the militiamen and arrested another, two motorbikes, two rifles and portable phones were seized. The camp harboring the militiamen was also destroyed.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 22 March, a vehicle belonging to a Chinese construction company was struck by an IED not far from Diafarabe, one Chinese worker was killed and five Malians wounded.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 22, a Malian army vehicle was struck by an IED in Ndoukala, northeast of Diabaly, Segou Region, two soldiers were wounded. The IED was most likely planted by Katiba Macina militants.
On 22 March, the Malian army arrested six individuals in the village of Dogo, Mopti Region, the corpses of those arrested were found in a mass grave three days later.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column9: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: On March 22, JNIM militants fired rockets against the joint MINUSMA and Barkhane base in Kidal, five French soldiers were wounded in the attack and significant material damages. The attack came ahead of a visit by the Malian Prime Minister Soumeylou Boubeye Maiga.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 22 March, presumed Katiba Macina militants abducted four NGO workers in the area of Dialloube.
On 22 March, youth protesting the mistreatment in detention of a suspected thief, clashed with gendarmes in Gouana on the outskirts of Bamako, several protesters were arrested.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 24 March, presumed Katiba Macina militants attacked the village of Parandala, near Diafarabe. Casualty toll not available.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 24, Barkhane carried out an air landed raid, killing four presumed Ansar Dine militants in the area of Boughessa.
On 24 March, Fulani militiamen killed a civilian near the village of Yorou in Mopti. They accused them of managing cattle stolen by Dozos.
On March 24, unknown gunmen aboard motorbikes abducted a member of of the Ahel Taleb Arab community in Tamkoutat.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 27, a cart carrying villagers from the commune of Kewa was struck by an IED between Nouhoun-Bozo and Parandala, two civilians were killed in the explosion. The IED was most likely planted by JNIM militants of Katiba Macina.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 28, a tractor was struck by an IED between Dia and Diafarabe, two civilians were killed and three others wounded in the explosion. The IED was most likely planted by JNIM militants of Katiba Macina.

column6: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 28, a MINUSMA patrol was attacked by presumed JNIM militants on the route between Boni and Douentza, Mopti Region, the attack was repelled and one assailant killed, an IED was also detected and neutralized.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 28, presumed JNIM militants attacked hotel La Falaise and the BMS Bank in Bandiagara, Mopti Region, one assailant was killed amidst clashes with the national guards, at least one national guard and a civilian were wounded, at least three assailants escaped, the national guard who was wounded later succumbed to his injuries.

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On March 29, French Barkhane forces intercepted a vehicle carrying JNIM militants of AQIMs Sahara Emirate in the area of NBakt Tagrouma, on the axis Timbuktu and Araouane, two militants were killed and another one arrested following exchanges of gunfire. One of the militants was identified as the Moroccan Said Dakdak als known Said al-Maghribi.

column6: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
