column17: On 27 December 2019, suspected JNIM militants burned a transport truck between Parou and Songobia (coded as Parou at geoprecision 2), no casualties reported, although substantial material damages were recorded.

On 28 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the village of Yoro. Three people were killed in two attacks on 28 and 29 of December, respectively in Yoro and Kindi, fatalities split between the events and coded as Yoro (2) and Kindi (1)
On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the village of Anamoila and seized all the livestock, no casualties reported.

On 28 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the village of Kindi. Three people were killed in two attacks on 28 and 29 of December, respectively in Yoro and Kindi, fatalities split between the events and coded as Yoro (2) and Kindi (1)

On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the Dogon village of Materou (coded as Madougou at geoprecision 2). Four villagers and three Fulani gunmen were killed (fatalities split between three events on December 29, 2019, in Bombou (3), Materou (3), Bore (1).

On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the Dogon village Bore. Four villagers and three Fulani gunmen were killed (fatalities split between three events on December 29, 2019 in Bombou (3), Materou (3), Bore (1).
On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the village of Ganida, village self-defense routed the attackers, no casualties reported.
On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the Dogon village of Lema, and killed four people and burned houses and granaries.
On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the Dogon village of Darsalam (coded as Ouenkoro at geoprecision 2), and killed two people and burned houses and granaries.
On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the Dogon village of Mande-Kanda (coded as Ouenkoro at geoprecision 2), and killed five people and burned houses and granaries.

On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked the Dogon village Bombou. Four villagers and three Fulani gunmen were killed (fatalities split between three events on December 29, 2019, in Bombou (3), Materou (3), Bore (1).
On 29 December 2019, suspected Fulani militiamen attacked a vehicle, and killed the driver and a passenger in Bargou, the attackers seized livestock in the village and caused material damages.
On 30 December 2019, students in the Kabala area of Bamako staged a demonstration against poor road security amid recurring traffic accidents.[size=hundred]

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 30 December 2019, suspected JNIM militants attacked the village of Bargou, and killed two civilians and seized livestock.
On 30 December 2019, French forces conducted an air-ground operation in the Mopti Region (coded as Mopti at geoprecision 3), and killed nine suspected Katiba Macina militants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 1 January 2020, suspected JNIM militants assassinated the school director between Yamtao and Solle (coded as Yamtao at geoprecision 2).

column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: On 1 January 2020, a MINUSMA vehicle was struck by an IED in the village of Gougele (coded as Lelehoy at geoprecision 2), two soldiers of the Belgian contingent were wounded. The device was planted by ISGS militants, ISWAP claimed responsibility.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 1 January 2020, Ansaroul Islam (JNIM) and ISGS militants reportedly clashed in Godoware (Douentza, Mopti), two Ansaroul Islam fighters were killed and six wounded.

column7: Military Forces of Mali (2013-2020); Military Forces of Niger (2011-); Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-); G5S: G5 Sahel Force (2017-)
column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
column17: Between 2 and 17 January 2020, French together with Malian, Nigerien, Burkinabe, and the G5Sahel-Force conducted operations in the area of Tessit and killed around fifteen suspected JNIM or ISGS militants and seized or destroyed vehicles, motorbikes, arms, and ammunition.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: Essor; AMAP; aBamako; Mali Actu; Maliweb; Mali Jet; Studio Tamani
column17: On 2 January 2020, presumed Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants attacked the prison in Niono, the Malian army repulsed the attack and killed one militant, three soldiers were wounded.
On 2 January 2020, residents including Dan Na Ambassagou militiamen and women demonstrated in Bandiagara, forcing MINUSMA peacekeepers to leave the area.[size=large]

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 3 January 2020, suspected JNIM militants reportedly attacked the village of Yoro, village self-defense of the Dogon community repelled the attack, no casualties reported.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 3 January 2020, suspected JNIM militants attacked the village of Lembde, and killed one individual.
On 3 January 2020, the Malian army killed a militant of an unnamed armed group and seized a weapon and ammunition in the area Ouenkoro.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 3 January 2020, a car was struck by an IED near Nassole on the border with Burkina Faso, one woman returned traumatized to Solle while three others went missing, no reported casualties, the device was likely planted by JNIM militants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 3 January 2020, suspected JNIM militants attacked the village of Bonkounda (coded as Bi at geoprecision 2), two people wounded and granaries burned.
Overnight between 4-5 January 2020, French forces conducted an operation in cooperation with the Malian army and killed around ten presumed Katiba Serma militants in the area of Serma.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
column17: On 6 January 2020, suspected JNIM or ISGS militants abducted the village chief of Gossi, in Gossi.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 6 January 2020, JNIM militants conducted a complex ambush initiated by the detonation of an IED against a Malian army convoy in the area of Alatona, five soldiers were killed and four wounded, four vehicles destroyed.
On 6 January 2020, suspected Katiba Macina militants attacked the village of Pongono, and killed one member of the village self-defense and wounded a civilian.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 6 January 2020, presumed JNIM militants attacked the gendarmerie in Niafounke. The attack was repelled, no casualties or damages reported.
On 7 January 2020, suspected Katiba Macina militants attacked a communal transport near the Parou bridge, and wounded three civilians severely.
On 7 January 2020, unknown gunmen abducted an elderly herder near Bara (Ansongo).
On 8 January 2020, presumed ISGS militants seized two vehicles from a merchant transporting marketgoers between Gossi and Ouinerden (Gourma-Rharous, Tombouctou).
On 8 January 2020, residents in Koro staged a demonstration demanding improved security and that the Malian army return to Yoro. [size=large]
On 8 January 2020, unknown gunmen killed a Dawsahak notable in Tassirist (Menaka).

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 9 January 2020, Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants clashed with defectors that had joined Islamic State in the Greater Sahara amid disagreements over access to land in Dogo (Youwarou, Mopti). At least two ISGS fighters were killed and eight others taken prisoners. Although JNIM refuted a statement falsely attributed to them about the events, several local sources confirmed that the clashes occurred.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 9 January 2020, JNIM militants ambushed Malian soldiers travelling on the Niger River between Dialloube and Mopti (coded as Dialloube at geoprecision 2). One soldier was killed, four others wounded, and one gone missing.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: On 9 January 2020, JNIM militants fired around fifteen mortars against the joint MINUSMA-Barkhane base Amachach in Tessalit, eighteen Chadian peacekeepers and two civilian personnel were wounded.
On 10 January 2020, French commandos conducted an operation north of Mopti and killed three presumed Katiba Macina militants, including a logistician.
On 10 January 2020, residents in Bamako took to the streets to demonstrate against the French military presence. [size=thousand]

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 11 January 2020, JNIM and ISGS reportedly clashed in In-Abelbel (Gourma-Rharous, Tombouctou). No casualties reported.
On 11 January 2020, presumed Katiba Macina militants attacked a toll booth in Diema, while at least one gendarmerie was present. The militants shot dead two civilian toll booth operators.

On 11 January 2020, suspected Katiba Macina militants attacked the village of Kassa (coded as Docoumbo at georprecision 2). At least five members of the village self-defense were killed, one person gone missing, and three wounded, ten militants were reportedly killed.

column6: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
column17: On 12 January 2020, CMA and Plateforme signed agreements on cessation of hostilities between the two alliances and joint security coordination in Menaka.

On 13 January 2020, suspected Katiba Macina militants attacked the village of Kassa (coded as Docoumbo), women and children had already left the village for Bandiagara, outcome of the attack not reported.

On 13 January 2020, unknown gunmen abducted a group of NGO staff in the village of Debere, the NGO workers were subsequently released, although the perpetrators seized a vehicle, phones and other belongings.
On 13 January 2020, the Malian army reportedly killed ten suspected Katiba Macina militants and arrested three IED planters and seized explosive devices in the area of Sobangouma.

On 13 January 2020, school students and parents in Commune V of Bamako staged a protest march in reaction to the Malian school crisis and the reccuring suspensions of classes due to teachers strikes.[size=thousands]
On 13 January 2020, residents in Gossi staged a demonstration against what they deemed as authorities' inaction amid reccuring kidnappings and livestock thefts.[size=large]
On 13 January 2020, unknown gunmen aboard motorbikes attacked marketgoers between Poundourou and Yorpin, Dan Na Ambassagou militiamen intervened and routed the attackers.
On 13 January 2020, an IED exploded near Gangafani without causing any casualties or damages, the device was likely planted by Katiba Macina militants.

Overnight between 14 and 15 January, French forces conducted an air-supported operation south of Mopti, and reportedly killed thirty presumed Katiba Macina militants, and destroyed twenty motorbikes, and seized communications equipment.

column16: AMAP; Mali Jet; Koutiala Observateur Infos
column17: On 14 January 2020, students in Gao staged a demonstration in solidarity with other students deprived of education and that the teachers strike continued locally in Gao.[size=large]
On 14 January 2020, students in Yangasso staged a protest march, demanding resumption of classes.[size=large]
On 15 January 2020, residents in Yanfolila staged a demonstration in reaction to insecurity in the area, and demanded police stations to be installed.[size=large]
On 16 January 2020, students in Markala demonstrated and demanded the resumption of classes.[size=no report]
On 16 January 2020, students in Segou staged a protest march and demanded the resumption of classes.[size=large]
On 16 January 2020, students in Sanso demonstrated and demanded the resumption of classes.[size=large]

column9: Fulani Ethnic Group (Mali); Tuareg Ethnic Group (Mali); Pastoralists (Mali)
column16: Mali Actu; RFI; Jeunesse Tabital Pulaaku; AMAP; Pinal (Mali); Mali Jet; Studio Tamani
column17: On 16 January 2020, suspected Dan Na Ambassagou militiamen attacked the village of Siba. They killed fourteen villagers from the Fulani and Bellah communities, wounded at least two others, and seized livestock.
On 17 January 2020, unknown gunmen attacked the village of Gan, and killed two people, wounded others, and seized livestock.
On 17 January 2020, students in Bandiagara demonstrated and demanded the resumption of classes.[size=large]
On 17 January 2020, students in Kayes demonstrated and demanded resumption of classes.[size=large]
On 17 January 2020, students and their parents staged a large demonstration in Kayes, demanding the resumption of classes.[size=large]
On 18 January 2020, a truck was struck by an IED (assumed Katiba Macina) near the bridge of Parou, the driver and apprentice escaped the explosion unharmed, although the vehicle was damaged.
On 19 January 2020, French forces conducted a drone strike near Ti Dinbawi (Tidimbawen), and killed five presumed ISGS militants and destroyed three motorbikes.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 19 January 2020, one construction worker was killed and four others wounded by the explosion of an IED while repairing a bridge near the village of Bih, the bridge had earlier been detonated by presumed JNIM militants.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 20 January 2020, presumed JNIM militants attacked a Malian army checkpoint in Ansongo. The soldiers repulsed the attack, killed one militant and seized an AK rifle.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: Mali Actu; AMAP; Studio Tamani; AFP
column17: On 21 January 2020, two Malian soldiers were killed and three others wounded by the explosion of an IED between Dala and Boni (coded as Dala at geoprecision 2). The device was likely planted by JNIM militants.
On 21 January 2020, unknown gunmen attacked the village of Yogoubeneme. Village self-defense responded to the attack, and killed ten assailants. One villager was also killed in the attack.
On 21 January 2020, students in Djenne staged a large demonstration, demanding the resumption of classes amid teachers strikes, and expressed their grievances in front of the prefect. [size=large]

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: Rocket Chat; AMAP; Mali Jet; Xinhua; Mali Actu; AFP
column17: On 22 January 2020, JNIM militants attacked the Malian army base in Dioungani, and killed at least seven soldiers and wounded others, and seized vehicles, arms, ammunition, and other equipment.
On 23 January 2020, Malian forces reportedly killed one civilian in Sevare, Mopti Commune (Mopti).

On 23 January 2020, striking teachers and unionists staged a large demonstration in Bamako in reaction to the government threatening to replace striking teachers with substitutes. The demonstrators demand the application of article 39 that safeguard their work status and ensure increased wages, and that the government engage in dialogue. [size=large]
On 23 January 2020, teachers staged a demonstration in Kayes.[size=no report]

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 23 January 2020, three Malian soldiers were killed by the explosion of an IED in the area of Dangol Bore. JNIM claimed responsibility.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 23 January 2020, one soldier was killed by the explosion of an IED near the village of Boulikessi. JNIM claimed responsibility.
On 23 January 2020, teachers staged a demonstration in Ansongo.[size=no report]
On 23 January 2020, teachers staged a demonstration in Mopti.[size=no report]
On 23 January 2020, teachers staged a demonstration in Yorosso.[size=no report]
On 23 January 2020, teachers staged a demonstration in Segou.[size=no report]
On 23 January 2020, unknown gunmen reportedly attacked the village of Sodon, no outcome of the attack or casualties reported.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: On 23 January 2020, presumed JNIM militants fired rockets or mortars against the joint MINUSMA and Barkhane base in Kidal, no casualties or damages reported.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: AFP; EMA (Mali); Mali Jet; Rocket Chat
column17: On 23 January 2020, two French soldiers were wounded by the explosion of an IED between Timbuktu and Ber (coded as Timbuktu at geoprecision 2). JNIM claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column8: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
column17: On 24 January 2020, three Belgian peacekeepers were wounded by the explosion of an IED five kilometers from the camp in Gao. The device was likely planted by JNIM militants.
On 25 January 2020, suspected Dogon militiamen reportedly killed three members of the Fulani community in the area of Ogossagou.
On 25 January 2020, unknown gunmen attacked the village of Dalla (Diallaye), and killed one individual, wounded two others, and set a vehicle ablaze.

On 26 January 2020, Malian security forces (soldiers or gendarmes) reportedly killed two civilians in Sokolo (Niono, Segou), believed to be reprisals for an attack against the gendarmerie camp in the locality on the same day.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: Twitter; RFI; AMAP; Jeune Afrique; Xinhua; Mali Actu; Kibaru; Studio Tamani; AFP; Reuters
column17: On 26 January 2020, JNIM militants attacked the gendarmerie camp in Sokolo. At least twenty gendarmes and four militants were reportedly killed, at least five gendarmes were also wounded. The militants burned and swiftly took control of the camp, and carted away nine vehicles, arms, and ammunition.

column16: Jeunesse Tabital Pulaaku; UN MINUSMA; Pinal (Mali); Maliweb; Bamada
column17: On 27 January 2020, Malian forces reportedly killed thirteen civilians in Massabougou (Niono, Segou).

On 27 January 2020, ISWAP claimed that its Sahelian branch, ISGS, repulsed an airdrop by French Operation forces in the area of In Araban (Menaka, Gao), and caused injuries in French ranks. The allegedly failed airdrop was reportedly followed by French airstrikes.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 28 January 2020, presumed Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants attacked the Dogon village of Anagadia, and killed one civilian and seized eighty heads of livestock.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 29 January 2020, presumed JNIM militant retook control of the town of Sokolo after Malian forces withdrew, the militants reportedly raised a black banner over the gendarmerie camp, which the militants had overrun three days earlier.
On 29 January 2020, presumed Da Na Ambassagou militiamen reportedly seized livestock in the village of Berdossou.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 29 January 2020, presumed Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants attacked the village of Gourty, and killed two Dan Na Ambassagou militiamen and wounded two others.
On 30 January 2020, Malian forces reportedly killed eight civilians in Diabaly and Marakabassi (Niono, Segou).

column16: AMAP; Kibaru; Essor; Menastream; Studio Tamani
column17: On 30 January 2020, ISGS militants attacked two gendarmerie positions in Sarakala. No casualties reported, although the militants seized two vehicles, eight motorbikes, arms, and ammunition.
On 30 January 2020, presumed ISGS militants made an incursion into the village of Intarkade (coded as Ntillit at geoprecision 2), and killed one civilian and wounded another.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column17: On 30 January 2020, suspected Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants abducted two Dogon farmers near Diankabou, one was subsequently released while the other kept in captivity.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: Facebook; Le Pays Dogon; Koro Kibaru
column17: On 30 January 2020, suspected Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants attacked the village of Bonkouna in Koro (Mopti), and killed four Dogon farmers, burned granaries, and seized livestock.

On 31 January 2020, hundreds of textile workers in Segou staged a demonstration due to a three-day salary decrease imposed on strikers. The demonstrators assaulted the staff chief who was left severely wounded and evacuated to hospital. [size=hundreds]

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: Le Pays Dogon; Koro Kibaru; Mali Jet
column17: On 31 January 2020, presumed Katiba Macina (JNIM) militants attacked vehicles carrying marketgoers between Parou and Songobia (coded as Parou at geoprecision 2), and killed at least five civilians.
Around 2 February 2020, Malian forces killed three civilians in Diabaly (Niono, Segou).

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
column16: AMAP; Le Pays Dogon; Koro Kibaru; Studio Tamani
column17: On 2 February 2020, presumed JNIM or ISGS militants attacked the village of Bana Gakou, and clashed with Dan Na Ambassagou militiamen, the militants reportedly killed four civilians from the Dogon and Mossi community and completely burned the village.

On 3 February 2020, residents including youths and civil society activists began observing a sit-in in Timbuktu in support of the Malian armed forces and in reaction to the prevailing security situation. [size=no report]
On 3 February 2020, Fulani gunmen attacked the village of Diennsagou, and killed three men from the Dogon community.
On 3 February 2020, unknown gunmen shot dead a deputy bank director in the city of Gao.
On 4 February 2020, suspected Fulani gunmen attacked the village of Orokamba and killed one individual [believed to be a member of the Dogon community].
On 4 February 2020, suspected Fulani gunmen attacked the village of Atomenoye (coded as Madougou at geoprecision 2), and killed one individual [believed to be a member of the Dogon community].
On 5 February 2020, presumed ISGS militants made an incursion into the village of Lelehoy, and killed one individual and abducted a herdsman who subsequently was executed.
On 5 February 2020, Dan Na Ambassagou militiamen reportedly killed one member of the Fulani community and wounded another in the village of Binedama.
On 5 February 2020, presumed Dan Na Ambassagou militiamen reportedly killed three presumed Fulani gunmen in the area of Diankoudia (coded as Madougou at geoprecision 2).
On 6 February 2020, presumed ISGS militants made an incursion into the village of Ouatagouna, and killed three people including the village chief and a school director.

column6: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: Whatsapp; Le Pays Dogon; Nord Sud Journal; Journal le Gardien; Mali Jet; AMAP; Essor; aBamako; Kibaru
column17: On 6 February 2020, presumed JNIM militants attacked the military camp in Dinangourou, and wounded at least six Malian soldiers, aircrafts intervened and routed the militants, killing an unspecified number and destroying twenty motorbikes, the website Le Pays Dogon reported that 34 militants were found dead.

On 6 February 2020, the Malian army reportedly arrested more than a hundred people at the market in Konna on suspicion of links to militants groups, twenty people were reportedly summarily executed, a majority of the arrested were members of the Fulani community.

On 6 February 2020, residents and civil society activists staged a large demonstration in Timbuktu against the prevailing security situation. Security forces intervened when demonstrators attempted to occupy the yard of the governorate, resulting in violent clashes. Several demonstrators were wounded and arrested. [size=large]

column8: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
column16: aBamako; AFP; Twitter; Whatsapp; Reuters; AMAP
column17: On 6 February 2020, French forces of Operation Barkhane conducted airstrike targeting JNIM militants between Tin-Djemba and Inagh, near Doro (N'Tillit, Gao), and killed at least fifteen militants.
On 6 February 2020, unknown gunmen abducted an economic operator in the town of Menaka, the abductee was subsequently realeased.
On 6 February 2020, security guard unionists staged a sit-in in Gao in reaction to the dismissal of fifty-six employees from the security company Securicom. [size=no report]
On 7 February 2020, many bank employees staged a demonstration in Bamako in reaction to the murder of a colleague and deputy bank director in Gao. [size=many]
On 7 February 2020, presumed Fulani gunmen attacked the Dogon village of Simerou and killed at least one civilian and reportedly seized six-hundred heads of livestock.

column9: Tuareg Ethnic Group (Mali); Imghad Ethnic Group (Mali); Imouchag Ethnic Group (Mali)
column17: On 7 February 2020, French forces of Operation Barkhane conducted an airstrike, which reportedly struck a funeral cortege in Fatawada, between Adiora and Ouinerden (Gourma-Rharous, Ouinerden). The attack targeted the burial of JNIM militants killed in an airstrike om the previous day. Fourteen civilians of the Tuareg community (mainly from the Imouchag and Imghad tribes) were killed.
On 7 February 2020, French forces of Operation Barkhane conducted airstrikes reportedly killing ten presumed ISGS militants in the Liptako Region (coded as Tessit at geoprecision 2).

On 8 February 2020, the Malian army conducted an operation near Hombori (Douentza, Mopti) and were ambushed by presumed ISGS militants. Two militants were killed and two soldiers wounded. French Operation Barkhane fighter jets intervened and routed the assailants.
On 8 February 2020, presumed ISGS militants killed two members of the Tuareg Imouchag community in the area of Tin-Azir in the Ansongo Cercle (Gao).
On 9 February 2020, Malian forces reportedly killed three civilians in the village of Sabaribougou (Niono, Segou).

On 9 February 2020, ISGS militants attacked a gendarmerie position near Alatona (Niono, Segou), three gendarmes and one militant were killed, and three gendarmes wounded. The militants seized two vehicles.

column8: Military Forces of Mali (2013-2020) Operational Coordination Mechanism
column9: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (Platform)
column17: On 9 February 2020, suspected ISGS militants shot dead MOC officer and MAA (Platform) chief of staff Yoro Ould Daha and one of his guard corps between Djebok and Tamkoutat.

column16: Maliweb; Mali Actu; aBamako; Nord Sud Journal; Mali Jet; AFP
column17: Overnight between 9-10 February 2020, French fighters jets and combat helicopters conducted airstrikes that killed around twenty ISGS militants, including commanders in the area of Nampala.
